We hope your reconsider and decide to stay with us the next time you're in town.   Thank your again for your feedback,  April Stephenson  Embassy Suites Santa Ana 1325 E Dyer Rd, Santa Ana (714) 241-3800

Summary: Good breakfast! The room was horrible though. TV did not work in the bedroom, the floor was wet by the window from rain, carpet was stained, the drawers would not stay closed on the dresser, the furniture was in poor repair.
Manager Response: I'm very sorry for the poor condition of the room during your stay. We strive to provide Hilton standards to all our guests and it's unfortunate when we fall short. I will pass these concerns along to our Head of Housekeeping so that we may avoid these issues for all future guests.   Thank you for your feedback, it's greatly appreciated.   April Stephenson Embassy Suites Santa Ana 1325 E Dyer Rd, Santa Ana (714) 241-3800

Summary: 1st timer here. Mercy‚Äînot good. No WiFi connection. Stand in line for the social hour free drinks for 15 min or more. Noisy. Airport shuttle was a joke; had to wait an hour after calling and being told it would pick me up in 10-15 min. Had to call 3 times. Phone did not work in my room. Appeared to be getting run down. Many issues that hotel mgmt need to work out here. Won‚Äôt come back. Good luck!
Manager Response: I am very sorry for the poor experience you had with us, Randy. As a Hilton Hotel we strive to accommodate our guests to the best of our ability through our service and dedication to make it right. I will be passing this information along to our upper management so that they may address these concerns directly. If you would like to call us to see if we can discuss some form of restitution for the experience I would be more than happy to speak with you personally.  Thank you again for your feedback.  April Stephenson

Summary Heading: Dated place in a great location.
Summary: Phone, Key Card, heating / cooling and TV issues. This hotel is dated to 1990. lobby is nice but the rooms are in serious need of a face lift. We were told the entire building was on a central heating and cooling system and the temp could not be adjusted in the rooms. The fix was to hand out floor fans.
Manager Response: I'm very sorry for the poor experience you had with us. I know when I travel a clean and comfortable room are the minimal expectations I have and the fact that we could not meet those needs for you is unacceptable. I will be passing along these concerns to our staff and management so that we may address them more thoroughly for all future guests.  Thank you again for your feedback.  April Stephenson

Summary Heading: This Embassy Suites was very disappointing
Summary: If this had been my first visit to an Embassy Suites property, it would be my last! I understand this is an older property, however even older Embassy hotels have been upgraded to a higher standard.  Upon check-in, we asked to be upgraded and were given a room at the top floor (10th floor). Very nice, we thought!  The room was tiny, the bathroom was the size of a small walk-in closet, the hooks for hanging robes were broken off and not replaced, the drapes in the bedroom were literally shredded strips of material, the snack basket promised each day never arrived, and there was no ice machine to be found (needed after recent knee surgery).  The bed was comfortable and the shower worked well, thank goodness.  We will never go to this location again!!!  Go to the Irvine Embassy
Manager Response: none

Summary: The heating and air conditioning system doesn't work at all.  It was in the 40s - my room was freezing.  Embassy brought a space heater to my room but when I turned it on, it blew out the electricity.  I had my choice between heat or electricity.  Awful!
Manager Response: I'm very sorry we failed to provide you with the Hilton Hotel experience, Pamela. While it is true that we are an older hotel with a more rudimentary HVAC system that's no excuse for the experience you had and we should have done better to make it right. I will be passing along these concerns to my upper management to try and mitigate the same concerns for all future guests.  Thank you again for your feedback.  April Stephenson

Summary: We are currently on day 4 of a 6 day stay. The list of issues that have come up just gets longer and longer.   1-The room that we were first in has a balcony with a sliding door. It has been raining on and off since the first night. Apparently the door is. It properly sealed. The carpet was soaked from the door to the bed. Along with our belongings that were sitting next to the bed. I don‚Äôt think this is a new problem. Upon further inspection we discovered that the water damage is so bad that the carpet is crumbling and pulling away from the door.   2- House keeping never cleans the rooms. Our bathroom didn‚Äôt have new toilet paper rolls when we arrived which isn‚Äôt normally a problem. The ones that were there were close to gone when we arrived. The first roll ran out the first
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our two-room suites. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary: The hotel is stupid. I was in room 710 and it had a problem where the sliding glass door was broken and rain flooded our things inside our room. The service is garbage as well. The supervisors refused to help us cause we pre paid. We paid for the upgraded suites and could've had a better experience at a motel 6. My sister was sick and barfed all over the sheets (not the hotels fault) and we tried to clean it up and put it in a bag. Housekeeping came in and gave us new sheets, but wouldn't replace them, even though my disabled father asked her to do it cause he couldn't. They wouldn't simply clean our room. We eventually ran out of toilet paper, but were moved to a different room. We asked for the engineer to fix our door, were promised he would show up, and never came. The
Manager Response: We are sorry we were unable to provide you with the quality of amenities and service you deserved during your recent stay. We apologize for the issues in your room and will work with our maintenance team to ensure this does not happen again. If you return to our area, we hope you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: Nightmare. Upon arriving my mother and I were treated so disgustingly by a young woman whom I did not catch her name. My mother in law who stayed and is a Hilton honors member and military a military member asked for our usual bag with water bottles and was scoffed at and advised that was only for silver and up members. My own mother asked how baggage with vallet worked and the front desk agent rolled her eyes and commented that she did not know and mentioned that was a separate service. This was all very difficult as a family for us to take in considering we had traveled very far and very late that evening. We were very tired and were accompanied by tired children and had expected our usual very warm very accommodating guest service representatives that we usually encounter
Manager Response: We're very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserved during your recent stay with us. Please know that this is not typical of our hotel and staff, and we are sorry we didn‚Äôt meet your expectations during your stay. We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience as your satisfaction is very important to us. We try hard to make sure all of our guests have a rewarding stay. However all of these aren't as bad as staff's misappropriation of my property. I left an item ($200 value) in my nightstand when I checked out. When I realized this I called the hotel, but they said "nothing had been turned into lost and found", and refused to look in the room, saying that housekeeping does a very thorough job of checking the room when someone checks out. Summary: The food service staff, including the breakfast cleaning crew, is GREAT! While they are busy setting up the food each evening, they are prompt at helping people with the restaurant menu selections. The servers will remember you when you return the next evening which makes the experience even better. The food is good with a decent variety. The breakfast area was extremely busy (12/26 - 12/28/2018); however, the cleaning crew was prompt, efficient and gracious. Get there early for the omelette line! The variety of food is great so don't worry if you don't want to wait for an omelette.   By the way, the lobby is like a wind tunnel. It stays rather cold while you're trying to eat, even in the bar area.

There is much more that was wrong but too much for a review. On a good note, the food was good.

Manager Response: none

The hotel also has central air\heat, so only an adjustable fan is available in the rooms.  Under 60 is heat, over 75 is A\C.  As a Midwesterner I was fine with the cool weather and an open window, but some may not care for it. Location was awesome and the staff superb.  Restaurant options and convenience stores nearby as well for those forgotten things.  Gated parking lot with private parking and valet if desired. Price was fair as well.

Stay somewhere else, as you'll leave here feeling like you sat on old and dirty furniture. Worse yet--it was freezing.  One highlight was the breakfast. It was well administered with friendly staff.

Summary: If you stay here, get a room opposite the freeway. Sliding doors do not seal well. Every yahoo with a motorcycle or loud muffler accelerating onto the freeway will wake you up. Staff is friendly and tries hard. Breakfast staff really hustle. Undergoing a much needed rehab, if they swap out the sliding doors for better sound insulation, then it would be a decent place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your past stay with us. We always appreciate hearing from our guests - including areas for improvement. We understand that the noise was an issue during your stay; while we do have additional security and overnight managers available during high traffic periods, we certainly do encourage, for guests comfort and safety, that they contact the front office so we can calm the issue. We apologize that your comfort was interrupted by other guests and I have shared your review with our security team to ensure that this is not a problem in the future. We do hope the next time you return to the area you consider staying with us again.

Summary: So the first room we stayed in had soaking wet floors! They switched us rooms the second room we were in had wires hanging out the ceiling the bath tub was broken water ran all day and night. The breakfast was sucky! They even tried serving tater tots for breakfast. We asked the hotel for toilet paper only gave us one roll. The room was dirty had trash under the table. The chairs in the room were broken. I called and complained and all they did was give us 20,000 in points that‚Äôs not even enough to cover a day in that horrible place! Sooo disappointed!
Manager Response: Thank you for your review of your past stay with us. We always appreciate hearing from our guests ‚Äì including areas for improvement. We apologize that the comfort of your stay was interrupted and we have taken your comments to our team to ensure that in the future we do a better job of making your stay more rewarding. We hope that you will be our guest again The next time you have the opportunity to travel to the area ‚Äì thank you for your review.

Summary: Great location. Near freeway. Clean spacious room and great staff. Food was great and organized. Omelets fantastic. Great coffee. Will come back. Staff catered to all our requests so well and fast. If they said they would do something they did it. Loved the experience
Manager Response: none

Summary: Embassy Suites Is remodeling their hotels.  They are taking out the decor that made the Embassy Suites Special.  We have stayed at two of the remodeled hotels.  The first could not make up its mind if the theme of the decor was Sci-Fi, Space or something else.  The second is just tan.
Manager Response: Dear Mike C,  Thank you for staying with us. We appreciate your honesty as we look for reviews to provide insight into our hotel to better our guest experience. We are sorry that you do not like the new designs and welcome any additional comments or suggestions you would like to share. If you return to our area, we hope you‚Äôll stay with us again.

Summary Heading: Ok property - Parking is a mess
Summary: Stayed here with family this week and the hotel is under renovation/ construction.  My only complaint is the parking arrangements. I paid my $17 a night to self park during my reservation- another add on which I feel is ridiculous, this isn‚Äôt a resort. A Ton of other guests didn‚Äôt and still self parked for free- the gate system isn‚Äôt working so they won‚Äôt know I was told. They have taken all of the close parking and reserved it for Valet and inconvenience guests including myself who are Diamond Members by making self parking around the back of the hotel near the blocked off lobby. I have never seen such a cluster at a property.  They also don‚Äôt have guest laundry facilities available but have an arrangement with the Hampton which is a sister property- another inconvenience.
Manager Response: Dear Eric B,  Thank you for your review of your recent stay. We respect your candor and strive for personalized experiences for each of our guests, actively looking for ways keep costs low and offer enhanced services for comfort and convenience. Your comments are appreciated as they provide feedback needed to re-evaluate guest needs and make the necessary adjustments to our offerings. We hope that given the opportunity, you will consider staying with us again.

Summary: I really liked the newly renovated rooms. Great quality for the price paid. And the breakfast is a real breakfast with real food. Great location too, close to so many great restaurants and shopping areas.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Rescued SIM card from p-trap in sink!!!
Summary: Victor was very kind and helpful in rescuing our SIM card.  His professionalism and friendly attitude made the experience more pleasant than it would have otherwise been.  It was comforting to know there was someone available to help take the sink apart.  Thank you, Victor!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel is clean, rooms are clean, breakfast is great, but parking is a nightmare. You pay  $17.00 a night to park, and your forced to park in back of the hotel with limited parking spaces. They have valet parking and those parking spaces are located in the front by the hotel doors and once those are filled they park in the self park, but yet paying $17.00 a day plus tipping the valet attendant your at $20 plus a day. Especially if you leave the hotel multiple times. The other downside is the ice machine is located outside in a room that has a bad odor, we even tried different floors and the same odor. The last thing is ‚ÄúCHECK your bill‚Äù they over charged me $607.00! I would rate higher but the billing forced me to only give them a 3.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If we could give this a zero we would!  The place is under construction so beware!  Most places that are renovating will tell you in advance. They do not. The rooms are very dirty- we even had melted wax all over the carpet.  The bathroom had a ripped curtain and the floor was not only moldy, but also crumbling. The housekeeping service was not standard for an Embassy. The first day they dis not leave any fresh towels and the bag with our granddaughters toys was missing. The other days we had fresh towels but no shampoo and did not make the couch bed or vacuum.  We are loyal to Embassy suites and this is our first bad experience. We will never return here and strongly recommend others try the other hotels in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel was under construction They were supposed to wait until 9 AM to start construction and started at 7 AM and woke up my family by the hammering and drilling. They didn‚Äôt clean our room. Our shower leaked the entire time. And the waitresss was very rude. Not to mention a man got stuck in the elevator for over two hours and it was a minimum of an hour before fire department showed up
Manager Response: Dear 183tiffanyb,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay with us at our hotel. We really appreciate your comments and are very sorry for the condition of your room and the noise disturbance endured. We will address your comments with our team as we work to improve our guest experience. Your feedback is genuinely appreciated, as it is the first step in helping us improve our services. We hope you will come visit us in the future.

Summary: The hotel website does say that the hotel is under construction, but if you use a 3rd party booking site that information is not listed. So many people are here complaining about the construction. This hotels website only states the lobby is under construction. It does not state anywhere that none of the washing or drying facilities works. Im on a 2 week cross country road trip and have not more than 1 days worth of clean clothes. The hotels solution, only when you point out that they do not report that there are no laundry facilities, is to haul your stuff over to the Hampton and on the day that you want to wash, let the Embassy‚Äôs front desk know to call the Hampton and then go to the Hampton who will give you a key to the laundry. Do you know how inconvenient this is???   The
Manager Response: Dear kferrell1,  We regret that we were not able to provide you with the quality of service and amenities you deserve during your recent stay. We strive for flawless service delivery at our hotel, and we are always looking for ways to ensure that each guest experiences the very best we have to offer. Your feedback will help us to continue to improve our training processes and notifications for guests, and we hope you will return to stay with us to experience the results of that work for yourself.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites- Average room- Great Staff
Summary: While this Embassy Suites was in a great location for us to attend a family wedding at Newport Beach without killing our budget, it was not the cheapest hotel in the area.  However, the recently renovated rooms were less than great.  It was clear that the contractor used for the renovations cut corners to update it well. It was sloppy work in the bathroom especially and they did not update the doors or the tub space to the walk-in showers we have seen in the other ES hotels.  They were still in renovation stages with the lobby and some other spaces which is understandable and was not annoying.   I can say with all honesty that the staff there are extremely friendly and sweet.  The breakfast staff always had sweet smiles and were ready to help if you needed it.  Check-in was a
Manager Response: Dear TripAdvisor Member,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our suites. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.

Summary Heading: Vacation near airport - Santa Ana, Ca
Summary: Hotel is average, location is good, near John Wayne Airport, Santa Ana.  Fees $17 for parking.  Hotel is currently under construction.  Avoid the corner room on upper floor as people will use the open stair area for smoke, and look into your room as they stand to enjoy the smoke and the view.  No privacy.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Unsure what happened to this location but it is not good
Summary: I understand this place is under renovation but the housekeeping is not good. We had to continually ask to get our room cleaned and then only two out of three beds were made. Why?  The sheets were left with sand in them and then no toilet paper. UNACCEPTABLE.
Manager Response: none

Summary: DO NOT BOOK HERE!!!!There are no words to explain. I have never seen something so disgusting in my life. First off most Embassy Suites are phenomenal places to stay we have stayed in one a few times usually a safe bet. I had specifically requested a patio room so we could enjoy being out on a patio. Well this patio is beyond words and how could I possibly be told they have never heard this complaint.   When I first saw the hundreds and hundreds of cigarette butts and filthy feminine product out by our patio I thought how could this possibly be overlooked. I called down to the front desk pleased to say they said someone would be right up to me. As long as they take care of it I am happy. Came back to my room later was not taken care of called down again they apologized spoke to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Tired Hotel that is under Construction
Summary: The biggest issue isn't that the hotel is under construction.  It's the lack of upkeep.  The lobby is closed, the restaurant is closed and the guest check-in is a couple banquet tables with a black curtain behind it.  I would have expected them to do a little bit more at the cocktail hour than potato chips, a few veggies and cheese, to make up for all of the construction.  I tried out the fitness center and none of the TVs on the equipment worked and the bicycle was broken.  Two of the elevators were out of service.  The whole place feels like a tired old hotel and I'm not convinced that the remodeling will fix the problems.
Manager Response: none

Summary: love this place. Complimenatry hot breakfast, snacks, and drinks are a plus. The renovation didnt effect us as well.  rooms were really nice and even staff. I liked the pre check in too. The hotel was worth it
Manager Response: none

Summary: Under construction, parking impossible and expensive. If you are handicapped, you probably will not have a place to park, but you get charged for it anyway. Used to be a great hotel. I have stayed there many times and the past several times, the property seems to continue a downward spiral.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The Resort breakfast was a nice incentive and the made to order omelet was an added bonus. Currently the resort is in the middle of some minor upgrades, but it didn't affect my stay at this beautiful resort. If you're a big gym buff than this wouldn't be the place for you. They have a few weights, two treadmills and two ellipticals and that's about it.  Beautiful pool but not very private. The pool is pretty much dead center of the lobby and connected to the gym. Overall I give the hotel a 7.5 out of 10.
Manager Response: Dear ld57resto,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us. We hope to see you return again soon. Safe travels.

Summary: This used to be a premium hotel in Orange County.  They are doing much-needed remodel work, but they should shut it down and finish.  The rooms are dingy, smelly, and old.  The bathroom is smaller than a gas station restroom.  And the parking is $17/day to park in a lot on the other side of the building, after navigating a maze of cones and gates.  Cars were parked all along the fire lane, so good luck getting out in a hurry.  The website should really advise travelers of all of this, and they need to do a much better job of operating during this mess.  We will definitely not be back to this site, probably even after they finish.
Manager Response: Dear Richard D.:   We hope this message finds you well and appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback regarding your stay. Summary Heading: The Hotel was being renovated during my stay
Summary: I with the management would have informed me that the hotel lobby was under construction prior to my stay. I think the the hotel should have focused on redoing the rooms and not the lobby. My room was sub-par and just looked worn out.
Manager Response: Dear gholdburg,  Thank you for staying with us recently. We appreciate your candor as we look for reviews to provide insight into our hotel. We regret that you were unaware of the construction taking place and apologize for any inconveniences encountered. We hope you will stay with us again the next time you‚Äôre in town.

Summary: Easy access to Newport Beach. Very clean and friendly staff. Nice pool and workout room. The hotel is almost done being renovated.  Embassy always have a great free breakfast. The only drawback is parking is a little tight.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Normall great hotel.   Construction made it average or less than average
Summary: This is normally a great hotel.  I expected the same when I reserved it.  However, when I arrived they were under major reconstruction.  The entire lobby was shut down.  The front entrance closed.   The restaurant was trying to operate out of the breakfast nook.  Not good quality at all.   There was occasional noise because of construction, even through they tried to limit the work time to late morning to early evening.  It would have been nice for reduced prices or some kind of notification of the major renovations going on when making reservations.   The entrance was moved to once side and a long walk from the self park, Yet they had valet cars right next to the entrance.  Seemed like the employees could walk to get the valet cars.  And let the guests park close.   Was total
Manager Response: Dear Richard N.:   Thank you for taking the time  to share your feedback and would like to  sincerely apologize for the hassle and the inconvenience that you had experienced due to the ongoing renovation during your stay. Your feedback has been shared and addressed  with our team and will be utilized to further train our staff and to better strategize our renovation as we continually work to improve our products, services and guest experience.    We only wish that you could have experienced a more enjoyable visit.  Should you need any assistance in the future, please feel free to contact me.

Summary: The Breakfast was great as always with Embassy Suites. The lobby & atrium were under construction, but we knew that before we stayed. I guess they will renovate the rooms next. We also stayed in the LA Area El Segundo Embassy Suites, It is nicer, and we have stayed there before.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Better customer service for a few people is needed. Everything else was ok. If you can get over the remodel going on you will be ok. Breakfast was good. Coffee was great. After a long day at Disneyland you just need a good bed
Manager Response: none

Summary: This property was a great fit for our family trip to Disneyland. Not too far from the park, we were able to enjoy a fun filled day. Check in was quick and easy. Staff was very helpful. The only downside of the property is the construction that was going on. I knew ahead of the construction and look forward to staying there once it is complete.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed in room 829, bathroom door seemed like it was there since 1950. Door was cracked with mildew, water from shower leaked when taking shower. Tried to move but the other room was worse. Terrible hotel!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: While I am traveling, I tend stick with Embassy Suites.  It is nice know that once I get back to the hotel, there was a restaurant on site with a bar and in the morning you have an above average hotel breakfast.  This Embassy was no exception.  Staff was helpful and friendly and they have a nice coy pond in the dinning area so I had breakfast most mornings with the coy and a few turtles.  The room was roomy and comfortable.  It was nice to have plenty of space when you are spending 3 weeks there.  Definitely two thumbs up for this Embassy.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not like it use to be.
Summary: My family use to come to this location often years ago and the experience was a lot better. The curtains were ripped and old in the room. Breakfast was ok but the drinks for Happy hour were not so great.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I loved the view of the hotel as it is circular with an open atrium and rooms facing in. The elevators where beautiful to watch as they are open and the indoor pool was great as it was windy when we arrived.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Pros: big rooms and location is close to John Wayne Airport Breakfast. Cons: Old, dusty, dirty, 20 years past its prime.
Summary: Pros: Close to SNA (John Wayne Orange County Airport). Great yummy omelet breakfast with big spread. Rooms are huge. Beds are soft and comfy.  Cons: Super old, way past its prime. Decor is from the early 90's, with silly print fabric couches and old furniture (not old enough to be nice - just outdated). Dusty and dirty desks - mine had glue stuck to the surfaces. Water smelled like rotten eggs/sulphuric coming out of the tap and shower. Got upgraded to a
Manager Response: none

Summary: There is NOT individual climate control -- and in between seasons, neither heat nor AC are on and there is no air circulation in the suite (strike 1). No screen on balcony door so opening it meant bugs.  Suite #1 had a non-working electrical outlet (and lamp) at the desk (strike 2). Suite # 2 light switch by the door didn't work, was missing a floor lamp, and required heaving my body against the door to get it to open (strike 3 and I was out of there).  The staff was fantastic, moving me from suite 1 to suite 2, but they admitted they couldn't do much for the jammed door problem and they acknowledged that the hotel's physical plant was subpar.

Summary: I love this hotel. The front desk and valet are the best. The room is spacious very clean and looked like just renovated. The bedroom had double windows and nice and sunny. The living room could use more lighting. They had a nice evening reception in the bar. The breakfast was great omelets cooked to order and huge buffet. I definitely will go back
Manager Response: none

Summary: Exceptional hotel, very friendly staff dedicated to making sure you enjoy your stay. Rooms are very clean. Even though the hotel was going through some upgrades everything was very clean and well maintained. The fitness center has multiple machines to work out on. The restaurant menu gas a lot to choose from, everything was very good.

Summary: Very nice hotel, front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and breakfast was good. Beds were hard and we could feel the springs which made it difficult to sleep but over all we enjoyed our stay.

Summary: I enjoyed my time at this hotel.  The rooms were like a small apartment.  They were very relaxing and comfortable.  The staff was extremely friendly and they prepared nice breakfasts. I recommend checking this fantastic hotel.

Summary: Might not come back.  The building looks fine on the outside but inside needs more upkeep and maintenance.  The breakfast is good.  Parking costs $17.00 a day but the gate is troublesome as it would not recognize the key card most of the time.

Summary Heading: Great hotel, Good Breakfast, Pay for Parking
Summary: I would give this hotel 5 stars but guests have to pay $17.00 a night for parking.  This is not a downtown area and guest should not pay for self parking.  The rooms are amazing as every one is a suite. Staff is awesome. The breakfast is the best comp breakfast you will find.

Summary: Hotel is located in a great location. Staff was friendly and very helpful. The rooms were spacious and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast was outstanding. Only compaint was the parking gate system seems to be confusing to most. There always seems to be a vehicle "stuck" at gate.

Summary: Came to Anaheim to watch the Giants and Angels play on my 60th Birthday and decided to stay in Santa Ana at Embassy Suites.  Being a Hilton Honors Member, we wanted to check this out.  We have the normal Embassy experience, good Breakfast, nice staff good room.  Only problem I had was the parking.  Very tight space.  You pay 17 to self park or 20 to valet.  You might as well ask for the valet because parking limited, I found.    I must say that they upgraded parking to valet and just charged us for self.  Otherwise nice hotel

Summary Heading: This hotel needs attention, we has a friend staying at the same time and left the hotel because she had mold in her room

Summary: Loved it, excellent customer service. Emaccoulate .....clean, luxerious. Breakfast included. Only downside a parking fee of $17 per night. Do the math 4 nights that's $76 bucks. When it comes to their breakfast, eggs, suasage, bacon, pancakes, fruit, french toast, you named it, about 20 different options to choose from
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Updated rooms, but very old and noisy hotel
Summary: The rooms themselves were spacious and updated. However, there is significant noise from the freeway and we had to wear ear plugs to sleep.  The hotel is quite old and it shows in many of the common areas. We would choose a different hotel next time.

Summary Heading: A rare disappointing stay at a Hilton hotel
Summary: I chose this hotel due to the rate and location. I'm a loyal Hilton member and always stay at a Hilton if possible. There are three main reasons for my low rating of this hotel. 1. The parking lot is small and tight. When it's nearly full it's very hard to navigate and park your car unless you're driving a compact. 2. The door on my bathroom rubbed on the top and bottom and make a horrible noise each time the door was opened or closed. I couldn't believe they'd rent a room with this problem. 3. I called the front desk 3 times during my stay. On 2 of the times the phone just rang and rang. After more than 20 rings I just hung up. Really disappointing stay.

Summary: The hotel is clean and the service is outstanding  The views on the top floors is great and the location is perfect  The breakfast made to order end a wonderful stay  There are also cocktail and food from 5:30 to 7:30
Manager Response: none

Summary: The hotel is very clean with lots of amenities. The staff was really helpful and friendly. Very quiet inside. Lots of parking. The food was great. The drinks cold. Check in was easy and fast. Convenient location.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Don't go if you want your TV to work
Summary: Two of the 3 nights at this hotel I had no cable.   In fact, the whole hotel had no cable!  Not great if you're alone in your room and you want to watch TV.  For the evening reception, whenever I'd come down to try and get a snack the platters were empty.  And, they've been going through a renovation that never seems to end.  The open area looks nice but everything else still looks old and shabby.    When I complained about not having a TV at check out, the hotel clerk looked kind of disinterested and really just wanted me to disappear.  Said he'd give me a few points for my trouble.  I guess I wasn't the first one to complain and he was tired of hearing about this.  What kind of hotel has no TV?  You can even get reception at a Motel 6.  Not up to Embassy Suites standards.  Go

Summary: Hotel needs deep cleaning and improved breakfast.  Room was clean on the surface but obviously had not had a deep cleaning in a long time.  NOT THE MAIDS FAULT.  Breakfast buffet was not well staffed and food ran out and took 30 minutes to replace.  obvious lack of management support.  Smallest wine glass I have ever seen but probably saves money for the reception.

Summary Heading: Spacious and clean rooms but hotel in need of renovation.
Summary: The rooms are spacious and clean indeed but very old. Bathroom is probably about 40 years old and does not work as it should be. Hot cold water mixing, a problem. Bathroom size, according  to fifties standard in other words, much too small. Hardly enough for one person. No decent bread at breakfast. Eat potatoes! Only american coffee and breakfast, no alternative. Friendly and efficient  staff.

Summary Heading: Worst Hilton property I have ever been to
Summary: The room stank and was in serious disrepair. I have stayed at other Embassy suites that were so much nicer. The internet was difficult to connect to and intermittent. Other guests were clearly not happy either, judging from the conversations in the breakfast lines and the guy who interrupted our check-in to threaten an employee. We needed to print something during our stay and it was a crazy ordeal that took about an hour to do what I have done in another Embassy Suites hotel in about 10 minutes. The breakfast situation was out of control, as someone who works in food service, I could hardly believe the way they were handling it.

Summary: What a great hotel and wonderful staff. This is how you should be treated when you arrive for vacation or business. The made to order breakfast and the cocktail reception are a great way to start and end your day. This hotel is an easy drive to the Anaheim convention center or downtown Disney or Newport Beach. Stay here. Only thing that was a little odd is that I couldn‚Äôt control my heat in my room. It was a little chilly at night,but the hotel did provide a portable heater otherwise I would have given it five stars.

Summary Heading: Average, needs a face lift.  Parking is awful.  Very tight to park, little room between cars.  Only one access out.
Summary: Only one access out from the hotel, busy street.  Very tight parking and the parking is high $ per day even for Hilton Honors.  Clean rooms yet their was paint splatters on the floor.  No room temperature thermostat!  Shocked.

Summary: From the day we arrived, to the time we checked out 3 days later, our stay was perfect! Staff was courtesy and friendly, food was tasty, valet parking was great, breakfast spread was awesome, bar and evening reception were entertaining. Overall a wonderful stay!!

Summary: Overall a very nice stay. Friendly staff. Parking is tight, and getting in and out could be difficult. But, I would definitely stay again. Breakfast was very, but can get monotonous after a couple days.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Hotel requires a major remodel and while I'm not sure how old the decor is the rooms are ancient by todays standards. We had no real heat as it had two thermostats and come to find out, the hotel switches between heating and cooling systems depending on the local weather cycles. The rooms were clean but furnishings were motel 6 plain with a closet cabinet at one end of the room. Overall the standard of service met or exceeded Hilton standards but the Hotel needs alot of work.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is a lovely hotel despite that fact there were major works going on when we stayed. The two things it affected was the evening manager's reception had to be held in the bar and breakfast was in a conference room. Summary Heading: No AC at this Motel! Stay Away
Summary: There is no AC at this motel. They told me repeatedly they are working on it, slept in a hot, stuffy room first night. 2nd night was offered to move rooms, but there is no AC in any rooms so why bother. They offered me half off of room, oh how gracious of them. Would much rather have a good nights sleep. Looking back on this site it appears they have had this AC issue for months going back to 2016 at least. management responds that they are updating HVAC. All lies! Website says AC for your comfort. All lies. Bottom line I'm never coming back to this motel. TripAdvisor users you have been warned.
Manager Response: MikeyE2727,  You are right we have had unusual issues with our AC in at one point a third of our rooms, but we figured it out.  Know that we would never want to operate this way and emergency repairs have helped and a Mechanical Engineer were called in to figure out how we went from great AC to none is some rooms.   I understand your lack of trust, but check with me if you would come back and I will make it right.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com.

Summary: There for 3 days with no air-conditioning. Day 2 the engineer comes and tells me he just put in his 2-week notice because he was so frustrated that they don't take care of the place. Their solution was a fan in the window and a one day credit.  All for only $386!  Rather pricey for a Turkish prison.
Manager Response: 1MaxPaul,  We are now fixed.  Glad my team did what they could and gave you a night off.  I saw a movie once where a tourist ended up in a Turkish prison... that one hurt.   I hate hot rooms and am pushing hard.   Good news is I've gotten great support from my team and owner to fix our systems as fast as we can.  Rooms are getting cold ac now.

Hotter then before had to call the front desk and asked to be moved too another room. Since it was so late I had to go check each room to make sure the AC was working before making the switch. Thank you for your time and helping me figure out what caused the breakdown.

Summary Heading: Love Embassy Suites in Santa Ana, CA
Summary: The staff is the friendliest than any other place I have stayed. Love the breakfasts and receptions. The place is beautiful and I was always greeted in a friendly manner by the staff. I highly recommend this hotel if you want to be treated special.
Manager Response: Kathy,  You made my date.  I have a wonderful staff and when they are at there best there is no better.  Thanks for the feedback.  Can't wait to share with the team.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites still has some skeletons in the closet
Summary: Booked this room for my sons basketball tournament in Garden Grove. I am a Hilton honors member so I mainly stay with in the Hilton family. I know Hilton has been doing a lot of renovations with other hotels in their brand  at this time. However, I do not think this Embassy Suites received the memo. I payed for a premium room which includes all the midnight snacks you can ask for, already in the room right? Well upon entering our room for the first time, the snacks were mainly already gone. Therefore we had no snacks. I had asked for extra towels and pillows in advance with my reservation. Upon my arrival, I see they were not in my room. I called down to the front desk, and I get it there is usually 1 person working the front at night, but the lady whom answered wasn't the
Manager Response: ReshaRee,  My apologies for the poor experience you had.   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so we can discuss a resolution.  Clearly we failed you.   Thank you for your in put.   We will address and improve.

Summary: This year, we were thinking of staying at the Embassy Suites until my daughter told us about her visit.  When they got to their room, there was something they couldn't identify in the sink.  She said there was something black on the floor that looked like coffee grinds.  When they opened the refrigerator, the prior guests food was still there. They had to wear shoes because the floor was wet.  The room had an over powering smell of bleach.    One of the young ladies called housekeeping about the issues but no one showed up to resolve the issues.  They did get moved the next day but not due to lack of cleanliness or bleach smell.  It turns out the wet floor was due to the room above them having a water leak.
Manager Response: AlexCammorn,  I would like to follow up regarding how the breakdowns happened.  While I'm glad room move happened it sounds as though the room should have been put out of order.   Challenge is school took all two bedded rooms for 6 students in each room and all girls on one floor, boys on the other.   Should have reacted quickly, but did not.  We will figure out what happened and address.  Please contact me via email at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com if you want to discuss further and discuss your plans to come in the future.   What happened isn't the norm, but clearly we need to see it doesn't happen again.   Thanks for letting me know.

Summary Heading: We usually stay at Embassy Suites, many times a this location.
Summary: This is a great location for those coming into the Newport Beach, or Corona del Mar areas, or, maybe just to stay the night, close to John Wayne Airport, for a flight.  Great morning Breakfast, cooked to order!
Manager Response: Kent,  We do have  a great location and wonderful breakfast!  Glad you had a great time.

Summary Heading: Extremely cold lobby and room suits
Summary: The room was really cold. Had the worse night ever. The lobby and the breakfast area is really cold also. You couldn't change the thermostat in the room because it has to be certain degrees outside for the heater to turn on.
Manager Response: Salvadora400,  My apologies.   We are addressing our HVAC system, but for now it is a challenge since the outside temperature means we are in AC mode though you wanted heat in your room.   As for the atrium we are adjusting the public area temp since feedback is it's too cold.  If you have more questions please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  Michael

Summary: Location was really great and they even had secured parking for guest. The only issue I experienced was with the heating and cooling system. The first rook I was booked into was very hot and humid and the cooling was not working. The next room was better in consideration of the temperature, but you cannot actually set a temperature point. This made it difficult to get the room comfortable throughout the day and night. Other than that the staff and accommodations were great and the hotel was clean
Manager Response: F Mike B,  Glad you found our team to be friendly and helpful.    I will share your comments with housekeeping regarding how clean the hotel is....   We are addressing our HVAC system to improve it since it is an issue several months a year in the winter/spring.  Thank goodness most of the year it's warm in Southern California and everyone wants AC.  Regards,  Michael

Summary: Now that we are back home, I want to take a moment to share my thoughts and concerns.   1st upon our arrival, the gentleman who checked us in spoke so fast that it was difficult to understand him. When he asked if we drove, we answered yes. He said something in regards to self parking so incredibly fast that it sounded as if what he said was one extremely long word. I found out when we received our bill that what he actually said without annunciation was "there is a seventeen dollar per day parking premium" oh my, are you guys serious to charge this kind of money to park in a parking lot with spaces so narrow and small it is barely fit for a small car. Getting out of the stall is a bit of a challenge. Anyways...we won't be driving back again.   Breakfast on Friday morning was
Manager Response: Paul C,  I could not agree more with the points you make and I thank you for your feedback.  My apologies.   Please contact me at your convenience so we can discuss how best to make your poor experience better.    My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com.   I will in the mean time discuss your experience and address what we can to improve.  One area that won't change is our parking situation.   We added gates and parking fees two years ago and this change has helped our overall parking lot conditions significantly.  All the full service hotels in the Orange County Airport charge, most more than us.   We also refer to the fees on all our sites and protocol when making a reservation with Hilton is to send a confirmation with all the fees and taxes.  Unfortunately some third party booking engines are less clear though we have informed them all.  I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: Close to John Wayne airport but absolutely no airport noise. Fantastic breakfast with great selection of food types including fruit, nuts, seeds and yogurt.  Great custom omelets.   Very friendly staff.  Secure parking but a little difficult to park as the aisles in the parking lot are a little narrow.  You pay extra for parking but if you Uber or Lyft, obviously it's not an issue.  if on a budget, Burger King is a block away.  Good desk space, decent internet, good cell phone signal.  Good highway access.
Manager Response: John Mark D,  So glad you had a great stay!

Summary: The hotel was freezing the entire time. I understand the HVAC system but when all the guests are wearing jackets its probably time to turn off the A.C.  Breakfast was great but could use a bit more options instead of pancakes, bacon and sausage maybe something different. Parking fee was ridiculous. Overall the hotel was very clean but needs some maintenance. There are pieces of stucco missing by the hot tub. The coffee table in our room had 1 leg that wasnt even attached. Toilet seat was loose.
Manager Response: 123marciej,  Thank you for your feedback.  My apologies for any inconveniences we caused you.   Clearly the atrium is too cold based on feedback from many guests of late and we are addressing.  Regards,  Michael

Summary: Stayed here many many times in the past. However this stay was a disgusting filthy mess. Checked in our room only to have the previous guest crumbs still on the bedroom and living floor,  and dried food on microwave. The Keurig was dirty and Corroded  Bathroom toilet did not flush had to remove lid in order to flush.  The pool bathrooms had Feces and Urine in each toilet. And you could see the film and layers of dirt in the pool... It was only 11:00 am?
Manager Response: 268lawandat,  My apologies.  The conditions you describe cannot and will not be tolerated.  Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so we can discuss a resolution if my team has not already done so.  Regards,  Michael

Summary: Dirty pool area, towels not restocked, standing water pools all over walking area; old facility. Fish and turtles were a big hit with the kids. The hotel is in need of a renovation to update it and clean it up.
Manager Response: 81melaniee,  Sorry we did not maintain the pool area correctly during your stay.  We will address.  Regards,  Michael

Summary: Attended a local Tahitian dance competition; location of hotel was very centralized to the competition, local eateries and shopping.  Breakfast staff is one of the friendliest staff you'll ever come across!!!!
Manager Response: Lorraine R,  Got to agree the ladies and Pedro are outstanding.  They work hard and are so friendly.  I will share your praise with the breakfast crew.    Regards,  Michael

Summary Heading: You Get What you Pay For
Summary: This stay reminds me that you get what you pay for.  A nice room with two queen beds, a well done bathroom/shower and an extra room that could have slept a couple more.  Shower could have benefited from temp control that did not fluctuate.  Nice breakfast that I can't complain about when there is an omelette bar (I guess the long line is a minor complaint).  Front desk was efficient and helpful.  Parking was adequate.  The title really says it all and I would recommend this place if you get a rate you can afford.
Manager Response: Dave P,  Glad you and your family had a good stay and you found us to be worth the rate.   We tend to serve 600-800 omellettes on a Saturday or Sunday morning and I'm amazed how fast the cooks make it happen.  Regards,  Michael

Summary: We stayed here with our two little ones for a week while visiting family and the sites in OC. We are from the area, but moved a year ago, and chose this because of its central location to all the major attractions (for small kids) in Orange County.  The hotel staff were all incredible. Kind, helpful, patient and welcoming. The breakfasts were fantastic, and the managers' hours a treat! The kids loved the koi fish, turtles and atrium, as well as the pool. We parents loved having a separate room, so as not to have to go to bed at 8pm. The only "downside" worth mentioning is that this hotel houses a LOT of teams and groups of youth coming into the area- so if you aren't part of that and happen to have little ones who need to sleep- with pre-teens making pre-teen noises, I recommend
Manager Response: Kirsten J,  So glad the parents and "little ones" had a great time!   We do have youth groups and teams some weekends and during spring break for all the same reasons you liked us.  Love hearing how friendly and helpful the staff was.   Makes my day!  Regards,  Michael

Summary: Stayed here last week just as a little getaway for myself and the boyfriend. The rooms have been recently renovated and were very nice with a separate living room and bedroom. Rooms include microwaves and fridges. The bed was very comfortable. We were on the 7th floor and had a small balcony with a nice view. Front desk staff were friendly and knowledgeable. The bellmen (I think his name was Oscar?) was kind enough to take us to a nearby place to get some supplies. Reuben and Roberto at the bar were super friendly and really took care of us. There is an evening reception nightly and cooked-to-order breakfast in the morning. Great hotel!
Manager Response: Honeysunrise,  So gald your boyfriend and yourself had a great stay.   I will share your praise of Reuben, Roberto and Oscar.   I will also share your insight about the front desk staff being friendly and knowledgeable.  Regards,  Michael

Summary Heading: Great Hotel Chain/bad area to stay
Summary: Three adult members of our family spent 3 nites at this location in Santa Ana. 1st nite was fine; 2nd nite we had zero sleep due to LOUD noises from above and LOUD arguing from room beside ours.  THIS IS NOT A GOOD AREA FOR ANYONE WHO DESIRES TOP SECURITY. Hotel management cannot keep riff-raff from entering the hotel via friends who pay; this is a known fact. The noise was not abated via the security being called to both rooms, more than once. They did remove the nonpaying persons from room beside us. Noise from above us continued intermittently after midnight hours. We were offered a room on their 'exclusive quite' top floor for last nite's stay which we took. Top floors are nicer in many ways but even better when they are on opposite side of freeway and road noise!
Manager Response: Sue,  Sorry you had a sleepless night on your second night, but I'm glad the team moved you for the next night and the upgrade to the Premium Floor.   I will follow up with our team and security service.  Normally the second time we go to the room we discuss evection and we will address guests who's behavior is disrespectful.

Summary Heading: Breakfast makes this a great deal for family of 5
Summary: We paid about $150/night to stay here.  There were 5 of us in our family.  If you average that your breakfast if you ate at a restaurant, was $10 per person this makes this room be around $100 bucks a night.  You can't beat that price this in this area.  They had just cleaned the carpets in our room and they were still a little damp but I liked that they had cleaned the carpets.  Bathrooms are small and nothing special, but the rest of the room layout was perfect.
Manager Response: ML428,  Could not say it better myself.   When my family travels and doesn't stay in a Embassy Suites we need two rooms and spend $$$ for breakfast and a few drinks.   We spoil you when we do it right.

Summary: Even though you tell the front desk agents three times how the bill should be charged, they still couldn't get it right. 2 reservations charged to 1 room...never thought this could be complicated.  Still waiting for response telling me "yes we made a mistake, we have initiated a credit for the overcharges."
Manager Response: Michael B,  I understand Ahmed our accounting manager resolved the matter today after discussing it with you last Friday.    My apologies for our inability to get it right the first time.  Please let me know if we can be of further service.

Summary Heading: Worst Night's Sleep at a Hotel
Summary: We stayed here last week for one night for business.  Arrived late and exhausted.  The room was 8th floor facing west and stifling warm and stuffy.  We immediately tried to put the air on and nothing happened.  There was a sign above the thermostat that warns the heat and air runs on an HVAC system that only works when the OUTSIDE temperature is above 70 degrees (for air) or below 55 degrees (for heat).   The outside temp that day had been upper 60's so we were out of luck.  The entire hotel was considered in "neutral" status meaning neither air nor heat would be available.   We cracked the window open to only now be met with considerable highway noise.  Hoping we would manage to sleep but it was impossible.  We tossed and turned all night and sweated.  Not being able to control
Manager Response: TropicalGirl22,  My apologies for sleepless night.   Yes we have had issues in specific rooms of late and our HVAC has meant you and several other rooms had issues.   We tend to stay in cool mode since most guests want AC and Southern California has a annual average temp of 80 degrees.    We are addressing the issues in the rooms in question and are addressing upgrades through a capital plan throughout this year.

Summary Heading: Don't Stay Here on a Hot Day
Summary: ....it was only 75-80 degs. when I stayed.  Checked in on a Tuesday afternoon. Room on 9th floor facing setting sun. Room is HOT. I turned on AC, left it on for an hour. No AC. Called desk, they send up maintenance. He works on it for a bit. Air is now blowing cooler, but not cold. Go to dinner come back, let front desk know about AC not working. They tell me "yes they know". I'm on the sun setting side of the building and maybe I should close my backout curtains. Try to sleep, I'm up at 3am sweating. Go downstairs and tell front desk. He says "I'll put a 'note' on your account". The note does nothing to cool my room. I go back upstairs, opening my outside sliding door wide open, and prop my front door (directly facing the elevators) open with a chair. This cools off the room
Manager Response: 679erichs,  I'm sorry you had a bad stay.  Please contract me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so we can address a resolution.    I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: We love the old world charm and all the perks that this place has to offer.  All the good features outweigh the not-so-good points.  And, if you want everything to be perfect, then you should move on elsewhere and pay a higher rate.  ROOMS:  Not modern but clean and accommodating.  Great feature is that you can close the door between rooms and not listen to your partner's "snoring" all night long. Good lighting in bathroom (although toilet is a bit too low.)  Bed and pillows are very comfortable.  Nightstands have drawers.  There's a large writing desk with good lighting in the bedroom if you have to do paperwork and reports.  Lots of chests, closets and drawers for storage, as well as a huge full-length mirror.  The other room has a hide-a-bed sofa with a large chest of drawers
Manager Response: MKS2010,  Thanks for the great review.    So glad the staff makes your stay so special.   I even got a shout out too.   I will share with everyone.   Hope to see you again soon and thanks for your loyal patronage.

Summary Heading: 1325 E. Dyer Embassy Suites Santa Ana Needs Help
Summary: Was called a liar when I complained about a maid coming into my room without knocking when I was only in my underwear. It was only after hotel maintenance came to scan my electric door lock did the hotel manager realize I was telling the true. No apology was give nor did the honor their "MAKE IT RIGHT" Service Contract.
Manager Response: John G,  We also got your Hilton survey so we have all your details and have addressed service recovery through that channel.   While I was not involved in your most recent stay I was made aware of the incident where a housekeeping supervisor opened your door while you were sitting at the desk looking at your computer.   I would like to better understand who called you a "liar" and will reach out to you.   When we talked I asked for a description and you gave me one I choose not to repeat.    I did say that could be any number of my team and then said we will interrogate the lock to learn who it was and did you want us to do that now or after you check out (you were staying one night).   You told me now.   I apologized and the conversation ended.  I DISAGREE WITH YOUR DIPICTION OF OUR DISCUSSION, I ALWAYS FIGURE WHAT THE GUEST SAYS IS TRUE TO A DEGREE.   If I don't I would then be jaded and best get out of the hospitality business.   Sorry your perception was different from mine, but I will consider how I can be more clear.  You will hear from me privately via your personal email also.   Oh I also asked was your Do Not Disturb Door Hanger missing and mentioned we have both a dead bolt and security latch on all room doors which are great to use.   Though we train our staff to knock and then say "one hippopotamus" to themselves and then open door.   This gives the guest time to answer.   Our supervisor clearing made a mistake and is sorry.   She is a great team member and was going to your room to add one item.   She said she made eye contact and quickly left.   She came to the desk and told the supervisor.     We have addressed service recovery on your Hilton Honors Accounts.   We are always trying to be better and catch

Summary Heading: Spring Break Disneyland Trip with Family
Summary: Embassy suites is my go to hotel for my family.  Suites are spacious and comfortable.  Can't beat their awesome breakfast staff; very friendly.  I would definitely stay here again.  Although I am partial to Embassy Suite North since they have a shuttle to Disneyland Park, which I really missed during this trip.
Manager Response: Elaine E,  So glad we helped you have a great stay.   While we are a 15 to 20 drive to Disney there is no question ES North has that advantage while we are more central to beach, airport and other attractions.   Hope the staff makes up for the difference.

Summary: Nice hotel and staff was helpful and friendly. A/C didn't work as well as I liked but all other aspects were perfect. The gated parking was a plus as well considering the traffic that is around. Breakfast was excellent.
Manager Response: omac03,  Thanks for your fair feedback.   I have a great team and we are addressing the A/C challenges we have found in some rooms.   Got to get that right and we are working fast to do so.

Summary: When my family travels to S. CA, my kids always ask to stay at this location. The rooms are spacious, the location of the hotel is close to the beach, and breakfast and evening food service is awesome. Family friendly.
Manager Response: X5871MFsandrab,  So glad you and your family had a great time while staying with us!

Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites three nights on business. Upon arrival, I checked into the room I had reserved on a higher floor.  As soon as I entered the room, I noticed it was like entering a sauna.  I attempted to lower the temperature using the thermostat, but it was already set as cold as it could be turned.   I called downstairs to the front desk and asked for it to be fixed. They said they would send an engineer up shortly.   I waited and eventually went looking for somebody. I found the engineer, who said he had me on his list.  I explained my issue and he went with me to the room.  After acknowledging how hot it was, he said he would be back to bleed the water line in the HVAC system.  He returned a short time later and proceeded to open up the system. After he was
Manager Response: Jim G,  Last week was quite a challenge and our luck was both myself and my #2 were at a company meeting.  Ingrid is our new Director of Guest Services and she did what I would expect based on her references.   Yes she is new, but worked for years at amazing hotels including the Beverley Hilton.     We are spending more than 5 million to update this wonderful 33 year old hotel.   Rooms and WiFi were done last year and public areas this year.   We also have a significant project to go through all the HVAC system throughout the rooms, banquet areas and public space.   That said generally we do fine when it's warm outside since AC is called for and strong.   Unfortunately we had rooms that were not cool and air got into the coils in your room and others.   Gordon, our Chief Engineer is really good and he is also fairly new (6 months).   Yesterday we got parts we needed (a valve and screw) that replaces the worn out parts in your room to eliminate the re-occurring air in coil system.     Comfort is key to our success and we will get back on track.   Please contact me directly if you would give us another chance and I will do all I can to win you back.  Some of my most loyal guests met me after a service issue.   I hope to hear from you.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary Heading: Once grand hotel suffers from lack of upkeep
Summary: We used this hotel several times twenty years ago when my kids were small and it was magical. The rooms suffer from lack of upkeep. The "sofa bed" is awful. The staff couldn't be nicer. The morning breakfast was welcoming. The public areas fabulous. Nice to have an indoor pool. Clean environment.
Manager Response: Kathy A,  My apologies.   Please send me  a quick email with your name so I can track down the room number you stayed in and address "upkeep" issues including the sofa beds.   We didn't change out the sofa this past year since they are only two years, but we have had to replace a few that are damaged.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  Thanks for your feedback.   We are working to make our hotel magical again in every way.   Glad the staff performed well.

Summary Heading: Good breakfast and snacks at dinner
Summary: Embassy suites on Dyer  Rd in Santa Ana is located very near a freeway. This makes for good location but also for a not so quiet room. Noise from freeway is very disruptive to sleep. The staff was friendly and helpful enough. However, upon checking in we found that the lamp and refrigerator were not working. The faucet dripsin the bathtub and the fan in the bathroom was on ( cannot turn off). The breakfast buffet was excellent. Sports bar is very limited on meal selection. Parking charge/ day was high.
Manager Response: Kittycatmom123,  I'm a dog guy, but cats like me too.   Thanks for your feedback and I'm glad the staff serviced you well.   We pay close attention to our guests feedback and do all we can as fast as we can to make the hotel great.   Please send me your name at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so I can follow up and check the issues in the room, but I would think we have addressed them already.

Summary: This hotel was fantastic.   Each staff member was great from check in, to check out.    I appreciated especially the treats, and drinks that were furnished by staying on the 10th floor.   They were all complimentary.   This is a great touch that I have not seen in a while.   Room service was also awesome.   Thank you!!
Manager Response: Scott A,  Yes the Premium Floor on 10th Floor.  For an additional rate we provide lots of treats and snacks along with beverages and a Keurig Coffee Maker with a selection of hot beverages.   The top floor also has high ceilings, a 50 inch TV in both living room and bedroom and a second bathroom vanity in the bedroom.   Check our website for details.   Glad you liked the offering.

Summary: Overall great experience.  They could turn up the heat a little. Had to wear my sweats to bed. Incredible breakfast. Best I've ever had. Computer room great convenience. Parking was great.  Love the inner atrium.
Manager Response: dennisst3514GO,  Sorry it was too cold.  My apologies.   We are addressing our HVAC system this year and expect it to work better next winter.   Good news is it's Sunny California and hot most of the year so AC is needed.

Summary Heading: Its time to trear down and build new
Summary: Everything is outdated: HVAC, Plumbing, Seals on the Windows and Doors. Loads of noise in every rooms from the street or mechanical at the back side. Over changed for self parking $17.00+ Tax. Have to exit car to use parking meters getting in and out of the parking lot. Staff are great but they don't make up for the over billing and parking money grab.
Manager Response: B72901Hdavidc,  Yes we are 33 years old and the owner is taking on the challenge to work with me to make this the best hotel it can be while at the same time maintaining it's charm.  We are spending millions over 2016 and 2017 to ensure all our guests are happy.   Sorry you didn't enjoy our property.  That said all the full service hotels around Orange County Airport and LAX charge for parking and we will continue to do so.   If that is a deciding factor the limited service properties don't charge for parking, but Embassy Suites, Doubletree, Hilton, Marriott, Westin and Hyatt do.  Our fee is actually on the low side.   We also try to communicate it to all those shopping our hotel.  Please let me know if I can answer any further questions or be of service.

Summary Heading: Great place to relax, great food, couples ambiance!
Summary: Took my hubby here to getaway for his birthday! It was amazing! The buffet was great. Rooms were clean, and the managers reception is always good. For the price, you definitely get alot of value. We checked in late and the manager was so great in assisting us.
Manager Response: tyheshah,  Glad hubby had a great birthday and you both loved your stay and one of the managers.

Summary Heading: Not very good and I'm not going back.
Summary: Stayed here for three nights in March 2017.  First up, be careful about room location.  I was in room 606 and the traffic noise from outside was just stupid all night.  Very disruptive and I wish I'd known.  DEMAND a room that's not facing the highway!  Second, the rooms are a bit tired and the heating/AC is ridiculous.  You won't have control over your environment. The hotel picks AC or heat based on outside temps and you have very little control.   Third, the service at the sports bar sucks.  Out loud.  I've been sitting here for an hour with one drink - bartender never came back to take the order.  They just don't have the staff to handle a Thursday night rush.  And they don't seem to care all that much.;Ridiculous.  When I went to the front de3k to bring the to the attention
Manager Response: Cornmuse,  Thank you for your feedback.   Both the manager you refer to the night you tried to have dinner and the restaurant manager remember your poor experience vividly.   Megan called your room and offered room service on us with no response.   I apologize for the poor service and we did address it with the bartender and two waiters who were on duty.  Shouldn't have happened, but we will work to fix for future.   As for the HVAC capital project is planned for 2017 so we have updated controls in the room to maximize effectiveness.    Luckily we are in Sunny California and 300 days a year we need AC so the system is generally good.   Challenge is when it's cool or cold we run into issues.   Will be better in the future.   I get it though, a new hotel with individual HVAC in each room is the best, but this grand old hotel when we execute right is a wonderful spot.   Not for everybody, but many love the features of our hotel inspite of the short comings.

Summary: As other reviewers have indicated, the hotel is old but the rooms have been renovated.  We were there in February and there was a moisture smell in the rooms.  Nothing terrible but we did keep the sliding door open to help with the odor and cool the room.    However, the nightly cocktails and treats were a welcome snack at the end of the day.  The breakfast was also a nice start to the day.  In general the food was a bit bland but I also understand they are making the food for a wide variety of tastes in a production line setting.    The microwave is somewhat hidden but after a short look, you will find it in the cabinet under the sink.  I found the bed to be very comfortable and the cleaning service did a fine job.  I am not a big fan of paying $17 for parking each night but I
Manager Response: jpohl,  Thanks for the feedback.   We are working through the various needs our 34 year old hotel has and our plans address HVAC, and the water intrusion we experienced this past JAN & FEB from the balconies.  I will share your input with our chef and I'm glad you liked our new Hilton beds.

Summary Heading: Great place to travel with family
Summary: It was the first time, to visit embassy property but it was a great experience, specially our breakfast bar was delicious. In door pool also a plus. Night audit was great, she was very helpful and everyone at the property.
Manager Response: anadT2318RZ,  So glad you had a great stay!   I will share your compliment regarding the staff and especially Emily.

Summary: For a great place to stay in Orange County California, close to all the attractions and away from the main stream hustle and bustle. It is one of the Hotels that has the old world charm and hospitality without the elaborate price you might expect for such an experience.
Manager Response: Jeffrey D,  Our property is a special one given it's 34 year old design and architecture.   We are working hard to innovate while still maintaining the hotel's charm and warm atrium.   Glad you found our staff so hospitable.

Summary Heading: Not a good choice for a winter stay.
Summary: Great location and easy access to freeways. Quiet and clean. The problem is they couldn't get the room temperature right.  It didn't matter how the thermostat was adjusted, the room was freezing. Hotel says it's an old system and needs to be overhauled. Great staff, they tried and understood, but can't recommend this place.
Manager Response: Danrist,  I am in the process of completing the timeline to work through the HVAC system in the hotel to update our system so that by next winter it is completed.   Good news is we only have a few months of winter in the 50's and 60's, but during those nights it is hard for us to please all our guests.   Our average annual temp is 75-80 so we are blessed and tend to need air conditioning which is not an issue.   Please think of us in the future and to all, know we are addressing this for next winter and this year's cold periods are almost over.    Sunny California is our strong suit.    It's a beach day today!

Summary: I generally travel for business about two to three times per month and I always use either Hilton or Marriott hotels.  It's safe to say I'm a bit of a germaphobe and trust both Hilton and Marriott due to my past experiences.  When the company announced a meeting, I was very pleased to learn that it was being held at an Embassy Suites.  I have stayed at a number of Embassy Suites before and assumed this was going to be a similar experience.  Upon my arrival, I contacted the hotel from the airport.  The initial call was pleasant and the attendant indicated our shuttle would arrive in 15-20 minutes.  The shuttle driver arrived on time in a new SUV, which was very clean.  He transported me to the hotel and I got checked in without any issues.  The staff checking me in was very
Manager Response: Adam C,  Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com, though I think we have your Hilton Survey so we are contacting you to address service recovery since your stay was poor.  I apologize for the accommodations and will address any room that is in a condition like your description.  We have had water intrusion in some rooms during this wonderful wet winter, we really need the rain, but found after years of no rain we had some balconies and sliding doors that allowed rain to come in.   All rooms are being addressed and rooms with any issue are (yours should have been) put out of order and should not be rented until up to standard.    I look forward to talking with you and redeeming ourselves.   Hilton has high standards and so do I.   This is being addressed.

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay for a weekend away
Summary: My husband and I packed up the kid and took off for the weekend. We decided to stay at the Embassy Suites Santa Ana OC Airport because it was decently priced, there was free breakfast and also an indoor pool. Our room was huge - we had an executive king suite. It had a pull-out couch and a decent sized living area. The bathroom was tiny. Seriously. Only one person could be in there at a time. Luckily (and also weirdly), there was an extra sink in the bedroom. The size of the bathroom was truly ridiculous when compared to the size of the rest of the suite.   The free breakfast and evening snack reception were great. The snacks were okay (chips, salsa, nachos, hummus, crackers) and it was nice to have an adult beverage. In the morning, the breakfast is pretty good. It's a decent
Manager Response: Pook1222,  Thank you for your feedback.  I apologize for the condition you describe in the pool area during your stay.   I will address with the team right away.   We strive to make sure all is well but it sounds as though we "dropped the ball".   Our pool is a real treat and having it warm and inviting is critically important.   Please expect it to be right in the future.

Summary Heading: Seriously needs to be updated asap
Summary: I have stayed here on business several times and have generally been pleased. However, this property has reached the point where it now is in serious need of reinvestment. I reported issues with my room that went unaddressed. The carpeting in the general areas is worn and dirty and the climate control system is lacking. Hopefully Hilton has plans to put some money back into this property soon.
Manager Response: res1958,  We do and have been addressing rooms throughout 2106 along with continual efforts through out this year.   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com to go into more detail.  My apologies.

Summary: Floor was wet and soggy below the return vent. Warm air being pumped into room from air conditioner caused a bad mildew smell. Room was hot and unbearable. Had to sleep with balcony door open to clear out smell but the noise from the traffic was as bad as the smell. Horrible night sleep.
Manager Response: Bckburn51,  My apologoies for your recent stay during a record setting storm.   Two inches of rain and strong winds meant we had some rooms that experienced water intrusion from the balcony area/ sliding doors.   We have addressed all rooms and a contractor has water proofed all rooms involved and the latest storm (though now as strong) proved the cure has worked.   Please contact me the next time you are coming to the area at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so I can make this experience up to you.

Summary Heading: Annual Sisters Reunion in Santa Ana
Summary: Immaculate. Friendly. Guest-first mentality.  Every year my San Diego based sisters and I (who live in SLO) meet up in a Southland neighborhood.  This year it was Santa Ana. Had an issue at check in and Guest Services Agent Rachel worked hard to correct and make us happy. It worked! Very nice suites on the 6th floor. Ate at the restaurant Sunday evening and Ruben took really good care of our boisterous table. Delicious carnitas! Jenny was very helpful at the nummy morning breakfast buffet. All in all a super fun time with my girls.
