Manager Response: Sandi S,  So have to hear you and your "Sisters" had a great visit and Rachel and Jenny provided special service for you and the group.    I'm a lucky guy to have both of them on my team along with many others who do their best every day to make our guests happy.

Summary: The hotel is old and needs an upgrade to the rooms. The lobby of the hotel is inviting, the attendants out front very cheerful, enter the hotel to a different lukewarm experience.  Food at the restaurant was served fast but limited service staff caused orders to be delayed.
Manager Response: Andrew,  Thank you for your feedback.  We strive to provide a great hotel stay and will continue to use your input and that of others to measure our progresss and we address product and service.

Summary Heading: A bizarre experience that's nowhere near worth the price.
Summary: This is my first time staying at an Embassy Suites and frankly for the price I expected a whole lot more. I was appalled that they charge $17 a night for parking especially since there's not exactly anything else in the area that people would want to take up parking places for. It just seems like an unnecessary surcharge. Then I got to the room and discovered the dinkiest and most poorly designed bathroom I've ever seen in my life. You quite literally can't even lay the bath mat down on the floor without shutting the door and if you do that you can't get out of the bathroom without picking the wet thing back up. If you say the hell with it and just try to leave the door open you literally have to climb over the toilet to get into the shower! I am not at all the kind of person
Manager Response: prbme,  While I can't change the size of the bathroom I would like to interact with you about your stay and the difficulties you had with TV and Internet.  Both issues should not be and I'm sure you under normal functionality are not usually an issue.     We do charge for parking as all the full service hotels do in the radius that serves the OC/ John Wayne airport.   If parking fee and bathroom size is a deal killer I understand, but I hope you contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com to discuss resolution.

Summary: Another example of a great Embassy Suite experience!  The staff was outstanding, warm, friendly and very attentive.  Everyone from the shuttle driver, valet attendant, front desk, restaurant and breakfast staff were outstanding and well trained.  I will highly recommend this location to others.
Manager Response: MichaelaU9639UJ,  So glad you had a great stay and the team performed well.

Summary Heading: A Great Breakfast makes the day
Summary: Rooms are spacious and clean; tho they don't turn on AC year round, so it can get stuffy. If you can stand some freeway noise and open the window, the SoCal air clears it out! Hospitality staff is super; breakfast is amazing.
Manager Response: JenniferoE6458TG,  So glad you enjoyed our staff.  They canbe Super.

Summary: Cheaper option between Orange County Embassy Suites locations, but you get what you pay for.  By far rudest staff of any Embassy Suites i've stayed at.  Pool area not the cleanest.  Breakfast staff need some customer service training.   Room was clean and overall hotel was clean.
Manager Response: 349rubend,  I sorry to hear someone was rude and would like to learn the details to follow up.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com.   My apologies.    Please let me know when we can discuss at your earliest convenience.

Summary: I have been attending this hotel for the last few years. It's been getting better upon each return year over year. Check in was early and easy. The rooms got new furniture, new windows, new tvs and upgraded bathrooms. Even with the upgrades we had troubles with the toilets not flushing, the heat nor working and getting interrupted during meetings for payment method. Overall the experience is good, just hoping for more upgrades in 2018, ha!
Manager Response: Kathryn,   So glad it has gotten better and better.   It's a one of a kind conference and the staff loves having you.

Summary Heading: Family Friendly Hotel w/ Parking Fee
Summary: A consistent family friendly place. - 2 separate rooms, with sleeping sofa in "family room" and your selected 2 Queen ($10-$30 more per day) or 1 King. - Parking Fee is $17 per day, for a non-city location - Great complimentary breakfast of hot buffet, made-to-order omelettes and good variety of other items. -  15 years at this location during Christmas, and it is a madhouse of adults, teens & kids.  Much more civilized during non-Holiday stays. - Location in Orange County is between Newport Beach & the LA Area.
Manager Response: Kin G,  You are right on all points.   Thanks for the review and the loyal patronage.

Summary Heading: Two-Pipe ruins an otherwise great hotel
Summary: We stayed here in late January, 2017 after having a good experience there in September, 2016. We learned this time that the weather is a pretty important factor if you are staying here.  They have what they call a Two-Pipe heating and AC system. This means they control the temperature. There are temperature dials in the room, but a sign above them touts this apparently wonderful Two-Pipe system. In other words, don't bother with dials.  In September, it was still summer and the cooling system was on. But in January, the outside temperature was typically wonderful Southern Californian: warm during the day, cool at night. But for Mr. Two-Pipe, it was officially In-Between being hot and cold. So Two-Pipe stayed off. No heat. No Air Conditioning.  The friendly housekeeping staff
Manager Response: Mike C,  The good news is we have so few dates the weather calls for heat and we have the AC on almost all year.   Out 34 year old hotel is a landmark and generally you are right it isn't  an issue, but we have had some unusual weather this winter and we do struggle with it.  I've got a great team and thank goodness.   Hope you return soon.

Summary Heading: This Hotel is Not up to Hilton Standards
Summary: I had a horrible experience at this hotel and it wasn't just one issue - it was multiple failures.   It began with giving me a room key  for a room that was already occupied.  Once I finally got to my room, it was hot and stuffy, and the hotel system doesn't permit the air to be on when the temperature is below their ranges.  There are no individual thermostats for your own comfort.  You can't control the temperature and it was a miserable 2 nights of sleep.  The room smelled damp and musty.    The toilet didn't flush and I had to go to the lobby to use the bathroom.   There was no no blow dryer in my room, although they did bring one once I called the front desk.  I am quite certain, on future trips that I will not be making a choice to return to this hotel.  Given Hilton's
Manager Response: Karen W,  My apologies for the poor experience you had.   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so I may follow up with you specifically.   I'm sorry we failed you so.   We are generally better than that and we will continue to do all we can to improve and learn from our failures.

Summary: I enjoyed my stay in Embassy Suites.  Thank you Kim and the front staff for helping me throughout my stay.  I called at the hotel to pick me up at Santa Anna airport and I did not have to wait long. It was a great serviceI enjoyed my stay in Embassy Suite.  Thank you Kim and the front staff for helping me throughout my stay.   I called the hotel to pick me up at Santa Ana airport and I did not have to wait long.  It was a great service.  The suite is nice and spacious.  The Wi-Fi worked well.  We stayed on the premium floor the first 6 nights and executive floor one more night (after our weekend in Baboa Bay resort).  Basically the premium floor is on the 10th floor with snack and drinks otherwise the 9th floor where I stayed the last night was as great.  The room was quite cool
Manager Response: Suwanatatnina2,  Sounds like you had a great time.   Glad we contributed to your nice visit.

Summary Heading: Look elsewhere for HHonors property near SNA- try Doubletree
Summary: I'm a HHonors Diamond, stayed for business mid-week.I was not impressed, and likely would look elsewhere unless the rates were a real bargain. The room (and overall hotel) showed some age, and generally there was a musty smell throughout the hotel.  Evening reception was ok...friendly bartender, really cheap well drinks, and nothing special on tap. Snacks were chips, salsa, crudites, and nacho cheese. OK, but really not anything special.   Breakfast was fair as well; made-to-order omelettes, which is a win, but bacon, sausage, and potatoes were not great. Looked like some of the lower-end Sysco stuff.  Room was a typical Embassy Suites, no complaints. I didn't have a problem with A/C or heat, but maybe I am not that picky...easy enough to get an extra blanket.    I didn't get
Manager Response: Squirrelpaws,  My apologies for not meeting your expectations.    Clearly we what we intend to do.   I will share your feedback with my chef and front office team so we address accordingly.   As a H Honors Diamond we value your patronage greatly and I won't rest until I get you back.  How can I make it up to you?   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com and I would love to visit.

Summary: We were greeted upon arrival with no wait time. Great breakfast and room service food was excellent. The room was clean and spacious. All staff members from housekeeping to breakfast staff to front desk were helpful and friendly. The only thing I wish was different is that we had control of the thermostat in our room. It was too hot at times.
Manager Response: GH007447,  So glad you enjoyed our staff and generally enjoyed the hotel.   I apologize your room was warm and the HVAC did not perform as you would have liked.

Summary: We decided to stay at the Embassy Suites on Dyer Road due it's proximity to our daughter's apartment in Irvine. The hotel is a beautiful, old-style decor building right on the freeway. Parking is $17 a day which we did not know in advance. Our room had no phone service due to maintenance drilling through the line while upgrading the wireless internet. Also, the safe in our room did not work and maintenance told us we were not alone. Finally, the thermostat did not work so we constantly has air conditioning even though it was below 65 each day. The staff is very friendly and greeted us with a smile and a hello every day. There were a few other minor issues but I would check around for a different Hilton property in the future.
Manager Response: 466Steve,  My apologies for the phone issue.   It is fixed now and the wireless internet upgrade turned out great.  I know we have struggled with the HVAC and weather tempertures this past few weeks.   Thankgoodness must of the year it's warm and we only need AC.

Summary: The rooms have been updated since our last stay at this Embassy Suites about 2 years ago.  The furniture and beds are new and the bathroom has been updated also.  As Hilton HHonors members, we got a nice upgrade to the Premium 10th floor which has nice amenities and complementary drinks and refreshments in the suite.  The suite was clean and had a nice view with a balcony facing the north where you could see the distant San Gabriel Mountains covered with snow.  The complementary breakfast was just wonderful with made to order omelets that were just right.  The only mishap during our visit was housekeeping missed our room one day even after we had called several times.  The front desk promised to comp our room for one night or give us extra HHonors Points which we thought was a
Manager Response: Geotech522,  So glad you got a chance to return and enjoy our hotel again.   A lot has been addressed this past year and I was happy to read about your favorable stay.  We are trying hard to do great work.   Sorry for the housekeeping mix up, but I'm glad it was addressed.   We look forward to your return.

Summary: Thermostat in room did not work.  Breakfast staff we're mostly nice except the first lady at the omelette station.  We did not attend any of the evening receptions.  The guy from the restaurant was upset we ordered food to go rather than having it delivered to the room.  He let me know gratuity was not included on the to go order.  I did and always do tip at least 20% and do not need to be reminded.  My husband is a diamond honors member.  We choose Hilton because of the service and quality.  This was definitely not one of our better Hilton stay experiences.
Manager Response: Tekkkkk,  Thank you for your valuable feedback.   I will address with my team and I'm sorry you found two members of the staff to be unprofessional and not as nice as the majority.

Summary: Fun times with softball team! Kids all had a good time at the indoor pool and parents had complimentary drinks for the night. There is a convenient sports bar for the family and great complimentary breakfast.
Manager Response: Alondra C,  So glad you had a great time and the team enjoyed the hotel!   We loved have you.

Summary Heading: Cigarette and moldy odor coffe maker didn't not work properly dirty towel on bathroom floor before we checked in room
Summary: Cigarette moldy odor no lamps non working coffee maker didn't provide service and benefits as promised dirty towel on bathroom floor when checkin to room reported several times to front desk it was a struggle to request removal
Manager Response: B3794ROvanessal,  My apologies for the condition of the room upon your arrival and the reaction time of my team.    I will follow up, but do know the electrical issue has been resolved.    We are a non-smoking hotel and unfortunately not all guests respect the non-smoking policy.   When we do find a room that has been smoked in we by design put the room out of order and have a deordorizing process and cleaning that costs us time, loss of revenue and the cost of the cleaning.   We charge the past guest $250.00 when possible.  I will continue to do all I can to ensure we have the best possible room accomadations and I'm sorry I failed during your stay.    Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com when you are returning to the area so I may give your reservation and room selection my person attention.

Summary: First time will not be the last...This hotel although a little on the older side is very clean, the staff are very outgoing, the food is well prepared and hot with the prepared to order breakfast adding the personal touch. The in hotel restaurant offers a nice size menu and the waitstaff are extremely attentive.
Manager Response: LawrenceC501,  So glad you enjoyed your stay and our staff got high marks.   Our restaurant is a diamond in the rough, we get lots of locals and many hotel guests because it's really very good.   I will share your comments with housekeeping, breakfast and restaurant team mates.

Summary: the heating/cooling systems are controlled by the hotel. the customer cannot control their own air/heat you will freeze your buns off if you stay during the winter months may be okay for summer months.  It was very cold at this hotel in the evenings and early mornings. The bartender during the happy hour evening receptions was very selective (racist) on who he asked for their hotel key showing that they are staying there on that day.
Manager Response: T9364CYkathryns,  Hope you got my email using your email address from your Hilton Survey.    I look forward to hearing from you.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: No working wifi or TV. Staff was indifferent. Hotel was dated and worn feeling and so were the rooms.  Breakfast wasn't the caliber of what I've had at other hiltons or embassy suites.  The tables were all dirty no one cleaned them up to make room for new people.  Other than the people cooking there was no other staff presence in the dining area.  Valet staff was good.  I left irritated with the entire experience and having told the deal agent I was unhappy she said I'm sorry.
Manager Response: X6853vTmicheles,  Please let me know your name so I can follow up.   TV and WiFi issues are now gone so I want to see when you stayed.   Very surprised about your breakfast experience, we usually score high marks.  My email is Michael.Anderson#wcghotels.com

Summary Heading: I think the Best place for the money paid!
Summary: Staff was friendly. The bedrooms was spacious and very comfortable (family stay with 3 kids). We heard absolutely no street noise. Beautiful lounge area and food was delicious. Inside pool just perfect in the winter, kids were happy. Parking is $15, I would rather pay $10, but overall 5 stars! Thank you.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Beautiful Embassy property but "just completed renovations" fall flat. Very poor wifi although I was told this was currently being upgraded. My son ended up using all his data plan for the month because the wifi would cut out without him realizing. We were a large group and more than half of us had unresolved issues with our key cards and the parking gates during our stay. There is no thermostat control for heat in any of the rooms. I was told by staff that the entire building is either on or off and currently it was off. Odd as it was unusually cold and rainy in SoCal during most of our stay. We were offered a space heater though. The glass doors to the balcony are single pane and in bad need of new seals. As a result there is lots of road noise and noise from adjoining
Manager Response: F3681QIandrewc,  Thank you for your review.    I also saw it in your Hilton survey.    In the past year we have spent millions and will continue to get this wonderful hotel in top shape.  It's a fun project and ownership is addressing various issues as time allow.   Challenge is we are so busy (run 86% for the year), but we will continue to work on everything.  WiFi project is done and results are amazing.    Rooms got done, though there are still challenges we are addressing this year with HVAC.   Sliding doors are a project this year too... Love the balconies, and you will never see them at a new hotel.  I hate where the microwaves are too and we are testing putting them on top of the wet bar.   Hope it works.      Again, thanks for your advice.

Summary: This is 2nd year in a row we have stayed here and love it.   However, I was disappointed with the advertised million dollar renovation as I really can't tell to be honest. Sure the tv and key is different but I was expecting new carpets, beds and a lick of paint.
Manager Response: Son N,  New furniture, lighting, all wall coverings, new beds, window treatments, TV's, safe, new phone system, room locks, fixtures, artwork, mirrors, lamps --- but yes the carpet was done two years ago so it will be done next time, still in great shape.     We just finished a Wi-Fi upgrade with the latest technology.  Great connectivity and more bandwidth.   Very exciting.  This year we tackle the public areas, lobby, atrium and restaurant.   Plus we are installing new thermostats with some HVAC upgrades.

Summary: Room climate cannot be controlled between 55 and 75 degrees and gets very cold at times. Internet is slow and sometimes hard to log onto. Parking rates were negotiated but when checked out was a different price. Beware rates change as rooms fill.
Manager Response: 116ronny,  Rates change daily, even hourly as our revenue manager sets rates.    We set rates based on demand and supply so booking as far ahead as your planning allows is best.   Also use Hilton.Com and use your H Honors Membership to get best rates.  This year we are using capital to address HVAC.   Thank goodness most of the year it's 70-80 and sunny so AC is what everyone wants.  I'd like to better understand the parking rate issue.   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: This positive about this hotel is the location. It was a very quick drive to and from the airport and there is a local shopping center nearby that is very accessible. The pool was nice (although I admit I did not use it). The breakfast was standard for an Embassy Suites and I cannot complain as my food was good.  The evening reception did not have an abundance of food.  It had chips and salsa pretty much all the nights I was there.  No variety.   The fitness area was nice but for the size of the hotel, it was rather small.  But the equipment was nice and not low quality.    The cons - the wireless connection on the 10th floor was terrible. The wireless worked at the door to the living area but as soon as you moved farther into the room, you lost the connection.  For a business
Manager Response: Tiffany,  Thank you for you detailed feedback.   Very helpful.   I will work with the housekeeping and operations teams to deal with what was neglected during your stay.  Clearly not what we want to happen and I'm sorry.  So glad you found the staff helpful, but I understand your frustration with a stuffy room and poor Wi-Fi.   Wi-Fi upgrade is done this week and please expect it to be very good.  Both bandwidth and connectivity have been addressed.   We expect to go from Wi-Fi being our top complaint to a noted strength.   Our 33 year old hotel has solid concrete walls and We had to put a contact point in every room.   Good news is we don't get noise complaints newer hotels get.  We are address the HVAC throughout the hotel this year, frankly we keep AC on also all the time since we average 70-80 degree temps in sunny Southern California.   It is an issue 60 days a year historically, but when it is it's challenging.  When it's not raining we do have the availability to have outside cool air directed to rooms, but during rain storms the humidity is an issue.   I hope we can complete this next project before next winter.  Sorry we lost you.   I'd love to help you the next time you are coming to the area and hope you will contact me when you have a reservation.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: Happy hour poor, Parking charge high, Can't adjust the heat or air, We were let down after staying there in the past. They get top dollar for poor quality. We won't stay there again. The only good thing is the location
Manager Response: 861ronaldw,  My apologies for our short comings.   Your title says poor service and the staff generally gets high marks.   I noted the parking fee, HVAC issue and your view of our reception.   Thanks for this feedback.   Were there also service issues?   I can be reached at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  Thanks

Summary: I stayed here in October of 2016.  The room I was first given faced the highway and was very noisy (I had wanted to keep the sliding door open to get some fresh air as the room was way over sprayed with chemicals).  I called the front desk and explained the situation.  I was told they didn't have any other rooms.  I am Hilton Diamond and told them I was surprised since I could see that rooms could be booked online.  So, the clerk found me another room but it ended up being in an area where they were remodeling and right door to a room where they were painting.  The odor was quite bad, but I figured I could stay in the bedroom part with the sliding door open,  although the view was pretty bad and a lower balcony was full of cigarette butts/trash.  However, after about an hour I
Manager Response: MHB1971,  I've been out for a few days and am just catching up on reviews.  Wow, so you stayed in October and we failed to address your situation.   We work very hard to get it right the first time and make it right when we don't.  I'm so sorry.   Could you please resend what you sent before to me and I promise I will research and contact you in a timely manner.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  Thank you.

Summary: This hotel is being remodeled. The process is going slowly and those floors that aren't completed really suffer. The floors are uneven so drawers do not stay closed. Some of the doors look like they have been eaten away. There is no functional thermostat in the rooms. The heat is centrally controlled and even though it was below 55 they did not put on the heat! On the lower floors - they have removed the cable box from the TVs and so very few channels are available. The evening Manager's Party was much less extensive than we have had at other Embassy Suites. We were very unhappy. On the positive side - the breakfast staff are exceptional.
Manager Response: Jamtraveler,  Thank you for your feedback.   Rooms are now done, as is the Wifi and TV upgrade.  The snacks at the reception are all brand standard (potato chips, chips and salsa, cheese and fruit).  Would love to know other Embassy's you are referring to and I will call them and see what they are doing.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  Breakfast team is amazing.

Summary: Front desk staff are not helpful, at all. Silva is extremely rude and childish. I do not recommend this location if you are looking for competent and caring staff members. The top blanket was dirty. I had to request a linen change upon my arrival.
Manager Response: Demetraa2017,  Tell me poor please.   I really appreciate your feedback and would like to better understand your experience with Silva.   She has gotten many great comments in the past.   My apologies for the bedding issue.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com      Please give me a name and phone number and I will give you a call.  Thanks

Summary: Good location, clean rooms, good place to stay before flight out of John Wayne Airport.  Very accommodating staff.  Welcome stay with family - pool area, breakfast and room service all good.  Will stay again when traveling with family in/out of John Wayne Airport.
Manager Response: JohnRollTide,  You can't be happy today after the game last night.   My condolences.   So glad you had a good stay and liked us a lot.  We look forward to your return.

Summary: It was my first time staying in this particular Embassy Suites, and I was not disappointed. Kyle, one of the staff gentleman, was very nice and helpful -- not to mention knowledgeable -- and answered all my questions. Even though there were a lot of people and the he was often busy, he always managed to make time for me, which went a long way. Thanks!
Manager Response: Fadi S,  Thanks for taking the time to tell us about your wonderful experience with Kyle.   It's great when our staff makes a personal impression.   I will share your note with him and his peers and we will celebrate.

Summary: I have stayed twice in this hotel and will continue to stay here for all of my Anaheim/Santa Ana trips. I enjoy the complementary hot breakfast, the evening reception, and the location. Easy access to the freeway and nearby shops are only a 5 minute drive away.
Manager Response: KTbug678,  Thank you so much for your continued patronage.   We look forward to your return.

Summary: Requests are being ignored. No checks on the room if commodities are working well or not. Clean rooms but shower, A/C not working.  Microwave was placed in an akward place- under the sink. Dryer for clothes not working. No one to fix it.  No signage. Poorly run.
Manager Response: Fred C,  Please contact me regarding your stay. I would love to discuss your insights personally.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: Older hotel however Overall nice.  I stayed only 1 night & had to change rooms at 1:00AM due to Toilet being stopped up!  I'm a Silver Hilton Member & never experienced this problem SO I was very disappointed
Manager Response: Chanda L,  My apologies for the plumbing issue you experienced.   While they happen from time to time we do all we can to treat our systems so we don't experience clogs though they happen once and awhile.   Hope we see you again soon.

Summary Heading: Rooms great, rest of hotel needs a little facelift
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel once before and was pleasantly surprised that the rooms have been renovated and updated. The rest of the hotel however is very dated. Having just stayed at the Embassy Suites in La Jolla I was a tad disappointed at the rest of the hotel, however I must say that the breakfast was better than La Jolla. We had very little time to spend at hotel so the disappointment did not last long. Better parking rate at 15 dollars than La Jolla's 28 dollar charge. The location is industrial so not much around as far as eating or shopping.
Manager Response: Calfair,  I agree we have a great breakfast and our parking is lower than San Diego, La Jolla and LA markets.    I too stayed at the La Jolla property a few weekends ago and their public area and room renovation was good.   We did the rooms this past year and we will complete all our public areas from June - December in phases this year.   The design is amazing and it take our unique landmark and leverages it while innovating where needed.    Going to be great!    Oh, glad you like the rooms!

Summary: Typical Embassy suites experience but hotel is showing age.  Heating and cooling does not work very well.  Fitness center had no towels.  Bathrooms in bar area were a total mess.  Breakfast was good - staff was helpful and pleasant.
Manager Response: James N,  Thank you  for your input.   We will address the ills causing the short comings you experienced.    So glad you enjoyed our staff.

Summary: We were visiting the LA area for a week's vacation and found this hotel to have very friendly, courteous, and helpful staff.  The rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet provided a great variety of delicious choices for our family which was a big plus before venturing out each day. We were pleased overall with this hotel and only have two complaints concerning our five night stay: First, the hotel was filled to capacity after our third night and although the housekeeping staff was working very hard to keep up with the demand, upon our return to our room the third evening, we discovered our room had not been cleaned or serviced. We reported this to the front desk staff who very helpful. They apologized and provided us with fresh towels and supplies and even gave us a coupon for
Manager Response: David T,  Thank you for your very fair survey.    I am so happy you found our team to be very helpful and friendly.    We are working on our HVAC controls to update the thermostats in each room this year.   Yes the heating and cooling becomes an issue at times, but thankfully most of our year in Sunny California almost everyone wants AC.   Generally we have about three months (DEC-FEB) each year where we have warm days and cool nights which makes the system less desirable.    By next winter we will have completed the upgrade in each room, the public space and banquets so guests have a better experience in this regard.  We have also looked at our pay structure in housekeeping to help our recruitment.   Those who work for us are great and we want to keep them so we are giving increases and addressing new hire hourly rates trying to attract more staff to clean rooms.   We are also providing great benefits and a good meal each shift.    Our goal is to always have the right number of housekeepers so all rooms get done in a timely manner.  We look forward to your return.

Summary: Air conditioning/heating system did not work. The paid parking system was a real pain. Facility not well maintained. The staff was friendly and warm. The food was good. We chose this facility because of the location and the family friendly environment.
Manager Response: Stephenn591,  Thank you for your feedback.   So glad you found the staff warm and friendly and the food good.    We did have issues this past two weeks with HVAC in some rooms and I'm sorry for the inconvenience.    We have plans and capital this year for new thermostats and better controls.   Good news is most of the year in Sunny California is just that.

Summary Heading: The worst stay experience at a hotel
Summary: I give this hotel not more than 1 star, because that's what it deserves. First day check in we were at a room that smelled like mold, I had to call customer service twice, they said they will make sure cleaning crew will clean it & refresh the room when we came back at 11 pm not only the smell was the same the room wasn't even vacuumed, called customer service again they told us they will change the room the next day& by our luck room was by free way so we could even leave the door to balcony open to get fresh air in room plus weather was chilly. The new room was very cold, weather got colder we froze & asked for blankets at 3 am & this was a night before new year eve of 2017, such a great start, took the kids to pool after 15 minutes they closed down the pool for two day ( also
Manager Response: We sure messed up and I would love to follow up with you.    If you would send me contact information I will contact you.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: Room was not clean, bathroom extremely small, not family friendly.  Broken door lock, unclean bedsheets, dirty floor, slow internet, and finally leaked ceiling (water dripped down over one of the bed).
Manager Response: Hungdan L,  Please contact me directly at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  I apologize for the inconvenience we caused you and your family and I would like to follow up in  more detail.   I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Summary: Poor service, broken elements in room, leaking tub, door off hinge, tv issues had to move room. For a hokton enbassy location, i expected far better... no recognition of honors status. Dissapointing stay... pull out bed more comfortable than main bed
Manager Response: JohncH3676PH,  Please contact me directly at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  I apologize for the inconvenience we caused you and would like the discuss the stay in more detail.   I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary Heading: A Very Good Property in Southern California
Summary: This property was wonderful.  It was clean, inviting, and provided a cooked to order breakfast each morning.  The staff was pleasant and very helpful with recommendations for things to do and see in the area.  It felt good coming home to our hotel/room each night after a long day.  Our view was amazing and the room was extremely comfortable.
Manager Response: Marilyn P,  So glad you enjoyed your stay, our hotel and the staff.   More and more guests do and we won't rest till everyone does.    Your comments are encouraging!

Summary: A little better than the  normal Embassy Suites. The breakfast has more items, plenty of seating (a problem for some EBs), and the staff is friendly. The one knock would be the parking should be included (I don't like hidden charges).
Manager Response: Raymond F,  We try hard to be the best Embassy Suites and one day the best hotel period in Orange County.  Sorry you missed the parking charges.   We have confirmed the details are on all our websites and reservations agents protocol.   We look forward to your return.

Summary: Having Air Cnditioning only when it's hot sucks. It would be nice to have a reclining chair to kick feet up at night would be nice. breakfast was fabulous, many options,interney was slow and bumps you off periodically.
Manager Response: Todd K,  $300,000 Wi-Fi upgrade will be done January 16th and the connectivity and bandwidth will be fantastic.    Thanks for the feedback and glad breakfast was fabulous.   We look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: The best. It has it all!
Summary: I stayed with my housband and baby boy during winter break and we loved it. The suite is very big and clean. Living room, mini kitchen, full bathroom and the bedroom. They offered us free internet and complimentary breakfast. We will definetly go back, it's the best.
Manager Response: G9781SWlindat,  Embassy Suites Amenities at their best.   By design your experience is what we want for everyone.  Thanks for sharing.

Summary: We have stayed here several times, and am sure we will be back.  The rooms are comfortable and clean. The complimentary breakfast is amazing; it even includes omelettes.  Easy access to the freeway; minutes from Disneyland. Like most Hilton properties, the beds are more than comfortable.  The only negative is the nightly parking fee, but we are seeing that just about everywhere these days
Manager Response: Tamas M,  Thanks for your loyal patronage.     Hilton beds are tops and our location is 15 minutes to Disney and 10 minutes to the beaches.     Glad our breakfast is so pleasing for you and yes all the full service hotels in the area are charging for parking.   We are lower and plan to always stay under the others.

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 5 days but the room was extremely hot and the internet was very slow. The TV/Satellite was also poor quality.  The hotel was supposed to be remodeled but it was done poorly and our room was musty and not really clean.
Manager Response: Yuni G,  Also got your Hilton Survey so I will be in touch via your email.

Summary: If we needed anything or had questions, all we had to do was ask and everyone was very helpful to make it happen or re-direct. Breakfast is amazing The shuttle took us shopping and picked up promptly. Kids loved turtles
Manager Response: Mayh699,  Sounds like you and the family had a great time and the team and turtles performed well.   Thanks for choosing us.

Summary Heading: Overall great stay! I would recommend this hotel great food nice atmosphere complimentary drinks and snacks at certain h
Summary: Great Hotel, I would stay here again, clean, I like that it had a full-size breakfast you can have dinner there and also complimentary drinks and snacks from 5 tof 7:30. We went to Disneyland wasn't too far out of the way.
Manager Response: T5802HUjessicag,  Glad we were a "Great Hotel" in every  way.    We look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Not what i expect from a Hilton Family Hotel
Summary: I will start out with a great compliment to Mgr on duty Mr. Eng who tried to make things right for me. As well as the entire hotel staff were very friendly, welcoming and helpful especially the evening shift at Sweet Spot they were excellent. I was truly disappointed by my room which was an upgrade to premium floor, by no means was this room what I would call "Premium". when I originally booked I requested a room with a balcony which cost more when I was upgraded I did not get a room with a balcony and I was charged more for the upgrade.. I was really expecting to have at least a great view but no. This room was no way near what I would call premium. Most of this type would have plush bathrobes, fluffy towels and fabulous pillows, nope, none of this. The bed was comfy but the
Manager Response: Ladyzire,  Thank you for your detailed feedback.   Frankly you make some very good points and we will consider all we can truly address.    Let me know when you are returning via email and I will see if we can block a suite more to your liking.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels  I the past twelve months we have improved our Trip Advisor Rating 7 hotel positions from 12th to 5th based on guest ratings.   The team has worked hard to provide guests the best possible experience and we will continue to improve to reach our goal to become the BEST HOTEL IN ORANGE COUNTY.

Summary: This Hotel has now refurbished all of their rooms. Additionally new TV's are in all rooms, most all are 50" HD LG's. They are programmed with 50plus HD channels.  Soon I understand the entire Internet WIFI system upgrade will be finished which will raise speed and bandwidth to several times the present capability. The staff here is extremely friendly and goes out of their way to create a great stay for every guest. My business necessitates I stay here for long periods of time, I have found no better hotel in the vicinity that is as comfortable and functions as well as this one. Management is very proactive with respect to guest comfort and the comprehensive upgrades to the facility make this a great place to call home.
Manager Response: TravelerJCB,  Thank you so much for the review.   It was a tough few days reprograming the new TV's with our content provider (never as easy as it sounds) and yes the Wi-Fi upgrade is well underway and will be done ASAP, end of December, worst case first week of January.   We really appreciate your loyal patronage and will do all we can to continuallty improve.

Summary: Overall, a good hotel with fair price which includes hot breakfast and happy hour drinks in early evening. This location is not good nor convenient comparing with the other Embassy Suites in Anaheim (in the heart of Disneyland). Therefore, the extra charge of parking ($15 / day) seems a little bit too high. It should be free as the other hotels nearby. As a 2-room suite, the bedroom is ok but the living room is a little bit small. The refrigerator is too small, not the regular one, so it does not help much for us who planned to have a party. Embassy Suites is part of Hilton HHonors program, but their prices vary a lot between them (Hilton, Double Tree, ES, Hilton Garden Inn & Hampton Inn etc.) So you should do a lot of research to find out the best rates for each individual
Manager Response: 639anhtuann,  Glad you like us overall.   Our location is very central to all OC has to offer.  15 minutes to Disney, 10 minutes to beach and 5 minutes to airport.    All the full service hotels around the airport charge so guests or worse yet "non-guests" don't leave cars in the lot for weeks at a time.   Over a year ago we noticed all full service hotels near us charged for parking so we started and it has helped us dramatically controlling our lot and adding valet.   It also helped us upgrade security.   All the limited service hotels next to us are just that.  They don't offer our two room suite, full breakfast and reception included.   Plus our full service restaurant and room service make us the choice if you want a great value and need all we have to offer.   I get it though, sometimes I stay at Hampton Inn and there is a great one near us, but our rates many times are not much more.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Dyer Road - My favorite hotel (so far)
Summary: I have stayed many times at this hotel. Each of these stays, I checked out "overall satisfied". The staff is excellent - I mean everyone starting with valet, front office, house keeping, restaurant, food services. Breakfast is included - and is EXCELLENT. Not the cheap "FREE BREAKFAST" kind. Evening reception is superb. The only downside is Pillows are too soft (for me). I am giving Sleep quality lower rating due to this reason. Mattress is Superb.
Manager Response: Anik M,  Thanks for the staff "shout out"!   Yes -- I think we have the best breakfast and our Hilton survey scores are always very high vs. Brand average.    Let me/ housekeeping know what kind of pillow you like and we will add it to your Hilton Honors Member profile.   We may have a type that is more to your liking.

Summary Heading: No control over guest room temperature
Summary: A central hotel system runs every guest room and heat or cooling will only come on/off when the room reaches a certain temperature.  The guest has no control of this.  It is out of the control of the front desk.
Manager Response: terrynkathy,  I apologize for the inconvenience we caused you during your stay.   Most of the year it's a non-issue since Orange County has such a warm/ comfortable climate so we tend to need AC.   Our wonderful old building has many "one of a kind" features, but the centralized HVAC system is an issue when we have unusual cool weather since most guests still want AC.

Summary: This hotel is old. Room was cold even though I put the heater on high. Smelly room and sinks,windows are not seal you can listen to traffic, carpet uhhgg. Tv channels are crazy. I requested to be room change is the same, not to much improvement from one to the other
Manager Response: V308XBcristinab,  I apologize for the inconveniences we caused you during your stay.   If you don't mind could you take a moment and email me your name so I can follow up and check each of the rooms you were assigned.    We are currently fighting a programing issue with the new TV's we installed.   LG and Dish are trying to address but it caused a real mess.   Was to be seamless....

Summary Heading: Didn't Expect This From Embassy Suites
Summary: My wife and I recently had a 4-night stay in this hotel that recently underwent a "multimillion dollar renovation." I expected a nice, new hotel feel - not an apparently aged hotel with a little lipstick. I guess I have watched too many episodes of "Hotel Impossible." After seeing the expectations of the host of that TV show; my expectations of a higher end hotel brand have been raised. We checked into a room and upon initial inspection we found dirty dishes that housekeeping had neglected to look for under the sink. We noticed the valve on the bathtub had been leaking for quite a while since there was a rust stain in the tub under the valve and when we wanted to watch TV in the bedroom, the cable was not properly attached to the TV. We brought these observations to management
Manager Response: kth626,  I'm sorry we didn't come close to meeting your expectations.   I will address all the operational issues you described with our team.    Actually floors 9 and 10 have new bathroom tile in the shower that was done this past January.   Floors 8 through 2 have marble and it's 33 years old, but specular, thus you like it better.   That said all budgets have limits, but all rooms were renovated.    The balconies and sliding doors do create noise challenges and we are working on solutions.    The entire hotel just got new 50 inch LG flat screens in the living room and 43 inch in the bedrooms though LG and Dish our content provider are working though unexpected challenges.  The 10th floor, our premium floor has the following:  12 ceilings, two 50 inch TVs, the upgraded coffee service you noted (also has additional hot beverages), sodas, sparkling waters, water, and a wide array of snacks.      The renovation in all rooms included furniture, flooring, wall treatments, art, mirrors, new light fixtures, beds, TV's, phones, door locks, and draperies.   So it was 100%.   I wish we would have done all new HVAC vents, bathroom doors and new thermostats, but we are in 2017.     Thanks for the feedback and please know our great team will continue to do all we can to consistently please our customers.  We are all excited we did what we did, but understand we have work to do.

Summary: The servers at the breakfast where very friendly and helpful. The young men parking the cars were great as well. The staff in the restaurant could have been a little more friendly. The hotel lobby was beautiful. We took a look at the pool but there were so many people in it we just didn't want  get in. The hot tub was the same. To many people in it at one time.
Manager Response: GWendolynb300,  Thanks for the shout outs for breakfast and valet teams.   I will also tell the team in the restaurant they need to step it up.    No question there are times on the weekend the pool and spa gets busy on the weekends.   Families love it and it can be full.

Summary: I always stay at Hilton's when possible. Will not stay at this one again. Room was dirty. TV channels usually were not clear if you could even get them. I had to go through several plates at breakfast to find a clean one to use. The workout room and swimming area were filthy in the mornings. Towels and food everywhere. Was told the shuttle could take me to the airport at 5 am so I returned my rental the night before only to find out when I tried to book the shuttle that it was full. The only choice I had was a taxi. Had I known that I would have kept the rental. The only plus was the breakfast taste very good.
Manager Response: JeanieSolley,  My apologies.  Please let me know when we can discuss your stay?   I would love to try to win you back.   I've got a great staff, but we really failed you on several levels.  My email address is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  I hope to hear from you soon.

Summary: The service was fine and what is expected of the Embassy/Hilton chain.  This property is subpar and severely needs to be updated.  The heating/air conditioning cannot be controlled - there is a plaque that states if the temperature is below 55 the heater is turned on and if the temperature is above 70 the air conditioner is turned on.. but if it is between 55-70, there is nothing.  The room was so warm I couldn't sleep.  The cleanliness of the room is what you'd expect from an Embassy, but I couldn't get past how outdated the hotel is as a whole.  There also is not ample parking at this location.
Manager Response: lanolin85,  Our wonderful 34 year old hotel has lots of charm and is a one of a kind, but our HVAC is unique.    The good news is Orange County is warm with average annual temps in the 70's so we are in cool mode most of the year.   Every once and awhile we do get in a range that is challenging but even then we tend to keep the system in cool mode.  There are plans to add new thermostacs and a HVAC management system which will improve the situation short of individual units in each room.    I'm sorry for the inconvenience.

Summary: You cannot control the heating system.  They recommend using their space heater.  There was a constant water leak coming from the ceiling during a western region conference.  Conference rooms are outdated.
Manager Response: 601staceyt,  I apologize for the inconvenience.   Unfortunately a guest left the bath on and it overflowed for some time with a Do Not Disturbed hanger that we finally choose to enter the room.   In 2017 we will be updating all lighting and audio/ visual systems.

Summary Heading: Affordable, older hotel with a good breakfast
Summary: This hotel is definitely showing its age, but the rooms were clean and spacious.  The free breakfast was a hot breakfast with many options and the staff were very helpful.  The price was good, just don't expect a luxury hotel.
Manager Response: Alison303,  Glad you liked the staff and accomadations.

Summary: Things not working and service overall not good. Parking Information not fully explained upon check-In. Heater in hotel not working on windy cold nights. Housekeeping forgot to clean room. ATM not working and bedroom TV didn't work for 4 days. Asked for space heater, delivered 40 minutes later and didn't work.
Manager Response: 877renitaw,  Thanks you for your feedback.   No question we failed you on several levels.   I also saw your Hilton survey and responded directly to you.  My apologies.   New TV install has us working through software/ content issues.  We will review and discuss what happened with housekeeping and parking/ check in info.   Going to change ATM companies if we continue to have issues with slow response.    Let me know when you are back in the area so I redeem ourselves.

Summary: I was very disappointed in this specific embassy suites. The front desk staff were not very helpful and the room was dirty and old looking. When we talked to the staff they only offered apologies without solutions, and the tv in the bedroom was broken. I will not be staying at this specific embassy again nor will encourage others to do so.
Manager Response: Antoinetterb,  Thank you for your review.   I would love to discuss details with you and can be reached at 714-241-3330.   I apologize for the inconvenience we caused you.

Summary: Stayed in this hotel for work purposes.  Plus things are: pretty decent breakfast that is free, a free happy hour is a nice perk.  The grounds are kept clean, inside was fairly clean,  beds are nice.  Downsides: The hanging CAT6 wiring in the walkways is not a great look, the restaurant inside the hotel is not good at all.  Food was not well made, service was under par.  It needs a lot of work. Other things are the bright lights on exterior of building pointing inside of my room I cannot speak of others.  The tv system is not great.  Either the picture and voices are not synced or tvs don't work at all.  It seems like a system where the signal is split to many times.  Poor design.
Manager Response: SJSPISAK,  We are in the processing of a $300,000 upgrade to the Wi-Fi and the wiring will all be behind walls/ ceilings.   Going to provide great connectivity and more bandwidth. As for the food and service it must have been an off night, I'd love to learn when you dined and what you had if you have time.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com.    TV system has been acting up and we have had Dish out to fix.   If it continues we are going to have to make changes.    It's spotty and not in all rooms thank goodness, but it's terrible when it happens.  I will have it corrected ASAP.

Summary: My wife and I have stayed here 2 prior times in recent months and enjoyed it without any complaint. Last week however, we encountered several vexing problems. Our room keys didn't work in the morning as we returned from breakfast (this occurred last time,to). There was only one printer for 4 computer station and only one station was hooked to the printer. Computers are locked out of simple safe sites, like a big city newspaper and a crossword site. Printer was out of paper. Had to call ATT to get on the wifi (not my fault) weekend bkfst should start at 6am to thin the crowd later. very crowded, but also very good. Front desk "apologized for the inconvenience" but, once is inconvenient, and 6 times is poor/careless management.
Manager Response: Dave S,  I apologize for the inconveniences you describe.   Appreciate the feedback.   We just put in all new room locks and they enable us to use RFID keys vs. old magstrip.   Generally we have found the keys and locks to be very dependable and are seeing very few "re-key" situations.   We are almost done with a $300,000 Wi-Fi upgrade that will eliminate poor connectivity and add needed bandwidth.   Will be done by end of year.  I will get IT to look into public/ business center computer security, we maybe to tight.  The trend is to go to wireless printers that allow you to print from your own device and that's our long term plan.    Frankly if we extended breakfast on weekends we would go later, not earlier.    We are always busy the last hour and never the first, but I get your point.   All Embassy's are consistent breakfast times so customers can find consistency.   As for 6 times and poor/ careless management I could not agree more -- my team of managers and their staff should ideally get it right the first time.

Summary Heading: Beautiful Hotel at a Great Price
Summary: Beautiful, safe, friendly.  The breakfast is wonderful and helps the overall cost of traveling.   The indoor pool is perfect in winter and the kids loved going in the pool at night.   The location is close to the airport, beach and Disneyland.
Manager Response: Renee G,  Glad you and your family and a great time!

Summary Heading: Very nice hotel in a central location
Summary: Plenty of elevators, nice pool and gym. The evening reception is great. The kids loved the koi pond and the turtles. Close to lots of attractions. Feeding fish was fun. Free breakfast and large suites made this hotel a great value over renting a house.
Manager Response: Adam,  I could not have said it better myself.   Glad you had a good time.

Summary: Hotel is,looking tired and not so clean.  No heat available unless it reaches a certain temperature. The manager's reception was very skimpy on snacks. Pool was too cool for children.  Dirty towels were left all over the pool deck.
Manager Response: F645ONJJosephc,  Sorry we failed you!   We must do better than that.   If you get a minute let me know the dates of your stay.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com.

Summary: I was very pleased and my only complaint is that we did not have enough time at the hotel to enjoy the lovely open area more. It would have been a wonderful place to sit and enjoy a game of cards or backgammon while having a drink or appetizer. The rooms are spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable.
Manager Response: K6291KMricks,  So glad you enjoyed the hotel.   We have a rare 33 year old landmark that is a great place to stay.   When we get it right we are special.

Summary Heading: Amazing place to stay - minor things to take care of
Summary: I had an opportunity to stay in this Hotel when I was on business trip to Irvine, starting from the location, courteous staff, food everything was amazing. Few things to take care of, WiFi signals were bad in the bedroom wherein I got a good reception in the living room, I was asked to deal with the vendor directly to deal with this, could have been better if this was taken care of. I am so glad and I am referring all my office colleagues visiting Irvine to stay here. Thumbs Up!!!
Manager Response: Thanks!   We would love to provide great service to your colleagues.  Please let me know who I should contact so we work out a on-going business rate.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com.

Summary: This hotel is our favorite place to stay in So Cal.  We start our day with an amazing breakfast and end it with the Managers Reception.  The staff is so helpful and friendly.  Overall a wonderful experience!
Manager Response: CarollK,  Thanks so much for your loyal patronage and telling all we are your favorite Southern California hotel.   You made my day.    I am lucky to work with a great team with many Rock Stars.   They really try hard to be good and it's magical when we do.

Summary: I arrived in the hotel and they gave me a smoky room. I had to ask for changing. After that, tired, I arrived in my new room (see pictures).Clogged sink, old carpet, toilet door difficult to close, fan in the toilet working even with the light switched off and believe or not heater just below 55F and air conditioning just above 70F!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!How can it be true?  USD 150 with no temperature control??? It was 58F in the night and they gave me a heater (see picture) that didn‚Äôt work properly. Most critical, I asked to talk to the manager and he didn‚Äôt show up !!??? Terrible experience and I am Hilton Honor member‚Ä¶.
Manager Response: Alfredozina,  Wow!  We really messed up.   I would love to talk with you and figure out what happened so we can learn from the experience.   Our 33 year old hotel is amazing in so many ways, but HVAC is a challenge since the entire building is either in heat or cool mode.   Most of the year it's a non-issue in our wonderful Southern California location with average temps of 72 degrees, but when it's cold at night and warm in the day time we have some guests who want heat while most want cool.   It's one issue we just have to manage the best we can.   Sorry for the inconvenience.  Let me know if we can talk.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: From the moment I stepped in the lobby until I checked out I was impressed this is a beautiful hotel from the pool to the restaurant to the amazing atrium filled with koi fish and waterfalls and trees to the beautiful room.i work in an amazing hotel in San Diego so I know how hospitality works and what to expect and this hotel has it down.the lady who made my omelet was super friendly and nice to talk to.btw the breakfast was really good and the happy hour was good too.                               Now to the room it was your standard embassy suites room but it was really nicely appointed and the bed was really comfortable the shower was really nice. 5 stars and when we go back to Disneyland or just need  a getaway this is my hotel and it should be yours too
Manager Response: Jason,  I could hug you.   So glad you got some time off at your amazing hotel in San Diego and found our amazing hotel amazing!

Summary: Wonderful stay for my family while in the Orange County  area. Conveniently  located  in the OC. Close to the John Wayne Airport and major freeways. in close proximity  to  beaches and local amusement  parks and shopping. Our room was quite, inviting, and very very clean and we'll kept. The beds were very nice and comfortable. The fitness area, pool and whirlpool area was very well maintained and clean. Complimentary  breakfast was wonderful  with many selections to choose from. We will definitely  come back to stay when we return
Manager Response: So happy you and your family had a wonderful stay and our hotel and team were a part of it.

Summary: Between the lack of parking (and the fees associated $15 per night), the plumbing issues, and having no cable available during our 4 day stay, I will not venture back to this hotel. It used to be my "go-to" hotel, but I will make different arrangements next time.
Manager Response: Amandam1978,  I am so sorry we failed you.  My apologies.   My hope is you would contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so we can discuss the stay and my resolution.  Thanks for taking the time to let me know.   We are working hard to be consistant and will do all we can to win back your faith.

Summary: Great location from Disneyland and Airport.  Staff was great and helpful.  Love the complimentary full breakfast buffet.  I always enjoy staying at Embassy Suites for my family vacation no matter where I travel ti
Manager Response: Bevedine,  Thanks for being a loyal Embassy Suites customer!   We look forward to your return and I will share your kind comments about the staff and our breakfast.

Summary: Overall solid location. Rooms average with pull out very uncomfortable. Breakfast reception hectic as always although staff very efficient. Evening reception always hectic but handled guests well with standard well selections.
Manager Response: T560RLmichaelm,  Yes we are busy at breakfast and the evening reception, but I am happy you found the team addressing their tasks efficiently.

Summary Heading: Comfy Place to lay your head
Summary: I love Embassy Suites and this location did not disappoint. The room was clean and nice and the room attendant was especially sweet. We were able to enjoy the evening reception and the full morning breakfast. We were all very comfortable with our hotel selection.
Manager Response: Thanks Christy.   So glad you had a good stay.   Expecially happy our room attendant was so "sweet".   They work so hard and always have a smile on their face.

Summary: The Embassy Suites Hotel in Santa Ana is a bargain luxury hotel. Great business center and fitness equipment. Comfortable suites with two flat screen TVs. Bed was extremely comfortable and blackout drapes made the room very restful. Table in front room useful for business and couch and sitting chairs were useful to meet clients.
Manager Response: Rihseq,  Could not say it better myself.   Glad our hotel exceeded your expectations.

Summary: Where do you start?  Like road noise, stay here  Want to freeze in your room, stay here  They do not turn on the heat in the rooms until the outside temperature is below 56, you cold in your room, too bad  They do not turn on the room air until the outside temperature is over 76, you hot in your room, too bad.   By the way you could open your balcony doors but they are full of cigarettes butts out there  They hit you $15 per day for the honor/privilege of parking your car there  They claim to have just completed multi million dollar upgrades, well they must have purchased gold and buried it in the basement because you can't see it anywhere!  I was going in there for 5 nights, I spent one and got out of there  Stay somewhere else I did
Manager Response: John,  Thank you for your feedback regarding our HGVC. We are working with an engineering firm to improve our system though our 33 year old building has this challenge. Thank goodness we are in Orange County where we average 72 degrees annually so the cold nights are rare. Problem is when the heat is on many more guests complain. I apologize for the inconvenience and hope you found a great alternative.

Summary: Aside from the size of the room I would compare this place to a motel 6. Dirty bathroom and sheets. No working heat and drippy faucets. Wall outlets that don't work and bad tv reception. Motel 6 had better reception and had heat.
Manager Response: G4841RZisabell,  I also saw your Hilton survey and we will be responding to your email address accordingly.    Clearly we are so much better than a Motel 6 when we execute well and I apologize.  The team prides itself on providing a great hotel product and your review points to our failure with you.

Summary Heading: No temperature regulation in the rooms. Whole hotel was very cold.
Summary: No temperature control in the rooms. Otherwise everything was nice. We froze until they finally turned on the heat at 8:00 in the evening. When we pay for a room, we should be able to have it at the temperature that is comfortable. Yes, we gat a space heate...which put out no heat unless you were on top of it. Not a good policy for what is supposed to be a nice hotel
Manager Response: mkeller451,  Thank you for your feedback regarding our HGVC.   We are working with an engineering firm to improve our system though our 33 year old building has this challenge.  Thank goodness we are in Orange County where we average 72 degrees annually so the cold nights are rare.   Problem is when the heat is on many more guests complain.   I apologize for the inconvenience.

Summary: They had a two person efficient assembly line system for making the omelets that was the fastest best omelet I have ever had at Embassy suite.  It should become the model for speed at all Embassy Suites.
Manager Response: Yea breakfast team!   Glad you enjoyed the omelets!

Summary: Can hear traffic from the freeway. Bedding was not clean top cover and sheet stained and dirty. Took about 8-10 minutes for shower water to warm up. But after that was taken care of the stay was nice.
Manager Response: Purpleodiva73,  Glad we got the problems fixed.   I apologize we didn't get it all right the first time.

Summary Heading: Great place for Family and Business trips
Summary: The hotel is very nice. Clean and in quite area. the Management is great and they really care about customer satisfaction. the swimming pool is nice. All what I mentioned above on one hand the breakfast on another hand, it great and lot of varieties. I have stayed there for 8 nights I never have an issue with parking, actually I got free valuate parking twice. I highly recommend this hotel to other families.
Manager Response: Thanks Hamid K!   We are trying hard and the team really embraces their role as a service provider.   The parking included package is a good deal.

Summary: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the past three years. The hotel is typical Embassy Suites and I would recommend it mainly because of its proximity to the OC airport.  But,,,, Their parking situation is one of the worst I have seen. They charge $18.00 a day to park your car in a lot designed for 200 cars but is striped for 300. That is bad enough IF you can get in and/or out. The patking is controlled by your room key. During our most recent stay over four nights our room key worked ONCE every other time you hit the help button and hope someone answers. Previous visits have been slightly better but their new key system doesn't work. This is frustrating enough for me to find another hotel in this area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Shout out to the valet team especially to Sal, Randy, and Ron, you made our stay great.  I want your management to know that we felt like it was home and you were  like family.  Special Thanks to Scott who was the best shuttle drive ever hands down, Gung who we had slater's 50/50 with, and David (the Davinator). Wilbert who also had a glass of Amber Bock ready for us during happy hour.
Manager Response: Jeremy L,  I am so lucky to work with a wonderful team!   Thanks for singling out some real Rock Stars.    I will share your kind review with each of them right away.

Summary: Secure loacation with access to freeway.  Room cleanliness was not what I expect from a Hilton Hotel.  Front desk staff and breakfast staff  was friendly.  Housekeeping and maintenance staff were slow to respond.
Manager Response: DavidcY6185WD,  I also saw your Hilton survey and I am following up with my team to see what happened.  I apologize for the inconvenience we caused you.   Please let me know when you are returning.   I'm happy to hear the staff was very friendly. Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: Spent two nights at this hotel.  Rooms are very loud as you can hear traffic outside the windows all night long.  There was no heat in the room as it is controlled for the whole hotel.  Was told I could get a heater at the front desk.  TV only had 4 channels that came in clear.  Police activity one morning with vagrant person ranting and raving at the hotel entrance.  Did not feel safe going to parking lot.  Advertized rennovations are not great.
Manager Response: SunandSkiFam,  I apologize for the inconveniences you experienced.   There was a issue with our TV system and it has been corrected for now, but we are going to switch providers as soon as possible.   Please contact me if I may be of service.    Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary Heading: The Embassy in Santa Ana could do better
Summary: Nice hotel.  Pool/Gym area is really nice.  Housekeeping staff is fantastic.  Parking/Valet fees are too high for a location not fancy at all.  Various problems with drains and sanitary services.  Complementary services like TV and internet failed miserable.
Manager Response: Manolo-PuertoRico,  So glad you loved our housekeeping team!   We are in the process of upgrading our Wi-Fi system and will be done the end of November so a fix is in the works to expend bandwidth and coverage.   We are also looking at a different carrier for our TV channels since we had a failure during your stay.   We look forward to your return.

Summary: Great value at this location. Parking is a bit pricy ($15 per day and has small spots). The managers special has almost a full bar using well drinks. Breakfast us like any other location that I have been to, great service.
Manager Response: Steven L,  A suite vs. a room, our great breakfast and the evening reception with a full bar is key to Embassy Suites great value.   Glad you liked our great service.  We try hard to make our guests happy.

Summary: Excellent hotel and amenities for the price!!  The evening reception was something I've never experienced with any other hotel chain.  The breakfast was better than a restaurant.  Factor those into the price and you're getting a four star hotel for a two star price.
Manager Response: Leonardp580,  Love your review.   So glad you found us and enjoyed our hotel.

Summary: Rooms were filthy with hair all over bathtub on kitchen table and on the bed the sheets were dirty changed rooms to go to a moldy shower and walls the fridge smelled horrible the third room smelled like cigarett and marijuana ...I do have to say though the outside was beautiful and the food was great lots of options
Manager Response: Silvia L,  I apologize for the poor condition you found your room.   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so we can discuss how best to make amends.   We try hard to Make It Right the first time, but clearly we must have failed.   Again I'm sorry for the inconvenience we caused.

Summary Heading: Family stay at the Embassy Suites
Summary: We've been going to this hotel for our annual Disneyland trip for over 20 years and it's the only hotel we use because of the quality and value that we get with ES. My only recommendation is to have the gym open longer or 24 hours and a stronger wifi signal.
Manager Response: Opsig,  Thank you for your loyal patronage over the years.   I'm a Tigger fan myself.    We are in the progress of completing a Wi-Fi upgrade over the next six weeks to increase bandwidth and add coverage in each room.   We will be done the end of November at the latest.   Regarding the gym I wrote to your Embassy Suites survey asking about what time you like to work out.   With the pool in the same location I have some concerns about 24 hours, but maybe we can adjust hours depending on your habits.

Summary: They had a very clean facility. The staff was friendly. The breakfast choices were great. The happy hour had good snacks. The bed was very comfortable. The room was very spacious. I would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Christina A,  So glad you had a great stay.  We look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: The best embassy we have visited yet.
Summary: When pulling in to the hotel my oldest said "oh wow." There were a few other hotels right around and this one is visually more impressive than the rest. There is a $15/Day parking fee. They also have valet. We stayed here for Disney and saved a bundle. It was only a 17-20 minute drive to The Mickey and friends parking center. The indoor atrium was very impressive. The boys loved the turtles and coi. The breakfast was most excellent with my favorite being the fresh made omelettes. Everyone was very pleasant. The only rub was that they had the biased liberal fake news on all through breakfast. I thought everyone knew it was extremely biased by now. I guess it is California though. Me and the wife like the separate rooms with the separate TVs. We put the boys on the fold out sofa
Manager Response: DaddyDecker,  Sounds like you and your family had a great time!   Our 33 year old hotel is special and we are so close to Disney and all that Orange County has to offer.   Hilton.com should have best rate so if you see that again let me know.   We look forward to your next stay.   As for the TV at breakfast it should be the Today Show.   We try to avoid all the cable news since we can't win... someone is always mad.   Amazing election this year!

Summary: Convenient Santa Ana airport location. Friendly staff. VERY relaxing atrium area with 2 water falls...considering other nearby hotels we felt this hotel was a good value for the amount we paid for this spacious suite. Price to park at the hotel we felt was expensive & unnecessary.
Manager Response: Robfromnmusa,  So glad you found the staff to be very friendly... charging for parking is here to stay.   All the full service hotels in the John Wayne Airport area charge and we started over a year ago.   Has helped us control who parks and keeps are spaces available for our guests.   We has have valet which has helped us on very busy nights.

Summary: Usual room layout, living room at the front with the bathroom/bedroom to the rear. There a couple of things that didn't go so well, the Internet was poor on the 8th floor. And there was flaking paint above the bedroom curtains that kept falling down every time we opened and closed the curtains. We reported the flaking paint twice but nobody came out to look. It just needed knocking all off and vacuuming up but as I say nobody bothered.   I didn't have any breakfast at all whilst we were there but my wife did and she enjoyed it.   There's a laundry on the 3rd floor in the corner where the 3 lifts are. The washer was $2 and the dryer was $1.50, all quarters.   The room had coffee making facilities, a microwave, iron-ironing board and hairdryer. There was a television in both rooms
Manager Response: digger2007,  Thanks for your detailed review.   Glad you found the staff very friendly.   We will work on the fish and chips.   I sense you come from "across the pond" where the dish originated.   I'll share your comments with our chef.    When you come back try it on me to see how we do.   We pride ourselves on our restaurant and it's a shame we failed your first meal.

Summary: From start to finish one of the best hotels and experiences my family has had, especially for the price. Top notch. The staff was great! We even got a nice treat for celebrating our anniversary and 1 year olds birthday! (Fruit, champagne, and cake!) Loved it.           We will be back!
Manager Response: Happy Anniversary!   Glad you had a great stay Levi.

Summary: Chose hotel based on location to theme parks and Disney. Hotel was clean, staff pleasant. Breakfast and evening reception were great. Room cleanliness, also good. Room was a bit dated but comfortable. Pull out mattress could be a bit better.
Manager Response: Martin,  Glad you found us a good location to stay and play at Disney.

Summary: The location was in a fairly easy area for freeway access. Check in was effortless . Although I do have to say I was disappointed with the condition of some parts of the room. I had read it was newly renovated and if you look at my photos many things should have been repaired. Work hard last thing I want to see when I'm away is rooms like this that's why I don't stay at budget hotels ... Conditions like this are disheartening   When I get the chance to get away I want my room to look appealing. The whole on the door , cracks etc was not what I expected . When I'm paying to stay somewhere while out of town I expect things look nice I'm sure the staff at the Embassy would feel the same way if they were customers out of town . Also I didn't mind paying a little extra for a premium
Manager Response: Rose, Please reach out to me about your return at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so I can address your next stay.   I apologize for the inconveniences.   Lots of good going on and the future is bright for this wonderful 33 year old hotel.   Wi-Fi upgrade is in progress over the next six weeks.   I look forward to Making It Right on your next stay.

Summary: This hotel is perfectly located to all major freeways. The hotel was very clean and offered everything my family needed. The hotel staff were great and I appreciated the appearance, cleanliness, and service I was offered upon my arrival. The only downside was the checkout process. Make sure to double check your bill upon leaving due to the fact there were several errors i found in my billing statement.
Manager Response: R4314Emichaels,  So glad you had a great stay and appreciated the staff and their hard work.   Sorry you found errors on your bill at check out, but glad you reviewed statement and caught them.   I will follow up with my desk team.

Summary: The hotel is amazing. The rooms where very clean and the staff was awesome. The free breakfast and happy hour was phenomenal. Great place to stay. It was in a very good location to store and about 10 minutes from the orange airport.
Manager Response: Froggy8083,  I love amazing, awesome and phenomenal -- so glad you had a great time with your grandsons!

Summary: We arrived very late and groggy, the valets were out there and directed us to where we could self-park. When we returned with the car to unload our luggage and look further for a space the valet ran over and offered to park our car for us, no charge, because he could see we were exhausted. That was the beginning of our very pleasant stay at this hotel. We checked in and were handed two bottles of water and a package of cookies and told about the free breakfast and the managers receptions in the evenings. The atrium is very pretty, the room was super clean and quite large. Plenty of space to unpack and sort and organize. We woke the next morning and enjoyed a cooked to order omelet and some of the rest of the buffet offerings, all in all a very satisfying breakfast.  Anytime we
Manager Response: Jill, You made my day!   Embassy Suites is a great hotel and your review explains why so many customers love Embassy.
