For the past year we have been working hard to update and upgrade and I am a lucky guy to have a team who is willing to do their best everyday.   So glad we exceeded your expectations and you join the many loyal Embassy Suite loyalists.

Summary Heading: A first class hotel with a caring staff
Summary: My husband experienced a health emergency while at this hotel and they were extremely helpful and compassionate. The hotel exhibited a professional (first-class) and understanding attitude toward us and helped us through the crisis. We provided appropriate help at every point during our stay and we were extremely appreciative. This hotel is not only first class it has a staff of incredibly caring individuals.
Manager Response: Mary Ellen, I hope your husband is feeling better.   I can't wait to share your review with my team.  I am so proud of them and what they did to help with your difficult situation.  We look forward to a future stay where you both enjoy all our hotel and OC has to offer.

Summary: very clean and well kept.  comp breakfast offered a wide variety of food choices.  evening reception offered a wide of drink choices, but snack choices were limited.  all staff were very helpful and courteous.  would stay there again ir we were to travel to the area again.
Manager Response: George -- so glad you enjoyed your stay and found our staff to be helpful and courteous.   We look forward to your return.

Summary: I have had such a good time! Kyle,Darius and Andrew were so awesome! They gave me such a good experience about this hotel! Good service nice employees! This place is the best choice for whom looking for a good time for your friends or family!! Thanks again guys Kyle,Darius and Andrew
Manager Response: Tyler N, Kyle, Darius and Andrew were so excited to see your review they sent it to me over the weekend... So glad they are on our team and you had a great experience.   I'm buying the guys lunch or dinner.

Summary: I love this hotel !! I have been to many Embassy Suites  and this one is the best one . I just love the way it looks the detail is just great .Please don't change it ! I think they are going to do a remodel of the common and lobby area  I and i think this would be a mistake as it would destroy the character of the hotel . I spent a lot of time just looking at the details please do not change it. The staff was just great very friendly made sure we were having a great stay . The food was great  ! room was clean  beds were great  I just love this place good job !!!!!!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to complete the review.   Love hearing we are your favorite Embassy Suites!   I am so lucky to work with so many great team mates.   As for the renovation of our lobby and atrium we are working with a designer that keeps our current atmosphere, yet helps us improve seating, traffic flow and provides operational improvements while also providing the open, airy, beautiful design we all love.

Summary: Everything went very well except a guest not with our party stole 2 bottles of wine from our raffle basket. The hotel was kind to replace them. Was very happy about that. We did have trouble with elevators getting stuck with us inside.
Manager Response: So glad your class reunion was a success.   Amazing the guest stole the wine out of the basket you were raffling off.  I know we got you two bottles of great wine to help, but it was troubling.   Turns out a Embassy employee from another hotel was staying with us and saw the whole thing so he followed the guest to their room to learn the number.   Under the circumstances we expressed to the guest that they were no longer welcome and would have to check out in the morning (any further issues and they would have to leave right away).   Of course they denied taking the wine or I would have called the police, though they generally have more pressing matters to take care of.    All's well that ends well.  Thank goodness guest's like that are rare.

Summary: Great place great staff .  just over all nice   good food good location .what makes this hotel is the staff and the charm of the hotel.the rooms are big the beds are the best and the location makes it easy .
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us and sharing your feedback... I will never tire from hearing about our GREAT STAFF.

Summary: The Room smelled musty.  would have complained but was there for only one night, therefore not worth the trouble.  This is unlike our prior experiences with this hotel chain.  The restaurant and bar were very good.  Shame about the foul smelling room.
Manager Response: Francis A,  We also got your Hilton Survey so I will inspect the room and see what's going on.  Sorry for the inconvenience.   Please let me know when you are coming again so I can make your next stay much better.  Our restaurant is really coming on and we are seeing many good comments.  Chef, Megan and the team are really nailing it more and more.    Even getting lots of locals!

Summary: Enjoyable weekend away from home.  Beautiful hotel, especially the lobby and ground level common areas.  Great complimentary breakfast.  Convenient location to highways, shopping, biking/hiking trails.  Great staff!
Manager Response: Anna S,  You are so right... we are right in the middle of everything OC!   So happy you loved the staff and had a great stay.

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites in Costa Mesa, CA
Summary: We were at this hotel for a class reunion.  Excellent experience starting with the suite accommodations to the banquet facilities.  The banquet dinner was excellent.  The staff is most gracious and courteous.
Manager Response: Roger R,  We loved your group!   Great people, getting together and having a good time -- so glad we could be a part of it.    I will share your comments with the kitchen and banquet team along with the entire staff.  I'm a lucky leader to have such a great team!

Summary Heading: Fabulous place for a get away
Summary: I stayed the weekend for a reunion.  My room was on the 3rd floor, a non-smoking floor. The rooms were great: an outer room opening on the atrium with desk, chair, and couch; and a bedroom that was very quiet with very comfortable beds and great linens..  T.V. in both rooms.  The only possible negative for some would be the small bathroom.  Breakfast was outstanding, especially the made to order omelettes. They recently started charging a parking fee if you bring your car so be aware of $15.00 per night for that if you drive. The evening reception by the manager makes up for it though. The staff was very pleasant and helpful.  No problems were encountered during the three days I stayed here.
Manager Response: Snavdog,  So glad you enjoyed your stay.  We are working hard to become the best hotel in OC.

Summary: This was my first stay at an Embassy Suites hotel and I was very impressed.  The room was nicely decorated, very clean and comfortable! The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the complimentary breakfast was great!  Nice not having to leave the premises to go eat-very convenient and made the morning hussle easier!
Manager Response: Debbie R,  Thanks for the great review.  Love hearing the team got high marks in all areas.

Summary: We love staying here. It's always clean and the staff is fabulous! The breakfast is a great treat and the evening reception is always a great way to end the day or relax with friends. The front desk staff is always willing to help.
Manager Response: 495tarras,  So glad you love our hotel and staff!

Summary: Nice welcome to OC. Staff was friendly & helpful, especially upon check in. Breakfast was great and the restaurant had a variety of options with attentive staff. Didn't have time to work out but there was a room for that overlooking the pool.
Manager Response: luvbeachesAustin,  Thanks for the great review.  Happy the team treated you well.   Sure hope you got to the beach.   It's been extra beautiful this September.   Minutes to Newport, Huntington and Laguna Beaches.

Summary: Fair value.  More show than anything.  I was disappointed in the size of the bathroom which are quite confining.  Not necessary that the bathroom be so small in a two room suite.    The restaurant is fair at best. Bartender and barmaid were poorly dressed which shows how they feel about being employees of the hote.
Manager Response: Gordon R,  30 plus years ago smaller bathrooms we the thing -- wish I could change them, but I sure love our big suites and that's where most of a guest's time takes place.   Uniforms -- I agree the baseball uniforms have got to go.   Staff hates them too... working on it.

Summary: Very clean, caring staff, nice bedding and spacious.  Great cook to order omlettes.  There is a $15 parking fee, but I guess that all the hotels charge for parking in So. CA.  I wold definitely stay there again.
Manager Response: Califamily4,  Glad you liked us.. we look forward to your return.

Summary: Checked in yesterday and found the room totally unacceptable.  There were no towels in the bathroom, hairs were all over the bathtub, and most disgusting is the bed, although made up, had hairs and spot of dirt all over.  This is definitely not what I expect from an establishment carrying a Hilton brand.  Received my invoice and parking was charged twice.  Had to call to let the front desk person know about it.
Manager Response: inot1966,  From your review I gather you did not end up staying with us.   Please contact me if you would so I can better understand what happened and follow up.   It sounds like we somehow checked you into a room that had not been cleaned after the last guest departed.   My apologies for the inconvenience we caused you.

Summary: Overall our stay was quite nice. Our family loved the great breakfast. However the door to our bathroom was broken so with 6 people going in and out it was quite annoying and frustrated everyone since it was so loud. Also the size of the bathroom was surprisingly small for our room. Every other embassy suites I have ever stayed at has great big bathrooms so I guess I was expecting that here too.   Overall though this was a great stay.
Manager Response: lgrumbley,  Thank you so much for your review.   So glad you and your family enjoyed the stay overall.    Yes, the bathrooms of our hotel are not as large as those designed today, but we sure have large living rooms and bedrooms that make up for the bathroom that's functional but not big enough for one than one person at a time.

Summary: I always stay at an Embassy Suites, because they are my favorite hotel.   I am usually in this area at Christmas time.  I have stayed at this particular Embassy Suites every year for the past 15 years. The staff consistently goes above and beyond to make sure the guests have an absolutely fantastic experience. This includes even the little things, like holding the elevator door, opening your room door if your hands end are full etc.  They especially go out of their way while serving & servicing their full complimentary breakfast.  They constantly monitor the area to ensure there are enough trays, plates & food.  In addition, the staff is continuously clearing & cleaning the tables so that you are not having to sit at a dirty table to eat your breakfast.  If I could rate this is
Manager Response: Anne M,  Wow!   10 STARS!   I can't wait to tell the staff.   Thanks for your loyal patronage and I am so glad you consistently find the team to be so helpful.

Summary: Strange odor in various places, dirty old popcorn ceilings, poor lighting, and cheap iron just to name a few of the issues. You must now pay for parking while there are no other options. Instead of being upfront and publishing the actual rates to make price comparisons fair, they "hide" the parking charge. The have this new digital key which is supposed to speed the check-in process and get you directly to your room. Ridiculous because you must still stop at the front desk because you can't exit the parking lot without a physical key.
Manager Response: Richard B,  Thanks for the feedback.   Please let me know how or where you made your reservation because we have the parking fee info on all sites and it is park of our reservation protocol to our knowledge.    You got me on the popcorn ceilings,  I used one of the irons just this morning and it worked great for me... I'll ask my team to check various irons in case one isn't functioning.   We will always replace yours if you find an issue.    And yes our guest room locks are new and fantastic with RFID vs. old strip on card that have so many issues (no more going back to the desk to get a working key).   We are working on making the parking gates more user friendly with latest technology, but for now yes you need a key to exit and enter the parking lot right now.

Summary: Very disappointed w/ this hotel - enough to leave after the first night of a three night stay. To begin with, the television in the living room would not work for more than half of the channels. I contacted the front desk and they sent engineering to fix it. Once there, he simply turned the tv on, turned to me and said 'This was a problem yesterday in a couple of other rooms too. There is nothing I can do to fix it.' When I asked why the TV in the bedroom worked fine, he said they we on separate 'lines'. So, I could no longer use the tv while working at the desk.   In addition, once I went into the bathroom the handle on the commode was not completely put together. It didn't just become broken, it was obviously missing a plastic nut in the backside of it to hold it in place. It
Manager Response: Woods7079,  I apologize for your poor experience.   Clearly not having a working TV and toilet is not hitting even the basics.   I'm so sorry we inconvenienced you so.  We will continue to do all we can to eliminate the issues and be more consistent.   Please contact me if I may be of service or help in anyway.   I would love to help you in the future.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel Santa Ana, Costa Mesa area
Summary: Great place to stay if you are going to be in the area of Santa Ana, Costa Mesa, Newport Beach,  Good price for holiday weekend.  The Breakfast staff are amazing, they greeted you on approach to the Breakfast area.  Omelet bar cooks made some outstanding delicious food. Many choices for breakfast.   Our room was on city side away from the freeway noise.  The Beds and pillows very comfortable.  The room size is extra large to accommodate 4 adults comfortably. The restaurant/bar, waitress snobbish bad attitude.  Acted like we were invisible.  ...The Parking attendant was very helpful.  Parking is very limited and is $15.00 a night. (:.   Front desk staff, did not smile, kinda of cold.   I am been staying at this hotel for the past 10 years and enjoy the Breakfast and comfortable
Manager Response: 231lucir,  Thank you for the review and the feedback.   Glad you enjoy the rooms and breakfast and I noted we need to remind our team at the desk and restaurant to be more upbeat and attentive.   Thanks for being such a loyal guest over the years.

Summary Heading: FOUR-STAR SERVICE AT A TWO-STAR PRICE
Summary: For once, an Embassy in Orange County was priced comparably with my standard Hampton so I took advantage of it to enjoy the nicer amenities.  The pricing might have been a result of some on-going remodeling and upgrading the hotel was going through but, overall, I'm glad I found this place and hope to come back.  Pluses of this particular location are: 1. Fair price for you get. 2. Great service, particularly from the front desk and breakfast staff.  They probably have the friendliest breakfast staff I've every encountered.  They really seem to love their jobs. 3. Very spacious room for either family travel or business. 4. Right off a freeway but not very noisy. 5. The breakfast itself was very good and orderly compared to other similar hotels.  I didn't partake in the manager's
Manager Response: Mike-in-bako, Wow!   I couldn't have written a better review myself.   And you points for improvement in a few areas are well noted.   We have an staff luncheon tomorrow and I'm going to read your kind comments to the team.   We celebrate every month and our chef makes a wonderful buffet for the staff.   Your review will get a cheer I'm sure.  Thanks so much.   And we are glad you found us too.

Summary: Great place that fit the needs of group travel. Breakfast bar allowed for easy (and early) group needs, and afternoon reception allowed transition from day to evening activities. We enjoyed the in house restaurant that allowed for dining without travel. Complementary shuttle to/from local area venues was a perk!
Manager Response: Carole Y,  Glad your group had a great stay and our various amenities meant all got their day started right, the reception was relaxing and convenient and our restaurant and bar enjoyable.    Our sweet spot restaurant is really good and many of our guests eat there more than once during their stay which points to the quality.    Plus if you want to go somewhere nearby like the District our shuttle is perfect.

Summary: The title says it all.  Its a very nice hotel.    The shuttle was very dependable and got us to the airport fast.  The rooms are comfortable and the employees can't do enough.  Highly recommended.    The bathrooms could be bigger but that's the only thing I can think of that I would change.
Manager Response: Kathleen,  Thank you for taking the time to rate us.   So glad we executed as designed.

Summary: The hotel itself was nice  and the complementary breakfast was very good, but the rooms were very noisy.  I was on the side near the 55, and the traffic noise was extensive.  I even checked to see if the window or balcony door were open because it was so loud.  Kept me awake all night both nights.  I also thought the $15 a day parking fee was high.  Best thing about this hotel?  $8 cocktails in the bar, even for premium liquor!
Manager Response: Randy B,  Thank goodness our 30 year old hotel is made out of cement vs. today's modern light materials.   Our wonderful location makes us central to all things OC, but yes 55 is next to us.   We are working on our sliding doors since if they are closed and tight the traffic noise is significantly less.   As for the $15 parking fee we are on par with all full service hotels in the John Wayne Airport area.   LAX is $40.    And I'm so glad you enjoyed a good crafted cocktail at a reasonable price in today's world.   We try to lower top end offerings for that reason.  Great quality and great value.   We even pour better than average liquors at our evening reception (better quality for a little more is worth it and our guests appreciate it.

Summary: Clean, comfortable, great service, convenient  to freeway, breakfast excellent. At the moment hotel being worked on so rooms slightly cold.   A nice family hotel and pet friendly üòäüê∂. The staff are friendly and accomdating.
Manager Response: Michelle,  So glad you had a great stay and your family had a great time.   To clearify regarding pets  we actually only allow service animals since our experience is dogs or cats mean we have issues, noise and cleaning expenses we have chosen to avoid.   Service animals we allow and generally their training means they are less of an issue, plus as you probably know we must do so based on Federal law.

Summary: Really enjoyed our stay, the staff is the best. They helped with our requests. Would stay there again. When I needed to stay extra days I was accommodated and was still able to keep my same rate. Loved the turtles and koi.
Manager Response: Deborah,  Glad you had a great stay!

Summary Heading: Very loud at this location with street noise when sleeping. Good location for freeway access
Summary: Very loud street noise for not so good night sleep no matter what floor your on. Much higher price charged for second night than first night. Great reception and breakfast choices close to freeways Food choices
Manager Response: Raquel,  Great location, but street noise from freeway can be challenging.   I'm working on the sliding doors since the rest of the building is sold as a rock.  Think that will help.  Glad you liked the breakfast and evening reception.

Summary: Beautiful hotel, the complimentary breakfast was incredible, and the complimentary drinks was the cherry on top.  Only complaint I would have is the complimentary internet was too slow to stream netflix or movies but they did offer a faster internet for a fee.
Manager Response: Brian,  So glad you like the hotel, breakfast and reception with bar.   We are working on Wi-Fi with an upgrade in September that will get us to the latest and greatest bandwidth and coverage to keep up with the demand.

Summary Heading: Don't stay here if you expect the typical manager reception
Summary: very close to SNA airport, with free shuttle which is nice. reasonable time to come pick me up.  You are limited to 2 drinks at the management reception which is EXTREMELY unusual for Embassy, and I VERY MUCH dislike
Manager Response: Travlinron2014,  Sorry for the confusion about number of drinks... we serve two drinks at a time, but you can come back and get more, just two at a time.    The bartender at our reception is responsible to ensure guests are not over served and drinks don't end up in the hands of those under 21.    Hope you understand, but you can have as many drinks as reasonable, just two at each time you come to the bar.

Summary: Checked in last Friday and everything went smoothly.  Staff everywhere were extremely helpful and friendly checking me in but Randy was a surprise!  I was in and out a lot Sunday morning and all I can remember is seeing him SPRINTING to every car he had to pick up and was always greeting everyone with comp waters and a big smile!  Will be coming back!
Manager Response: Anthonygperez,  Randy is here right now and I am going directly to him in the port to share your compliment.  Thanks for sharing.

Summary: Hotel is in a convenient location near many attractions the south LA area.  Hotel was under partial renovation while we were there but that had no affect on our stay.   We had 3 rooms for our family members.  One room had a shower that would not drain and hotel either did not or could not repair. Morning complementary breakfast was average at best for a Hilton property.
Manager Response: Marc JE,  Sorry we didn't meet our goal to be a great hotel for you.   We are continuely working to be the best we can be so we don't hear "average".   Hope you try us again soon.

Summary: Been staying at this hotel for many times, most of these due to Business purposes. Nice environment, comfortable suites, all you need is there. Breakfast is very good and with Quality, Personnel always willing to help.  The only thing that needs to be improved is the internet connection that usually is weak and low speed.
Manager Response: Gutierrez A,  Happy to report the wi-fi upgrade is scheduled this September and we will then have the latest technology to handle bandwidth demand and coverage.   Thank you for your loyal patronage and soon the internet will be at the proper level like our service and other products.

Summary: If ur budget wont allow for a property in Irvine or costa mesa then this will be a good fall back. It is priced right and only a 10 minute drive from John Wayne airport.  They are in the midst of so called renovations but I'm not quite sure what they are.
Manager Response: sammymadison,  This year we have worked on our rooms and will finish September 16th.   Currently on half of third floor and all of two plus one ADA room on each floor to expand the bathrooms.    A year ago we added new carpet and a sofa and comfortable chair in all the rooms, but didn't do anything else.   This year we did the rest: new paint, vinyl. new furniture, new beds, new drapes, new lamps and lighting, new mirrors, and new artwork throughout the suite. And in the bathroom we painted, new vinyl, improved lighting, mirror, new vanity, towel storage and showerhead.   No question having the same carpet, sofa and chair means returning guests don't see a significant change, but trust me we sure do, because we really were ready for a renovation.   We also painted all hallways, doors and changed out door locks to new RFID key locks which eliminate the use of old key cards with strips that cause a significant number of guests to get another card since they don't work due to damage or wear.    We spent millions and are very proud of our new room.

Summary: Very friendly Embassy Suites. Fancy lobby a little cold temperatures wise. Evening reception was good, the first time I have seen Humas and chips. We couldn't see olympics on tv for dinner, but they handled our party of 10 easily. Breakfast was very nice even open banquet room so easy table find. Hot cereal and yogurt had great nut toppings. Wifi a little slow, but rooms comfortable.
Manager Response: Stuart C,  So glad you love the lobby, reception, breakfast and had a nice dinner.  Surprised you couldn't watch the Olympics on TV -- I will check on, but at least one TV is on the coverage all the time by design.    Wi-Fi upgrade is happening this September and October and we are getting the latest and greatest to expend bandwidth and coverage.  Thanks for the business and we look forward to your return.

Summary: They are remodeling the hotel which definitely needed it. The atrium is lovely and a nice place to sit. The breakfast is great (nice omelettes).   Just need to pay attention to details. At check-in, stood at the front desk for ten mins while one person was being helped and two others messed on their computers. No greeting. No "I'll be with you in just a minute". Elevators super slow and the back bank don't pick you up (but no sign saying this). Finally took the stairs down and ended in the parking lot (no entrance to the lobby) locked out. Had to walk around to the front. No signs on the elevators saying they weren't functioning.  The thing I really can't forgive in a hotel of this size, though, is the completely non-functioning internet. Tried connecting as a hhonors member.
Manager Response: Sorry we failed you kskdmad,  I agree Wi-Fi is critical and we know coverage and bandwidth needs to improve.  Hilton has the latest specs announced and we are going to get the upgrade this September for $300,000.   Our experts tell me we will have coverage, speed and the ability to handle the ever higher number of devices.  If you get a chance to email me your dates of stay I will look into what happened with the elevators, but I don't recall any point when all the back (three) elevators were down.   My apologies.  Hope you enjoy the Holiday Inn, but if you choose to give us another try after the Wi-Fi upgrade please let me know.

Summary: Staff was great. Everyone was polite and helpful. I think the food and drinks were a little pricey.  The Micro wave oven is in a very low cupboard. That made it difficult for a senior citizen to use. It should be at counter height.
Manager Response: S2021SPlindac,  So glad you love the staff.    Thank goodness we include a full breakfast and complimentary drinks at the evening reception each night to help.  Breakfast at a full service hotel can be $20 given what we offer in Southern California.   Food cost, energy and wages and benefits mean even at the prices we charge we don't make a lot of money.

Summary: Stayed here for a total of 8 nights.  Rooms were spacious and comfortable.  Rooms were clean.  Complimentary breakfast provided lots of options. Would stay here again. Only downside was my room overlooked the highway and if you are a light sleeper, you can hear the cars at night.
Manager Response: Kimberly167,  Thank you for the business!   So happy to hear you have a great stay.   Know that on the Hilton.com site you can pick your specific room location  for check in and we do our best to have that room for you.   Call me if you need more info.   As a H Honors members you get best rates and digital check in.   Even using your phone vs. key if you wish.   Like the Jetsens.

Summary: Great experience, great location, very nice interior, wonderful accommodations for family events, helpful staff. Parking can get full quickly in evening. Overall would recommend, stay & refer  again. Thanks Embassy Suites!!
Manager Response: Zoeh528,  So glad you and your family had a great stay for the wedding and the staff was so helpful.

Summary: I've been at this location 10 years ago and it appears to have been updated. thankfully. Evening reception cocktails are decent but the chips and salsa with cheese and cheese cubes and veggies gets old after 2 days. The morning cook to order breakfast is a winner. Eggs over easy of even an egg white omelet was great. the AC worked well and wasn't noisy. The only negative was the street noise and I was up on the 8th floor.
Manager Response: Ronald K,  So glad you love the breakfast.   Go on Hilton.com in the future and pick your room with digital check in.   We will try our best to get you the specific room you pick away from the freeway.    We are in a great location right in the middle of OC, but we do have 55 next to us.

Summary: Enjoyed my stay st Embassy Suites like always !! The service was great and staff was friendly and attentive.  Location was great.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and location to family and friends.
Manager Response: 170normag,  Love hearing the service and staff was friendly and attentive.   Appreciate your sharing your good experience.

Summary: This is my second stay this summer.  We had such a great experience our first stay we decided to stay here for our second visit.  Laney at the front desk was very friendly and helpful in relocating us to a quieter room.  From a previous guest our sink was clogged with beach sand.  Maintenance came quickly and solved the problem quickly.   We had pleasant stay and the rooms are nice and clean.
Manager Response: Hockeyharts,  Yea Laney!   Yea maintenance!  Yea housekeeping!   And Yea hockeyharts!   We really appreciate your choosing us twice this summer.   Be well as school starts back up -- though the beaches are still very inviting in the fall.

Summary: We went for our daughters graduation which was located close to the college.  The breakfast and reception were excellent but the Internet in the rooms were not good at all.  Couldn't work in the room for Hilton Honors I think it should be a perk. We pay enough.
Manager Response: Gonzalo R.L,  We have a major Wi-Fi upgrade scheduled this September to improve coverage and bandwidth.

Summary: Very comfortable, nice living area, pull out couch, 2 T.V.'s, small kitchenette, coffee maker, refrigerator, family friendly, clean, spacious, indoor pool, hot tub, gym, free WiF, free breakfast with made to order omelettes, private parking, staffing nice and helpful, free happy hour
Manager Response: Suzett B,  Glad you had a great stay!

Summary: I usually love Embassy Suites but this one is by far the worst one i have stayed at. At times I couldn't believe that the Hilton would be associated with this place at all. The rooms were just remodeled and I would say overall it is a OK room. The room  was clean but the bathrooms are super tiny, the AC is controlled by the hotel and not the guest, the room was warm a d uncomfortable. I had called front desk and they sent someone up look at the AC unit, he said it is working fine, I asked well can I move to a different room and he said they were full. Each day i was there the hallways were full of trash and dirty breakfast plates which is a disgusting site while going to your room. The internet is non existent in this hotel, the paid parking lot is tiny and no open spots when
Manager Response: Diane_hhgold,  I'm sorry you had a bad experience and I apologize.   We will use your feedback to improve.   Your points are well taken,   room service trays and linen from the rooms should not be on the floors for a long time and the AC system is unusual, but generally works well.   That said we are looking at a new HVAC management system to enhance the efficiency.   We are also upgrading the Wi-Fi system to improve coverage and bandwidth this September.   Again thank you for your feedback and I'm sorry to loose you.   As the new gm I am focused on continual improvement and our service scores are up considerable over all, but your experience means we not consistent enough.   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com if I may ever be of service.

Summary: Love sitting by the koi pond communing with the turtles and fish in the midst of a busy day. The breakfast and happy hour times promote social interactions. Staff super helpful. The construction project was of minimal distraction.
Manager Response: KarenkP4856JU,  I do have a super staff.   They work hard to create great stays and it's fun when they connect well with guests like they did with you.  I appreciate your kind words.

Summary: I stayed at the hotel the week of July 11-15. The first night in my hotel room, I noticed a distinct moldy smell. I talked to the front desk the following morning and they apologized, said for me to check with them in the afternoon when I'm back from work about moving rooms. That afternoon, I asked the front desk and they said that all the rooms were full, but they would move me the following day. The person even said they would apply bonus honors points as compensation to my account for the inconvenience. The following day I stopped by the front desk after work to follow up. This time I spoke to Andy and he said that unfortunately the rooms were all taken again, that they didn't have any note of a request on my account, but this time they will make sure I get a new room by
Manager Response: Justin W,  Please expect to hear from us ASAP.  Sorry for the delay.

Summary: We were down in Santa Ana for the weekend to drop our daughter off the to UCI. The location was very convenient to the freeway and very close to the University. The staffs at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. We will definitely come back again!
Manager Response: lisanP9723TK,  So glad you had a great stay and your daughter is at UCI.   Please let me know if I can ever be of service.     Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: We paid for one room by that gave us a room that was under construction at the Emassby Suite.  The Hotel was under construction and we was not notify through the third party who book our room.  Please...Check to make sure the hotel that you book is not under construction. Awaken in the middle of the night with a loud sound it was pike broke and water backup from the sink. Smelling black and toliet water fill our living area sink... It was very stinky.  Terrible customer service...
Manager Response: Johnny,  I am sorry there was a plumbing emergency interrupting your stay.   I'm surprised you were not informed about renovation since we have had banner information on our site and have made all third party sites aware and have checked and find the notice on the sites.   Please contact me if I may be of further service.   I would think we provided service recovery (comp night and room move for a broken pipe).

Summary: There are now 5 night M-F dinner specials that change monthly in the Sweet Spot restaurant. Each one I have tried is excellent. This two room suite hotel has a staff that is the friendliest group I have ever been taken care of by. With the number of nights stayed in my business career that is a very complimentary statement. Please try this gem of a hotel very near SNA John Wayne airport and you will experience the great accommodations and kindness of the capable staff.
Manager Response: TravelerJCB,  Wow!   Thank you so much for sharing your experiences.   So happy to hear you love the nightly entr√©e specials, accommodations and the staff.

Summary: I went to this hotel with my two young daugters. The staff was very courteous and the suites were nice and comfortable. The only problems I ran into, my room was very loud due to the freeway. I had trouble sleeping because of it. And you have to pay for parking, but they were doing construction so parking was limitted. It took me a long time to find parking. Other than that, the hotel stay was fine and the brakfast was good as well.
Manager Response: dwaniques,  Glad you and your daughters had a good stay and found our staff courteous.  As for parking, if you find self park spots are full we will allow you to use valet for same price as self park.

Summary: Always a good experience. I know what I am getting. A comfortable room, good shower and towels, great cheese omelet breakfast and nice people! My son and I were able to stay in one room which was great. Couch, bed, 2 TVs, peace and quiet for both of us.
Manager Response: Robin N,  Happy we meet your expections again and again.

Summary: We've stayed at this property twice when visiting the area.  When traveling with children we love the Embassy Suites for extra space and the ability to have a separate space to be while the kids are ready for bed, but we are not.    The atrium of the hotel is one of my kids favorites!  They love being able to feed the fish in the little garden area.  They still talk about this and ask whenever we are headed to California if we can stay "where we get to feed the fish!"    The happy hour is very nice and on our second visit was more plentiful with veggies in addition to chips and salsa.  The drinks are delicious and generous.  We love that there is a shuttle available within 3 miles.  It is nice to have someone else drive when you are not familiar with the area.  The rooms are a
Manager Response: azboiler,  Could not have said it better myself!  Glad you and your family love the hotel and the fish.

Summary: The rooms are a bit dated.  They were clean and had no complaints about noise or comfort.  Parking is extra, Be prepared to pay and extra $22 daily for it.  This is an abuse from my point of view as it is not that close to the airport and other hotels much closer to the airport offer free for their guests. The morning breakfast is OK, mostly pre-made food served in large quantifies.
Manager Response: msmxtoo,  We charge $15 for self park and $22 for valet and all the full service hotels in the John Wayne/ OC Airport area charge.   That said it has helped us control who parks in our lot.  Unfortunately we historically had non-guests park in our lot and take uber or cab to airport to avoid parking fees.  It has also helped us monitor and provide valet to maximize parking.   I understand your concern, but we hope a full breakfast, suite vs. room and evening reception make us more valuable.

Summary: Just stayed for the weekend at this hotel with some buddies. Had an overall great experience! The valets Andrew, Kyle, and Darius were so helpful and were very knowledgable about all the perks the hotel offered. 5/5 rating and will definitely be back!
Manager Response: Davis B,  Thanks for the shout out for Andrew, Kyle and Darius!    I will see they are recognized and buy them lunch.  They are very attentive.

Summary Heading: If you need WiFi take care!
Summary: Terrible,terrible Internet experience, sign in complicated and very,very poor wifi signal my kids have to sit outside of the room to have a better signal every time you acces wifi have to sign in a complicated ritual again... other clean,excellent area,quit ,great breakfast, and personal housekeeping and breakfasts excellent people!!
Manager Response: Cesar V,  Terrible internet experience in some parts of the hotel will be addressed this September with a $300,000 upgrade to address coverage and bandwidth.     Love hearing you apprecitated the staff and their service.

Summary: Let me first start off by saying we were there during the construction.  After another reviewer's tips i requested a newly upgraded room. I am going to give the hotel the benefit of the doubt to say the rooms must not be updated yet and just the outside of the rooms were being worked on because the rooms were not upgraded there was glue keeping things together and cracks in the sink. In my opinion if you stay at one Embassy you have just about stayed at them all. So let me go onto the area and the restaurant which can differ. Its pretty centrally located as we went to the mall (we travel for tournaments often). The restaurant was horrible service it was so slow and they weren't taking my order I had to go the bar to order and all i wanted was a side garden salad.  It took 26
Manager Response: Sumibunni,  I am sorry you didn't have a great stay in all regards.    Most importantly your experience in the restaurant is most disturbing.    I would love to know more from you and hope you would take a minute and email me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com and tell me your name, date of stay and when you were dining in the restaurant.   This way I can zero in on what happened so we improve.    Our renovation will be completed the end of September.    Thanks in advance for the additional feedback.   I hope you try us again in the fall.    Let me know when you are coming to the area again.   I would like to make special arrangements for your next reservation.    Thank you,

Summary: Have used this hotel the last 3 times we went to California.  Rooms are large and clean. Having the complimentary breakfast is great! Will definitely stay again and will recommend to our friends and family.
Manager Response: 793annabelag,  Thank you for your continued patronage and the referrals!   We are working hard to do what we do well consistently and improve everyday.   Happy to know the team pleased you again and again.

Summary Heading: A Very Good Deal ... and close to airport
Summary: Excellent experience.  Ongoing construction work being managed with negligible impact on guests.  A VERY good buy.  Easy access with parking included in price.  Beautiful public spaces, and excellent amenities.  Don't miss the complimentary breakfast !!
Manager Response: Douglas,  So glad you used the room package that includes parking.   Great deal!

Summary: We stayed 5 nights here, during my daughters softball tournament.  The staff was extremely nice and helpful.  The breakfasts can't be beat, and the night time reception is a great unwind for the day.  Overall I would definetly recommend staying here.     The location was very convenient for us too.  Close to the airport, beach, mall, and freeway.
Manager Response: Jamie C,  So glad you and your family enjoyed your stay during the tournament.

Summary: Can't go wrong with Embassy Suites, when I travel with family this hotel is totally worth it...breakfast is always yummy! Room is spacious with living room so gives privacy and sofa folds out to a bed.
Manager Response: Rosie M,  You are so right -- Embassy is great for families... and we are so happy you had a 5-Star experience.

Summary: Quiet rooms were very welcoming after a long day. We could have slept until noon each day. Breakfast was very good with an omelette bar and lots of other items. Looking forward to staying here again. Very friendly staff.
Manager Response: Countrymusiclvr12,  Thank you for your feedback.   Love hearing our staff is "very friendly".   We look forward to your return.

Summary: Not happy with how I was treated when someone from a hotel window throw orange juice at my car and the staff didn't even care! Security was right there when it happened and management should of been called to see if my car was okay and at least offer a free car wash to me.
Manager Response: MelissahH3797IS,  Turns out it wasn't our security officer, but one of our bell staff.    I know you have had a discussion with Tim our Assistant General Manager and he tells me you and he came to a solution.   Unbelievable that a guest would through OJ from their room on your car as you drove by.   The team member did tell Tim right away so he knew of the incident.   We have coached him to engage right away with the guest and get name for follow up.   When Tim went out to the lot you had driven off.   Please let me know if I can be of further service, but my understanding is all is well other than the memory of the messy departure.

Summary: So where do I start?!  This place was awesome.  I have stayed in many Embassy Suites, but this one shines the brightest among them!  From the moment we drove up the very friendly valet welcoming us. The greeting from inside staff upon arriving was awesome, room awesome!  We bought dinner from the restaurant inside the hotel but ate it our in the atrium for our basketball team could just kinda hang out. The staff in the restaurant was very helpful.  Because we sat in the atrium, we were able to enjoy the managers reception for a little bit as well.  Our beds were comfy and our towels soft.  Breakfast in the morning perfect, except for one thing! I left my purse hanging on the chair when I left. As I was leaving the hotel I remembered.  The breakfast staff had thankfully picked it
Manager Response: radoki,  So glad you and the team had a great stay.   Our goal is awesome results and I will share your review with my wonderful team.

Summary: Nice hotel, great staff!  The place seemed a bit dated, but they were updating while I was there.  The shuttle service was great as was Scott, the driver.  The staff behind the desk was also nice.  LOVE the pillows!
Manager Response: DebRFranksville,  Love hearing about our staff and specifically Scott in such wonderful reviews.   I'm buying Scott lunch when I see him and we will share your review.  Thanks for the business.

Summary: We fell in love with the Embassy after this stay, we will only stay at Embassy Suites hotels from now on! The room was perfect, the staff was friendly And the food was excellent. We cannot wait to stay again.
Manager Response: 960tiffanid,  Wow!   Yes Embassy Suites is a great brand and we are trying to become one of the best.   Our staff takes great pride and we are getting more and more consistent.  Soon the renovation will be over and we will have great service and new rooms.   We look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Know before you schedule your stay
Summary: If your are using your Hilton Honors points for your stay - YOU MUST GO THROUGH THE Hilton Central Reservations department. Make sure there are TWO reservations made, one for your stay minus the points you are using and the second reservation for the points you are using to get your free night(s). It CANNOT be done afterwards and the 'property' cannot do it. We learned this the hard way as we had called Hilton Central Reservations but the person assisting us was very hard to understand and when we called again to confirm we were told everything was taken care of when it never was!  Also, we have heard they will HOPEFULLY be keeping around the fountains with the Koi pond and turtles. Let's hope they do as this is a main reason our kids and we love this hotel.
Manager Response: Gloria C,  Thanks for sharing the reservation process when using points.    We are still working on the atrium design, but we hope to keep the koi and turtles.

Summary: Spent the weekend here and booked a 2 queen room. When we arrived they had been deemed out of commission so the front desk team went above and beyond and decked us out with 2 rooms. The kids loved it! They felt like royalty so thank you! Thank you to Leo who checked us in and helped us out as we arrived very late!
Manager Response: RandoGirl,  Yes we had a plumbing issue and lost several two bedded suites.   Glad the team made the decision to give you two rooms and the kids loved it.   Leo is a great night auditor and he Made it Right for sure.

Summary: Poor Staff and Management lack of customer service. Needs to learn how to be more professional when dealing with clients. Never tell a customer that is checking in to step aside to help several other customers.
Manager Response: Huggs125,  Thank you for letting us know.  We got your Hilton survey and are reaching out.  I apologize for the poor service at check in.

Summary Heading: Dated, but clean and good price
Summary: We stayed here for a family trip to Disneyland in April 2016, and were quite happy with our accommodations.  Our room hadn't been updated in a while, but did feature flat screen TVs in the living room and bedroom.    We have stayed at this hotel several times, and would recommend it to anyone.
Manager Response: Jeff R,  Room renovation is well underway and will be done by mid-September.   Yes we were due and it's wonderful we are addressing.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, but beware of parking
Summary: This is a very nice hotel. The rooms are large 2 room suites. Very clean, quiet. The made to order breakfast is top-notch. The hotel is in a good location, especially if you are traveling in/out of the Santa Ana Airport. However, they have recently added a fee and entry release arm for parking. The parking arm going in is understandable, but you also need a keycard to go out. If your keycard does not work (which happened to me), you will be unable to get out of the parking structure without paying the steep $15 cost of parking or getting out of your car and flagging someone down to exit. I had 2 cars behind me so I could not simply back up. And there is no one there, besides valet at the front of the hotel entrance to assist. The parking spots are also extremely narrow. I have a
Manager Response: Cheryl A,  Thanks for your feedback.  Parking starting over a year ago and the reason one must use their hotel key to get out is that really is the only control in place to ensure you have stayed and paid the parking fee.    We just added new door locks with RFID keys which are amazing (no more strip to damage so no more coming to the desk when you key doesn't work-- YES!).   Unfortunately we are having some trouble with gates, but we will figure it out.   As for notice of parking fee -- it is on all sites and on confirmation, plus protocol when talking with a reservationist is to cover all fees.   So glad you like the hotel.

Summary: The hotel is under.repair which is needed. The most remarkable team in any hotel. From management to ANY one who was in staff. They were very intentional to assist you in whatever need you had. I have stayed in 3 in the area and the staff bring us back to this location! Especially the breakfast team from Chef to table service team
Manager Response: Bryanb453,  Thank you for documenting your great stay and the compliment about the staff.   We are trying hard to be our best and it's so fun to see you had a great stay.

Summary: This was a great family oriented hotel.  Staff was great and was an Oasis during our trip. It was close to Newport Beach and Huntington Beach.  You could go to expensive restaurants and bars or swim in the ocean and return to rest in you room priced for value.
Manager Response: Q7879VJfrankkm,  So true... thanks for letting everyone know!

Summary: Embassy Suites is one of my preferred hotel chains. This one did not disappoint! I was fortunate to book a room rate that included everything including parking. Parking is not free so keep that in mind when you book and look for room rates that include the parking. I chose my room ahead of time by checking in online with the Hilton Hhonors app. They gave me the keys when I checked in but we went out and didn't look at the room. When we came back several hours later and I tried to get into the room I wasn't able to. Turns out our room had been trashed by the previous guests and was not going to be available. They gave us a room on another floor close to the elevator like I wanted so all was well. They were good to deal with. I was also happy to get a goodie bag with 2 water
Manager Response: Smileytech,  So glad you had a wonderful stay finding all our services to be well done.  Thanks for choosing us and we look forward to your return.

Summary: This is another outstanding Embassy Suites, perfect for families and located just minutes from the Orange County airport. The rooms are clean, the service was great, and the breakfast is phenomenal (along with the evening reception). The business center is very convenient and the WiFi was nice and fast.  There are two minor things keeping the property from an Excellent rating, and both are relatively minor. First, the $15 daily parking fee. The fee is understandable considering the location, but it seems a little high considering you're not right next to the airport or the beach.   There's also a small indoor pool that seems a little out of place in beautiful Southern California, but perhaps space was an issue. There's a small fitness center adjacent to the pool, and it does
Manager Response: 56WALDORF,  Thank you for your review and feedback.   So glad your stay was pleasant and will seek us out again.   We look forward to your return.

Summary Heading: Didn't Want to Leave this Hotel!!
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for four nights. We stay in Hilton properties when ever we can, and Embassy Suites primarily. This is an exceptional Embassy. Operations Manager Tim McDonald and his staff do an amazing job. From the front desk and the guys in the valet parking to the managers reception and breakfast. They pay attention to details that make staying there very enjoyable. We had a great room, it was clean and well maintained by the hotel staff. The restaurant in the hotel was a pleasant experience also, good food and good prices. Very glad we stayed here and we would definitely stay here again!!
Manager Response: Tim M,   Our Tim is fairly new and it's great to see his impact.    He loves what he does and is a true professional who spreads the "warmth of hospitality" to both our guests and teammates.  We hope to see you again soon.   You could move in... we have two guests that have been here almost a year on business.   They have become part of our family.

Summary Heading: Underwhelmed from the moment we arrived but a comfortable bed!
Summary: We stayed 3 nights and from the moment we arrived it seemed nothing went right.   I picked my room and did the online check in.   When we arrived our roomed 1.5 hours late on being ready.   We had to sit in the lobby and wait.    The valet Ron was top notch.   Very helpful and went out of his way to make our stay as good as it could be.    We stayed in room 629 which was one of the newly remodeled rooms.  The remodel was ok, nothing special.  Clean carpet and new furniture.   The beds were very comfortable with new sheets and comforters.    One issue I had with this room was the wifi signal was weak in the living room and nonexistent in the bedroom.  We ended up using our phone data for Internet.
Manager Response: Brian M,  Sorry for the rate for the specific room you picked via digital check in.   I will follow up and see what caused the delay.    Also saw your survey through our email process... thanks for the feedback.   Always helps us continually improve.   Hope we didn't inconvenience you too much.  My apologies.

Summary Heading: Poor service and run down rooms.
Summary: Arrived at the hotel at around 5:00 for a 3:00 check in. Waited in a very long line for about 30 minutes. When it was my turn I was told our room was not ready. When I asked when it would be ready was told she had no idea. They were way behind and had been that way all afternoon. She took my number and said she would call when room was ready. I called Hilton to see what was going on. Customer service called and could not get anyone to answer. Customer service said they would have the manager follow up. As of when I write this review I have not been contacted.  At around 9:00 I had not received a phone call so I called and was told my room was ready. No apology for not calling. The room they gave us smelled horrible. We called down to the front desk and was told they could move
Manager Response: MTgirl5517,  My apologies for the poor service, late check in and lack of response from the hotel.  I understand I have lost a customer and I don't blame you, but my hope is you would contact me so I could learn more about your stay and address the results accordingly.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: The ES is located right off if the freeway, so the access was very convenient for the soccer tournament we were attending. I used the mobile check in app prior to my arrival so check in was a breeze, I basically just went to the front desk to pick up the room card.  The indoor atrium is very nice with a water feature with Koi fish and turtles. We stayed overnight at this location for a soccer tournament so there were alot of kids about. But we figured that would be the case due to the tournament. The property was currently being renovated but was not a disruption during our stay. Self parking fee is additional.  The room was a good size and easily slept our party of four. Our room, 1 room w/queen bed, living room with sofa sleeper,  small dining table and fridge was perfect. The
Manager Response: SoCaltravelerSD,  So glad you had a great stay and made us your home for the soccer tournament.   We really are a great location and hotel for families here for all OC has to offer.

Summary: Every time we would return late we had a very hard time to find an open space and they were very tight when we did find one .. The gate to come in and out was a little struggle as well felt like we had to jump off the car quick then jump back in
Manager Response: Diannam225,  Thank you for your feedback.   While you found few spaces late at night controlling who parks in our lot has helped a lot since before doing so we had lots of non guests taking up space.   We also added valet and when it's late and self park is full we will allow you to valet at the same self park rate.    Hope that helps.

Summary Heading: The perfect spot in Orange County. Centra to everything and very comfortable and clean!
Summary: We had a very relaxing visit to the OC The perfect spot in Orange County. Central to everything and very comfortable and clean! The hotel is going through a remodel but we were never unconveinienced by this. The wifi is my only complaint!
Manager Response: G4318URrebeccac,  Glad you had a great stay!   Wi-Fi upgrade is scheduled to add latest and greatest technology to improve coverage and bandwidth.    Will be completed by the end of Q3.

Summary: Anyone who knows me knows I already love Embassy Suites. It is my go to hotel anytime we have to stay out of town. This particular Embassy blew my mind away. The ambiance of the hotel is unmatched. The service of the staff is unparalleled. But what really takes the cake is that while we were there it was undergoing renovations and you would have never known. Nothing skipped a beat. Embassy again for the win!
Manager Response: Sharolc2016,  Your review made my day!   So glad we "blew you away" with great guest service.  I really take the bad ratings personally and I read yours after one where we blew it.  We try very hard and have a great team.   My goal is to create great stays for all and my team is willing so we will get there.   Thanks for being a loyal Embassy fan and I'm so happy we exceeded your expectations.

Summary: Excellent hotel that is near the Santa Anna Airport but far enough away that you don't hear the the planes.  Service was excellent from the time we were picked up at the airport to the check in, the hotel restaurant, the Mrg's Reception, the Complimentary breakfast, the check out and return to the airport.  Will stay there again when visiting Santa Anna area.
Manager Response: Richard W,  So glad you enjoyed your stay!

Summary Heading: This place is a huge disappointment, stay somewhere else
Summary: Here are the good things first since they are very few. Staff: The ones that want to provide good service do. The morning breakfast staff. Property: The atrium is nice Value: THere are a few freebies to take advantage of.  The not good: Greedy, poorly managed parking situation is a nightmare! The pay stations and gates are an afterthought that dont fit in the parking lot and make it very difficult to get in and out. Also, you have to do most of the work yourself with the parking permits and paying. A sheet of wallpaper, a few tiles and some paint covering up a bunch of broken down junk does not constitute a renovation. TVs dont work right, loud AC, corroded bath fixtures, backing up sinks and the ever-lingering smell of cigarettes are all still featured in the "renovated" rooms.
Manager Response: Hhonorsreview,  I apologize for the bad stay you had and I'm sorry we have lost a valued customer.    Clearly you didn't like the room you stayed in and my hope is you would take one more minute and tell me your name so I can use it to know what room you stayed in.   I checked the Hilton Service Survey's for a similar response which would have this information, but to date there isn't a survey.    We have gotten good feedback on this site from guests staying in rooms that have been done.   Unfortunately not all are done and yes we needed a renovation.     As for the restaurant poor food and service can happen and we will follow up.  Regarding pricing we are lower than other comparable restaurants in the area.   Orange County is expense, but we are comfortable we are priced right when my team delivers consistent food and service.  Our parking gates and procedures were added in late 2014 and there is no question the gates approached straight on are the easiest way to maneuver.  That said one exit and one entrance call for a turn and drivers find it difficult particularly using larger vehicles.  Controlling our parking lot and seeing all other full service hotels in the OC Airport market charging for parking is why we made the move and it has successfully helped us.   Our $15 charge compares to $45 at LAX.   The parking fee is here to stay.  Again I hope you give me your name and date of stay via email at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com and we will use your poor experience to improve.     Again I'm sorry we failed you so.

Summary Heading: Good value but a lot of room for improvement
Summary: This hotel is great for the price. When you look at the amenities at this property compared to similarly priced properties, this is a good value.   The good: breakfast, lobby area, pond area in atrium, indoor pool, staff friendliness, freeway access  The bad: Parking (cost-$15/day, space), shoddy maintenance work (room condition) and poor renovation, wifi is intermittent, workout area is humid, warm, and stuffy  Similar to how home renovations typically dump a lot of money into the kitchen and neglect other areas, I believe this property put a lot of money into the lobby but neglected a lot of other areas. The upkeep and attention to detail is lacking. Our room had a slight smell of cigarette smoke, telephone wall outlet detached from wall, cracks in bathroom sink, unpainted
Manager Response: Nvhank,  Thank you for the detailed review.   I arrived last October and as the new leader of this great team charged with leading a much needed renovation.    The rooms are being done now (started last December we will complete all rooms by the end of this December.     Public areas including the lobby, atrium, pool, exercise area, and restaurant/ bar will all be renovated next year.     We are "dumping" millions throughout the hotel to address all ills and the exercise room and issues in your room will be addressed.    (Could you email me your name and date of stay so I can follow up and know which room you reviewed?   My bet is we have not gotten to it yet.  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com).  Wi-Fi upgrade is scheduled for this fall to bring system up to latest and greatest.     January 1 our hotel became 100% non-smoking since it was the perfect time to do so (all new drapes, carpet, furniture, beds, etc.).   Guests who smoke in our rooms are charged $250 and it doesn't happen often, but when it does we penalize them and then use the fee to clean the room professionally.  So glad you found the staff helpful and the value meaningful.  I hope to hear from you soon so I can follow up.

Summary: When I went to check in at 3:00 I had to wait 2 hours in the lobby, got in line 3 times to check if my room was ready and didn't get my room. The first time i was told by someone who spoke to house keeping that my room, a specific room number, would be ready in 40 minutes. 40 minutes later I was told 10 min. 1 hr after my arrival I asked again, still not ready and since i saw a sign that said "ask me how I can make it right?" on the desk I asked what options do I have because I'm not satisfied with waiting for so long. I asked if they can get another Hilton room in the same are at the same rate if I wanted to leave and the answer I got from a man that I was assuming was the manager was "you are welcome to leave and if you want another Hilton at the same rate you have to arrange
Manager Response: JayLim06,  I apologize for the poor service you received waiting for your room.   Thank you for taking the time to provide valuable feedback and I will address with my team.

Summary: Stayed in suite with a view of the freeway and airplanes passing by, my two youngest kids got hours of entertainment watching the cars, trucks, and planes!  Breakfast was wonderful, and the kids got to feed the fish and turtles in the lobby koi pond every day with free food from the front desk!  Maintenance helped us by replacing coffee pot in our room and fixed a dresser that was opening by itself like it was haunted, but turns out it had been moved so was out of balance.  Both times maintenance came within 10 min of us reporting the issue.  Room was huge, plenty of room for my four kids and all our stuff (playpen, toddler cot, etc).  Also the staff was very friendly and good with the kids, especially the breakfast staff.  One named Paula was very friendly and got us the fish
Manager Response: Momofallboys2016,  So glad you and your family had a great time!   I was talking to another Mother and her two adult sons who were here and recall many stays together as a young family, now adults remembering this hotel and their great memories.   Your review points to how children are amazed while staying and it's so fun knowing the staff was so attentive.   Paula is amazing isn't she...

Summary: We stayed there a night before leaving to Cabo San Lucas for our vacation. We normally flew from LAX but this way was much better.  Avoid chaos at LAX.  The hotel is so close to the John Wayne Airport and so much easier.  Love the breakfast!
Manager Response: Yuri,  Have fun in Cabo!   Thanks for the great review.   John Wayne / OC Airport is a breeze compared to LAX and we are 5 minutes door to door.

Summary: The Embassy Suites near the John Wayne Airport is undergoing a minor upgrade.  Several services have improved to include their local shuttle which is much larger than a few months ago.  The hotel is well maintained; the staff very friendly; the manager's reception and breakfast are up to Hilton/Embassy Suites' usual standards.  Overall a great stay.  This location is highly recommended for those with early departures out of the John Wayne airport as you are about 5 minutes from dropping off your rental car or being at the departures area from the hotel doorstep, which is perfect for those early departures back to the east coast.  Only downside is the WiFi is being interrupted at times by the renovation.  We couldn't get ours to work for the stay.  Guests for whom WiFi is
Manager Response: POlaris600,  Thank you for the great review!   Yes, lots of improvements done and in process.   Wi-Fi upgrade will be completed the end of Q3.   We had the upgrade ready upgrading to the latest technology to improve coverage and bandwidth.    It is inconsistent in the bedroom, but tends to work well in the living room.   We will be done with all rooms end of September.   Glad you noticed the improvements.

Summary: I love the location of this hotel.   Great breakfast staff to fix an amazing buffet to start your day also.  Then close to  airport, shopping, beach, Disneyland.   You can be at all of these in low traffic times in 10 to 25 minutes.  The central location is truly a great benefit.
Manager Response: Richard N,  We are right in the middle of Orange County.    So glad you enjoyed your stay and our breakfast team got you off to a great start each morning.

Summary: The price looks good , but  they charge my parking for 3 times makes it $45 , after I called them , they said it took few days to get back to me.. Then I never receipt a receipt from them after 2 weeks of stay , I called for receipt, they hold me online for hours with music playing ... I won't recommend this place
Manager Response: Jane,  I apologize for the inconvenience we caused you after the stay regarding getting a receipt.   Please contact me directly at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com if you still need to discuss further.   Also if you could let me know how you made your reservation since we have been charging for parking, as you say $15 per night, for more than a year and believe we have this information on all sites and park of our protocol when booking with our reservations department.

Summary: Great location, whether you are flying out of John Wayne airport, or just doing business in the area.  I was able to get a great rate. The general manager was helping tend bar during the evening reception, and was very engaging.  All the staff were very friendly and helpful.
Manager Response: Dennis J F,  You caught me while our bartender was clearing tables... they are faster but I make a great drink!    Location, great team, I'm a lucky GM.    Thanks for the kind words.

Summary: The renovated hotel is very comfortable and a very good value. The renovated rooms are very comfortable and roomy, well appointed. Hotel conveniently located. Staff very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was very good.
Manager Response: W1521IEjamesf,  So glad you had a great stay and found the staff, room location and breakfast to meet and exceed your needs!

Summary: We haven't stayed here in a year and now I remember why. It needs a much needed update. The rooms are dirty and showing much wear and tear. Especially the bathrooms. They are also very small. The frames around the doors are dingy and cracked and dirty. The beds are so uncomfortable and the furniture needs to be cleaned and updated as well. We won't be staying here again. Plus they now add a parking fee where they never used to do that before. The breakfast was out of oatmeal at 8am. And the omelettes were not cooked all the way through. Needs a good over hall.
Manager Response: AJZAYAH,  Thanks for the feedback.    We are in the process of renovating all our rooms including furniture, all surfaces, bathroom floor, paint, hardware including a great shower head, new beds, artwork, lighting, drapes, mirrors and amenities.   Yes we were very ready.  Down to the 5th floor and we will be done by the end of September.  I will share your comments with my Chef, we usually nail breakfast with top scores for the whole brand.   Must have had a few issues that morning.  I apologize.

Summary Heading: great hotel - but avoid patio room
Summary: Wonderful breakfast with amazing made to order omelettes. Nice large suites with lots of room to spread out, and includes microwave and small frig and sofabed, although sofabed is not comfortable. Evening reception is nice, but same nachos, fruit every evening, although the complimentary cocktails were nice. Avoid the patio rooms because debris from above keeps showing up on the patio and housekeeping doesn't clean that area, and the patio room we had was directly above a ballroom which held a loud party one of the nights of our stay. Hotel location was great: about 20 minutes from Disneyland and from UC Irvine, 30 minutes from Huntington beach
Manager Response: Elizabeth,  Thank you for you review.   Glad you found some "wonderful" results, but noted the balcony not being cleaned.   We are working to clean them consistently, but we sure didn't for your suite during your stay.    We will watch more closely.   I know some guests enjoy birds on the railing singing but of course they leave "deposits" faster than we clean at times.   Our weather is amazing and having the sliding door open at times is a plus of our old wonderful hotel.

Summary: I was traveling on business alone and had several issues of being approached by vagrants in the parking lot. Overall feeling of not being safe. Room wasn't cleaned daily. WiFi was horrible. Only positive was the breakfast and evening reception staff.
Manager Response: 973yvonney,  I apologize for your experience in the parking lot.   Our parking gates have helped us control our parking lot much better than before, but I do Know homeless walk through our parking lot from time to time going through our trash cans, etc.    Please pull into our port and let us park your car in valet if you ever see anything that concerns you.   That said I don't want anyone hanging around our property and we take keeping them off our property seriously.   We invite Santa Ana officers to join us for breakfast anytime and drive through when in the neighborhood and this presence, our valet team and our security efforts are helping.    Again when you see anything, don't park and drive to our entrance even if you leave your car there if valet isn't available.   Your safety is important.    Again thank you for your feedback.

Summary: Wouldn't go out of my way to stay here.  It's convenient to John Wayne Airport but didn't have a good internet connection, lights not working and one was hanging from the ceiling.   TV in bedroom wasn't working either.   I was only here for one night on business and usually stay at a Marriott which is what I would chose in the future.
Manager Response: Elizabeth S,  Thanks for the feedback.  I'm sorry your room was in poor condition during your stay and their is no excuse.   Please contact me at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com so I can make it up to you.    Our renovation will be over in September, though in the condition you describe your room we may be old, but everything should be clean and in working order.   We will do better.  Your moving back to Marriott points to how important it is to get it right the first time.   I hope you contact me.

Summary: Upon checkin staff was extremely courteous even changing my room from a double bed to a king upon my request. Room was acceptable however patio door was quit dirty. Evening reception was nice. Bartender was extremely pleasant. Breakfast had vast choices and was quite tasty.  Restuarant (sports bar) had wonderful service and good food.
Manager Response: Airbell96,  So glad you found our staff and various restaurant offerings to be good.  We will address the balcony -- on going task to keep up with the birds, though I love their singing.   Thanks for the feedback.

Summary Heading: Poor Service for a Hilton Company
Summary: Poor customer service from the time I arrived at the airport until I left to the airport. Staff did not alert shuttle that I arrived and I was stranded at the airport for an hour. All the staff said was he is on his way. Sure he was!!!
Manager Response: K1336DHgaryf,  I apologize for the poor airport pick up service you received.   It is not our intent and we will review what happened and see what caused the delay and lack of potential other solutions.   Please contact me at 714-241-3330 if you would like to discuss further.

Summary: Upon arriving I was immediately disappointed to find out that I was having to pay 15$/night for parking alone. For someone who stays in hotel a lot due to travel, this is an expense that can add up quickly. My check in process was quick and efficient, and my room was ready as soon as i got there. The hotel has a great pool/hot tub (Go later in the evening around 8 or 9pm to avoid the pool being filled with little kids). My room was wonderful, however it was FREEZING. There was no way to adjust the temperature in my room which made for little sleep because i was so cold. If you get cold easily, I recommend getting a space heater, didn't know until i left they offered them. The complimentary evening reception is a huge reason i love Embassy suites, the food was delicious and the
Manager Response: Alisha P,  Thank you so much for the feedback.   I am so happy to know we nailed it regarding our breakfast and evening reception.   Yes, we pour a good drink, but appropriately so and we pride ourselves on finding the best ingredients so our food is good, coffee gets great reviews and our wines, beers and various alcohols are of good quality.   I'm working on some HVAC improvements during this year (hope to complete installing new thermostats in the fall).   As for parking we made the change late 2014 finding all other full service hotels in the market also do so.   It has helped us control who parks in our lot and add valet with out adding it to our room rates.    We have put our parking details on all our websites, reservation confirmations and reservation protocol.   Please let me know where or how you made your reservation and I will follow up.   My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com.

Summary: I love this hotel and stay here often but this time I had a bad experience. They changed their parking policy. Now youhave to pay for parking - ridiculous! And even worse I was awakened by the sound of loud driulling and constuction on the room directly above mine. I wish they would have told me there would be construction taking place on that floor. Even if they gave me the option of choosing a room that was farther away from the construction I would have been happy.
Manager Response: Keith H,  I apologize for the poor experience during your stay.   I will respond via email since I also believe completed a survey sent to you.   I will see that we make the construction noise inconvenience up to you.   As for the parking, we have made that business decision and will continue to charge as do the other full service hotels around OC Airport.   I hope our wonderful breakfast and reception along with a two room suite still offer great value vs. the competition where both charges per person can exceed significant additional cost.

Summary: I really enjoyed staying at embassy suites at Santa Ana. My family enjoyed the suites and the food. I did enjoy the gym and pool. The thing that was not comfortable was the guest in the top floor. They were running and jumping all night long.
Manager Response: S1470CKalim,  Glad you had a great stay.   I'm sorry there were guests disturbing you on the 10th floor.   While we hope guests respect other guests we do at times have to talk with some customers to stop inconsiderate behavior.   Our managers and security will always get kids and adults to quiet down.

Summary: I have stayed in Hilton properties for the last 29 year.  This is the worst I've ever stayed it.  It is old, musty and in serious need for a remodel.  To be fair, part of one floor was in process of remodeling - so if you stay, ask for a remodeled room
Manager Response: Steve P,  Thanks for the feedback.   We are working as fast as we can and will be 100% by mid-September.    See you then.

Summary: Excellent experience, location, very and customer service was AWESOME! Parking could be better, however the parking staff is very kind. Breakfast and Happy hour is a very great treat. The hotel is a stone throw from the airport and from the mall. the beaches are with 10 miles away and LA is an 30-40 minute drive north on the interstate. Major attraction such as Knotts Berry Farm is 25 minute drive. Great location!!!
