Manager Response: Rodricklh,  Could not have said it better myself.    Glad you had a great time.

Summary: It's big enough where you don't hear everything but personable to accomodate your entire family.  Great breakfast! Staff very accommodating. Stayed here on several occasions and would recommend to anyone.
Manager Response: Leonac88,  Glad you like us.   I will share your compliments to my fine staff.

Summary: When in doubt, I always book a Hilton.   I will recommend this hotel because of the value and quality of the stay and the service too, let's not forget the location and easy access to the freeway and shopping mall etc.
Manager Response: Sue F,  Thanks for the business and review.   We do have a great location.   Minutes from Disney, Airport and Beaches.

Summary: Have stayed at this hotel several times. It is currently under going a renovation but it is with respect to the guests and not intrusive. The breakfast is plentiful. The pool is cold. In the past I have not been charged for the parking. $15 per day. This time I was. It was not expected and a surprise. The front desk was not open to discussion. I might not stay here again because of this. I felt cheated. If parking is part of the price to stay here they need to let us know when booking the reservation because that was not the policy in the past.
Manager Response: Scott S,  We have been charging for over a year and all our sites have the parking fee information and our confirmations do as well.    Our protocol with calls for reservations is to also discuss the parking charge so I'm sorry you were surprised.   It is also something we train our staff to talk about at check in.   All of the full service hotels around OC Airport also charge and we were the last to do so, but it has helped us control our parking lot much better and provide valet.  How did you make your reservation so I can check and see what happened?

Summary: I have stayed at all the Embassy Suites in the area but this particular Embassy Suites is not one of my favorites. This hotel needs upgrades.  The bathrooms were extremely small and there is no way to adjust the temperature.  The kids were a cold at night.  It was very hard to find parking late in the evening even though it cost us $15 a night for parking.  I would probably not stay at this hotel again if I could help it.
Manager Response: looking4hoteldeal,  Thank you for your feedback. I apologize for the inconvenience.   We use what our guests think to improve our property.  Upgrades are in works to address rooms and HVAC.   As for parking, all the full service hotels charge for parking in our market.   Our $15 by OC compares with $45 by LAX and we have seen significant improvement since adding the fee and control gates more than a year ago.   Prior to having the controls our challenge was non-guests parking in our lot (some leaving cars and going to the airport to avoid paying to park).   Later at night when everyone is back from daily events having valet is really helpful too and if you can't find a space we will honor the self park fee even for valet.  If that's a deal killing for some I understand.  We note the parking fee on all our sites and reservation confirmations.

Summary: Embassy provided this link so I will evaluate honestly.  Had trouble with them not fixing the thermostat even thought it was reported twice. Wanted to eat pizza in atrium but since we did not purchase it from the hotel I was insulted by a staff member  in front of my family that I did not read a 5"x 8" sign stating that it was prohibited- it was 8:30 at night and not a soul in the atrium (the atrium itself is very nice)  Overall not a good experience
Manager Response: Damel D,  I apologize for the inconvenience with your thermostat and the pizza event.    I've got a great restaurant with wonderful food.   Our chef and his team are so good even locals eat here.   Suggest our pizza next time -- it's really good, but if you like a delivery pizza please eat it in your suite.    If you have further question please give me a call at 714-241-3330.

Summary: This hotel was very clean. The staff is friendly and happy. Food during breakfast was good and worm. Great environment to stay during vacation or business. Recommend this place and would definitely comeback.
Manager Response: DanieladW852601,  Thank you so much for your feedback.  We love when our efforts create the results you describe.  We look forward to your next stay.

Summary Heading: Make it right is a farce
Summary: Stayed at hotel on night before flying out of SNA.  Checked in around 9:00.  I am a hhonors member and have preferences set for high floor away from elevators.  This was even more important since I was travelling with small children who would sleep in the front room.  I asked the host if she could switch rooms due to my preferences and children.  She said the hotel was sold out.  I asked If I got the last room, she said no.  She offered no further accomidations despite pointing out the hotel's make it right policy moments earlier.  30 minutes later my wife saw a crowd of people checking in.    Throughout the night -the kids woke up three times due to noise -the TVs both lost connections regularly -the microwave didn't work -the internet didn't work (poor range).  I needed to
Manager Response: CPfoutz,  My email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com and my hope is you would email me so I can Make It Right.   I apologize my team who had two opportunities to do so didn't understand your inconvenience and respond to it appropriately.   I look forward to hearing from you.

Summary: Room service hit and miss. Overall a very nice place, great omelette station in the morning, good selection of fruits and yogurts. All staff very friendly and accomodating. In midst of remodeling, love the smell of paint. I don't know what was premium about the room but I can't complain about the room but I didn't notice any thing special .
Manager Response: TexasDave9,  Thanks for your feedback and so happy you loved the staff, breakfast, and I noted opportunities regarding room service consistently.   The 10th floor Premium Rooms currently have a selection of beverages and a upgraded coffee maker.   We are in the process of adding a tray of snacks and cold drinks that replace a vending machine (with code for 10th floor guests) that no longer works and the maker closed up shop.

Summary: We stayed here to visit the "Mouse." The atrium was spectacular & exactly what we expected from Embassy Suites.  The rooms on the other hand are not up to par. I realize they are refurbishing right now, which I hope includes a complete gut and rehab of the bathroom. It was honestly the smallest bathroom I've ever seen! The inside doors squeaked and were very difficult to close at all.  The room was clean enough, but I hope their idea of updating isn't just putting granite counters in the bathroom. The bathroom had visible signs of grime and attempts to cover this with white grout/sealant.  The back door of the bathroom had a huge hole in it which was patched.  The staff was amazing, as usual for an Embassy Suites.  Especially Joe at the front desk, which turned out we knew his
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have to pay for parking $15 per night for self-parking, $19 for valet. Breakfast included.  Staff is nice, esp. randy. Checked in late and there was no room although we had made a reservation but the problem was solved quickly.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The only complain we had is that bathroom was tiny. It was difficult for a woman to put on her makeup.  Every one of the staff was awesome.   the Evening snacks and drink were often.  The view from our room was awesome.
Manager Response: Paul C,  Yes, our bathroom is on the small side.    Our renovation is underway, and it will be    done in September, and we are adding mirror, lighting, table and bench for putting on make up.   Good news is the room design was done by a talented woman.   So glad you loved the staff, reception and view.

Summary: Excellent service and very friendly attitude. Best valet service ever, as a lifetime Hilton diamond I have experienced many valet services, but this was over the top service. He was Johnny on the spot whenever car was needed. Will frequent this hotel whenever in area
Manager Response: Mark W,  Thanks for your feedback about Darius's great service.   I will share your compliment with him ASAP.   He is outstanding and it's great you took the time to tell us.   Also thanks for you loyal Hilton patronage.   We love our Diamond guests!

Summary: Excellent location next to freeway easy access in and out of town near Airport breakfast was excellent Emily and Frank at the front desk were wonderful to deal with also Jose and Ruben at the sport bar and grill were helpful and friendly
Manager Response: Dear Kimberlydawn,  So glad you had a great stay!    I will share your wonderful comments about Emily, Frank, Jose and Ruben.  We have a great team and I love that these top teammates made a personal connection.  Michael

Summary: My husband and I were attending a wedding close by the hotel and wanted to check in early so we could get ready at the hotel rather than at home. Mid-week I made a couple of phone calls to the hotel with my request and no guarantee could be made for early check in, it was only notated that I called. The day before I was to arrive I did my online check-in for room selection and then contacted the hotel again to see about checking in early. Again I was told they were sold out and to call back tomorrow. Well you could now see my frustration since I needed to know one way or another. Morning of my arrival I contacted the hotel and asked to speak to the  manager Frank. After explaining how frustrated I was he apologized and said he couldn't give me the room I had selected but was
Manager Response: Dear Christy T,  So glad Frank and Dani were able to meet the need for your early arrival and your stay was amazing.   I will share your comments with them both.    Exciting to see Dani, who is new is already sharing the Hilton warmth of hospitality.   Weddings are great events and it's great you chose to share some time with us.  Michael

Summary: The hotel is clean. Parking is considerably tight, especially for the $15 additional fee that is charged. Queen beds are not queen size, but should be considered a full. Bathrooms are disproportionate to the size of the room, especially having one sink. Breakfast was very good. Wifi is horrible. Basically, this hotel is overpriced with not much perks beyond breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear OWH03,  Sorry you thought we were overpriced.   Embassy has built a solid loyal fan base since we are fun service, provide a wonderful breakfast, cocktail reception each evening and a two room suite at one price.    All of our competition around OC Airport charges for parking and it has helped us ensure only those using our hotel park in our lot.   Historically when full we ran out of parking.   Don't now.   Also have valet so it's here to stay.   I've got a Wi-Fi upgrade in process with the renovation which will be done the end of September to address ever increasing bandwidth needs and coverage.   The rooms with two beds have Serta queen sized beds, new as we work thorough the renovation and the kings are California Kings.   You are right the bathrooms are small since we are nearly 30 years old and the walls are all concrete so that will not change, though we are remodeling each, but if that's a deal breaker I get it.  Michael

Summary: My wife and I made a quick trip to Orange County. The purpose was to use our season passes for Disneyland. We have stayed at this Embassy Suites several times. It's very close to John Wayne Airport (SNA) and about a 10 mile drive to Disneyland. Had a great visit.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Excellent stay and I would stay again it is very close to my office in Irvine. Every thing was as expected and very nice as usual. The complimentary happy hour is always nice along with the complimentary breakfast.
Manager Response: Dear Michael K,  Great having you stay with us.   Sounds like you are making us your home when you work at the Irvine office.   I think we have the best staff of any Embassy Suites and I am so proud of how they take care of our corporate guests.  Thanks for choosing us.  Michael A

Summary: I stayed only one night arriving late and leaving early the next morning.  The suite arrangement (BR plus LR) would have accommodated a small family even though the BA was a little on the small side.  There is a renovation going on but not on my floor so did not have any issue.  Cooked to order breakfast was provided.  If you take out coffee, be careful as the lid pops open easily when you squeeze the cup even just a little as you get it out of the cup holder in the car.  I stained my shirt going to the meeting in the morning so needed to change the shirt quickly.  That was the only "complaint" I have.  I would definitely stay again but will be careful about the coffee cup.
Manager Response: Beenthere111,  Thanks for the heads up on the coffee.   I will do some testing.   I've always got a tide stick for all my shirt spills.   Hate when that happens. ;0)  Michael

Summary: The price of hotels in parts of California is astronomical. It is difficult to find some good hotels that won't break the bank. This is one of them. The rooms were great, the breakfast extraordinary, the staff was tremendous. I have stayed at  many Embassy suites, and this ranks at the top of the list.
Manager Response: Thanks Ruth Z,  Glad you found good value on your stay.  Your "this ES ranks at the top of the list" made my day!   I shared your comment yesterday at a team member luncheon.  Staff loved it.  Michael

Summary Heading: Santa Ana Embassy Suites, A Very Good Place to Stay
Summary: This is my third time that I have been at this hotel in Santa Ana, CA. Although this time the hotel is going through a building remodeling, the premises were clean, the service was pleasant and the suite price was attractive.
Manager Response: Dear Miguel Oscar Q,  Thank you for your loyal patronage!    Renovation of the rooms will be done the end of September.   Glad you like what we are doing.  Michael

Summary: Hilton Diamond member here. I was here for a one day stay by car. The parking was $15 in a cramped lot. Somewhat understandable because you are near an airport.  Many of the Embassy Suites have cramped bathrooms and this was no exception. However, the shower was hot and there were bathroom fans to prevent steaming.  Jacuzzi is only warm, not hot- that was fine by me.  I got there too late for the manager's evening snacks. However, the breakfast is a bit different than some other Embassy Suites in that their yogurt is out of a tub and some of the hot entrees are separate from the made to order omelette area. I found it a very good breakfast- even for Embassy Suites.
Manager Response: Dear BJBrew,  Thanks for the feedback.   Really appreciate the detailed review.   Glad you loved the breakfast.   My team and Executive Chef really focus on getting our guests a great breakfast selection.   The Greek yogurt by the oatmeal is bulk, but we also have a selection of individual yogurt by the fruit and cereal.  Congrats on your Diamond status.  Let me know if I may ever be of help.     Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com  Michael

Summary: Too many bad things to list.  Would like to discuss with hotel mgmt staff.  Rooms were drenched in cigarette smoke, staff was non responsive, elusive, unhelpful, and took too long to check us in.  We were charged more for half a day room rate than we were for a full day.  Told we could not use shuttle for our wedding party because it was 1 mile out of radius.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Had a bad experience at this hotel. The rooms were overcharged and the hotel room left more to be desired. The lobby and dining area do not reflect the guest rooms as it is a beautiful lobby. Also, my room never connected to Wi-Fi. The front desk said they couldnt do anything about it.    I would not recommend this hotel as it does not appropriately reflect the Hilton brand image.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First off, the hotel is being refurbished, so take this review with that in mind.  Unfortunately, I got an old room that needs to be updated.  The thermostat in the room would turn on the air conditioner only when then temperature was changed.  While Embassy Suites' beds are comfortable, my room was drab and it is clear to see why the hotel is being refurbished.  One afternoon, I returned early to my room to take a nap.  However, the room next to mine was being refurbished, so there was  a lot of construction noise that prevented any rest.  It would have been good to have been warned that there would be construction in the next or nearby rooms.  Would have been even better if construction was limited to certain floors.
Manager Response: Craig M,  Please call me the next time you are coming to my hotel.   I would like to focus on where you stay so you can try a new room.   My direct line is 714-241-3330.   Yes we needed to renovate and all rooms will be done end of September.   I look forward to hearing from you.  Michael

Summary: Very pleasant stay thus far. Living room still on the dark side so not sure my room has been remodeled yet. The room is clean the maid service is fantastic she never misses a thing. The whole hotel staff very pleasant and  accomodating The perfect stay to put me into diamond status. Thanks to John at the front desk for his assistance.
Manager Response: Dear Sr Manager,  So glad you are enjoying your stay.   I will share your thanks to John, he is special.  And congrats on your Diamond status!   Thank you for your loyal patronage.

Summary: At any time I walked by a staff member they were courteous in a very natural, unpretentious way. Rooms are large but bathrooms are very small. Hotel is in the midst of a refresh, but I am uncertain of the magnitude of the activities. Now they charge for parking which is frustrating.
Manager Response: Dear William,  So glad you are finding the staff to be upbeat, genuine and helpful.   Our renovation in the rooms includes: all surfaces (carpet a year ago), all new furniture (sofa & comfort chair we done a year ago), drapes, art, lighting, lots of electrical plugs and we are upgrading WiFi.   Will be done the end of September.

Summary: One of the best hotels I've  stayed at as a business traveler. The room was just renovated. I love the bed, new decor, cook to order breakfast and social  hr with drinks. They also have dinner specials. I had a full rack of ribs and side for $20. Im picky about bbq and ribs. Thumbs up
Manager Response: Dear Miss T,  You made my day!   The dinner specials are pretty new -- about 6 weeks and the Chef and our Cooks are hitting a home run Monday - Friday.   We have lots of guests like you during the week and the variety and creativity has been fantastic.   I love all of them, the portions are generous, ingredients so good, and each special is a winner.   If you visit the omelets station in the morning Anwar our Chef is there most mornings.  He spent years at several San Francisco grand hotels so we are very lucky to have him.

Summary: NO HEATING/AC controls in ROOMS! Main building won't turn heat on until outside temp reaches 55 degrees. It must reach 70 for A/C to go on. Signs in rooms say between 55-70 degrees they just pump in neutral air. Spent night in 60.8 degrees! Why? It didn't reach 55 degrees....the point they turn on a/c. This is not a joke post; it's real.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stayed here for 4 nights while on a recent business trip and hope I get a chance to stay again.  My room was very spacious, clean, and nicely decorated.  The breakfast was absolutely wonderful, and the evening happy hour in the lobby was also very nice.  I used the fitness center every day which had very nice new Precor equipment.  The pool also looked very nice but I did not swim.  I ate at the restaurant twice which had very tasty food.  There is also a business center with several computers and a printer that is very handy.  The people who work at the hotel were all very nice and extremely committed to resolving any problems guests may encounter (I had a problem with my TV when I first arrived and maintenance was there to fix it within minutes).  I was on the 8th floor
Manager Response: Dear MDDChicago,  Thank you for spreading the word and noticing my team's efforts.    We try to hire warm, happy people who like to help our guests have the best stay possible and then do all we can to set them up for success.   Our reviews and service scores all point to it working consistently and we are having fun going from good to great.   We are also spending a lot of money and energy renovating and innovating so our hotel rooms are new and meet the needs of today and tomorrow and our amenities top notch.   And yes we mess up (TV not working), but a quick fix and finding ways to say "yes" make all the difference.  Hope you get a chance to come back soon.

Summary Heading: Stay in Embassy Suite for business meeting
Summary: Very disappointed in the quality of this hotel, especially the room quality.  Room was not pleasant.  Could not control room temperature.  Light switch did not work in bedroom.  Could not turn off exhaust fan in bathroom.  Bathroom was too small. Front room was too dark.
Manager Response: Amitava,  I'm sorry you didn't like the room.    We are in the process of renovating our rooms with all new lighting, new design, furniture, etc. so the future is bright.    As for the light switch not working we always focus on keeping our rooms very clean and in good working order so we will check the log regarding any requests for work orders this past weekend.   Thanks for your feedback.   We are also working on the HVAC to improve function.

Summary: Great hotel, very nice evening reception with good alcohol, and GREAT breakfast in the morning. Rooms really are nice suites. Just love staying at this brand. the staff was also very professional and kind. the hotel is pleasant, historic. I would definitely stay here again if I am in town.
Manager Response: PK,  Thanks for staying with us and we are so pleased you enjoyed your room, evening reception, breakfast and most importantly our staff's service.

Summary: Glad to be a GOLD  Hilton honors member. Check-in was quick&easy. The strawberries up-grade was a big hit with us!!! I wish we could have a later check out,but overall it was a great experience for us. The breakfast buffet was filled with healthy choices  Love the indoor pool&amenities. Nice variety of drinks at the open bar. I would book this hotel again.
Manager Response: Dayvena,  So happy you had a great stay and the various amenities were well done.  Thanks for the feedback and choosing us.  We look forward to your next visit.

Summary: The atrium was beautiful with lush green plants, Koi fish and painted turtle swimming in the pond. The staff was friendly and helpful. We were there for a family Wedding in the area. I chose the hotel I love Embassy Suites for the room size and full breakfest. The rest of our group was impressed with my choice. At breakfast the staff was friendly made time to speak to the guests asking about our stay what brought us to the hotel. Our rooms were clean and spacious. The refrigerator and microwave was great for my family.
Manager Response: Julie721,  So happy you and your family loved our hotel and staff.

Summary: I spent three nights at this hotel and loved every moment.  The hotel is in the middle of a remodel but you would never know it because the rooms involved are sectioned off and none of the rest of the hotel is effected.  The beds are incredibly comfortable and loaded with pillows that have varying degrees of firmness. The complementary breakfast far exceeds that found at other hotels and included made to order omelets, pancakes, waffles, French toast, bacon, sausage, fried potato, pastries, fresh fruit, a variety of juices, sodas, coffee and tea. And if your tired after a long day, unwind at the evening reception and enjoy the open bar!  That's right! Free drinks!!  For two hours. Monday - Thursday.  My only complaint is the Grille.  I ordered the wings and they were horrible.
Manager Response: James P,  Thank you for the feedback.  So happy we exceeded your expectations.   I will work with the chef and wings are in my future today.

Summary: From the beginning it was great Scott picked us up from the airport to Michael at check in to Paula at breakfast very inviting. We also enjoyed to feed the turtles and fishes I just hope that this Embassy does not change that in the future
Manager Response: Summer S,  I will share your comments with Scott, Michael T and Paula and celebrate their great service.   We are renovating all our rooms right now and atrium update is under design.   I will share your hope to keep the fish (hearing that a lot).    I personally agree and am a good advocate.

Summary: Staying long term on business assignment. Have never stayed at a hotel with kinder more helpful staff. The breakfast crew particularly Angela, Paula and Maria take care of customers as if they were family. Which is a pretty nice feeling when away from home on business travel. The in hotel Sweet Spot restaurant has great food and equally wonderful staff. They recently implemented 5 night dinner specials the quality of which rivals fancy high end restaurants but at reasonable prices. The rest of the menu is high quality at good prices as well served quickly. Ianna of the daytime staff is extremely attentive to customer desires and has a good sized lunch time local crowd. The later staff Jose, Justin, Ruben, Mariella, Roberto and Ricardo are all excellent at keeping customers very
Manager Response: TravelerJCB,  Wow!   Thank you for your kind comments.   I sense I know who you are since you have made our hotel your home away from home for months.    We are honored you have chosen our property and I'm so happy are team has make your home very comfortable.    I appreciate the "plug", but my team deservers all the credit.    We have lots of wonderful people working in all departments and they all share a willingness to give their best.   I'm lucky to lead such a great team.    They consistently do all they can to provide the best possible service and product.   We are failing less and less and I'm glad many are noticing.

Summary: Overall my family was satisfied with Embassy Suites.  Connectivity to the internet was very spotty.  At times, my phone would say I was connected but I wasn't.  There was a very large group of kids at the hotel.  My own kids were questioned multiple times if they were with that party.  When my kids answered no, staff would reply "are you sure."
Manager Response: I'm sorry your kids were "swept with a wide broom" during your stay.    A few weekends ago we had multiple rooms with children who needing parenting and their behavior was inconveniencing many of our guests.   In this case all the reservations were made separately so it was not an organized group with leaders.   Unfortunately not all parents are responsible like you and that Saturday was very unusual for us.  Frankly we should have evicted the guests and will if needed in the future.  Our goal is to be a great place that's fun, yet safe and respectful so everyone has a great time.

Summary: Stayed at this property from Dec 22 to Dec 31, 2015 on a trip to Disneyland, Universal and Seaworld. Breakfast is made to order and is simply GREAT lots of selection of food, fruits, juices. Kids really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Staff is friendly and helpful. Try to be early for the breakfast if coming late then there will be big line up for made to order Eggs.  Kids did enjoy the evening reception.  Overall an excellent experience. Will stay again!
Manager Response: Sami M,  Wow!   I love that you stayed over the holidays in December and remembered your stay so well you did the review now!    We try to create great memories.   So glad your family had a wonderful time.  Priceless.

Summary Heading: Feeling like a second class citizen at hotel
Summary: I was asked to show my breakfast card to the Breakfast Supervisor as she walked around.  As she turned away from me she asked the others if they were enjoying their breakfast.  Terrible treatment.  When I was told to return to the front desk to switch rooms I was told that the room was given away to another guest even though I showed up 30 minutes earlier than requested.  The treatment was terrible.
Manager Response: Sophiaw39,  Sorry for the mix up on the room, were you using E Key in?  My apologies you didn't get the original room you picked.   As for asking to see your breakfast coupon we do try to ask all guests, though I know the team tends to remember returning guests who they already know.  If we don't ask to see the coupons at breakfast and at the evening reception we get people who aren't staying with us and we don't want that for two reasons.   One, we want to focus on our paying customers and two those who steal drive up our costs and we don't want to pass that onto our customers.

Summary: Love the Embassy Suites hotel layouts...the two room suite with wet bar, refrigerator, and separate bedroom, the rooms are spacious.  The Santa Ana Embassy Suites is a tired property, the furniture had seen better days, but happily the bed was good.  The room could have been cleaner.  I never could get the wifi to work anywhere in the suite, even though I am a HH member, and the cell phone reception was poor.
Manager Response: kricket26,  Good news -- room renovation is under way and we will have all new furniture, etc in all rooms by mid September.   Also have a project to address Wi-Fi (both connection and bandwidth).    What cell carrier do you use, we usually fair well with coverage?

Summary: This was the second time we stayed at this location.  It was crowded with many more families probably doing the same college visit tour as we were. But unless you were out in the hall you'd never know it was crowded.  Everyone is nice there.  Rooms are perfect for a family with kids. Staff were very friendly from in every department.
Manager Response: Sharene C,  Hope your college search was successful and the fit is wonderful for your son or daughter.   With all the colleges we get lots of parents coming for events.

Summary Heading: A wonderful respite in a busy city!
Summary: Even under renovation construction, rooms and staff were lovely!  Strongly recommend this property for business or vacation stays. Tremendous breakfast options and a fantastic central area complete with running streams fully supplied with fish.
Manager Response: Italycathy1,  So glad the team was successful and you had a great time.

Summary: So comfortable... Being away from home. Stayed here several times to visit my parents and amusement parks. Worth the money! Staff are always helpful. Valet service is great! Late check out option is fantastic
Manager Response: Glad you had a great visit.   Thanks for taking the time to review our hotel and staff.  I will share your kind words with the team.  All are extraordinary.

Summary: Room was clean enough upon entry we go out to the balcony and cleaning dumps cleaning water all over us from the floor above horrible experience horrible horrible horrible experience and management refused to put it to a higher floor said it would just dry I showed him the video and he got the room for the night complimentary i said you need to do a lot more than that we just did my wife's hair for $450 and now it's all whatever cleaning solution or urine or anything else for it on her said you need to find out and let us know and nothing still
Manager Response: peternkjr,  The email below was sent on April 12 to your gmail email address in your reservation record:    I look forward to hearing from you.  Dear Peter Encke:   Clearly Mr. Encke we made a mistake when the housekeeper in the room above put water on the balcony and then swept the water off the balcony causing you and your wife to get wet. Feedback I got from my team was similar to yours. I understand you wanted all four of your nights complimentary. We did one. I was also told we asked about clothing you both were wearing and I'm told you told us the clothing is/will be okay. Of course I will reimburse you for dry cleaning if needed and if stains are permanent I will address replacement provided you send me the damaged items. And finally your wife's $450 hair cut/ style certainly got my attention. I would need a receipt or cc statement from the studio prior to your stay and I will see you get $450 worth of Hilton Honor points so you can use them in the future.   Please let me know.   Sincerely,   Michael Anderson  General Manager  Embassy Suites by Hilton, Santa Ana Orange County Airport  michael.anderson@wcghotels.com   714-241-3330

Summary Heading: Great Place to Stay for O.C. Area
Summary: The staff were very friendly, from the HHonors counter, the guest reception, breakfast and check-out, they were all very kind and accommodating.  The free (but be kind and leave a nice tip) evening reception and breakfast were excellent!  And though they cannot always provide a late check-out, they did so for us and it made all the difference before heading to the airport.
Manager Response: Eric,  So glad you had a great time and we helped.

Summary: Top rated stay. All staff very accommodating. Food in dining room very good. Love the free shuttle to and from airport and within 5 mile radius of hotel. All the staff remembers you by name. I was there in October of 2015 and returned April 2016 and they called me by name and where I was from.
Manager Response: SSSchayltz,  Thanks for the feedback.   Great to hear my staffs efforts were successful.

Summary Heading: Good stay, great staff, poor internet connection
Summary: Great place to stay at. Great staff will make feel welcome. Was there on business. Close to fwy connections. Down side very poor Wi-Fi connectivity. Takes forever to connect and when you do very slow.
Manager Response: mje,  Glad you liked the hotel and staff.   We have a project over the next 90 days to upgrade Wi-Fi connectivity in bad areas and bandwidth through out.

Summary: Great place to stay if your in Orange County. The managers reception and complementary breakfast is an excellent value considering the rooms a great also. I highly recommend embassy suites to all my friends and colleagues.
Manager Response: Jeremy,  Appreciate spreading the word.   We have a great staff at both our breakfast and the evening reception.   Very proud of their efforts.  Glad you liked their efforts.

Summary: I was very pleased with our stay.  Although there was some construction going on (we were advised before our stay) we had a great experience.  The rooms were spacious and clean and the complimentary breakfast was delicious!  We also enjoyed the complimentary happy hour.  We will be returning in the future :)
Manager Response: Anar,  So glad you enjoyed your stay.    Yes we are renovating half a floor at a time including bathrooms, furniture, new beds, furniture, art and draperies.   Will finish all rooms mid September.

Summary: We have a big family so this hotel was great for our stay.  Comfortable and clean... Loved the pillows and the breakfast..  Overall great stay... The only draw back is the heating and air it only goes on when the hotel reaches a certain temp.  I guess I just like to adjust the heat if it gets to cold.  Other than that it was a great stay.
Manager Response: Shannon,  So glad you had a great stay!   As you may have noticed we are renovating all our rooms and will be done in mid-September.   We do half a floor at a time and our construction team has done a great job of being as quiet as possible and inclosing the work area so we don't have dust or unsightly work in view.   We are address our HVAC with new thermostats which are going to help.   Thank you for your review.  I can't wait to share it with the team.

Summary: This location is on point. As you pull up someone is there to greet you and take your bags; even if its a doggie bag from your meal they want to know if you need any help. The manager is on his j.o.b he seen we pulled up before check-in and we was tired from our 8 hour drive. So he got us in a room til our room was available I thought that was so nice and we were very greatful. Next time we take the kids to knots berry farm this was will our home.
Manager Response: Tanisha,  So glad you and your family had a great stay and the stay was so attentive.   I will share your review with the team.

Summary: Everything about this hotel is perfect. From evening reception, with free drinks,  and snacks. To the buffet breakfast with omelet station... Also there is an indoor pool and hot tub that the kids loved. The rooms are large and spacious. We will stay here every time we are in the area!
Manager Response: Thanks for the input Desirees.  I will share with my team.

Summary: I had a very difficult time adjusting to the management service. I called for 2 bath towels and never got them. Our room key did not work and it took a long time for someo e to open our door. Horrible service. Does not recommend this hotel to anyone.
Manager Response: Eddie,  Clearly we failed you.   We certainly didn't meet our goal of providing great service and I'm interested in talking further with you to react to details.   While I can't promise perfection we do a lot of service training and my team is very willing to give their best generally and our service scores are significantly up so I'd love to talk to you.   We have a service culture of MAKE IT RIGHT when we don't do so the first time so I want to understand if you told my team and what did they do?   We monitoring whether we met or exceed guest expectations when told of a problem so that's a huge focus.  My direct line is 714-241-3330 and my email is Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com

Summary: We stayed in a remodeled room and was extremely disappointed. First, upon entering the room it had a must smell that wouldn't go away. Second, our room only had 1 remote for 2 TVs. Third, and most importantly, the sofa bed was very uncomfortable. We could feel the springs from the mattress.
Manager Response: TAmaker,  Sorry we failed you.   Would you be so kind to email me your name so I can follow up and see what room you stayed in.   Clearly that is not he result we want you to experience.     I would agree sofa beds are not as comfortable as a bed so I want to see if it's broken or what and the remote is carelessness on our part.   That said thanks in advance for giving me more information.   If you prefer to call please do.

Summary: I prefer to stay at Embassy Suites when I travel with family due to the size of the rooms and the quality breakfast offered. This location was for a staycation which did not disappoint except for one factor. The hotel is undergoing renovations but you won't notice too much noise or dust as the work areas are covered. The staff at the breakfast center were professional and attentive to the food stock. The only drawback I will not is the excessive $15 a day to park in the lot.  Other adjacent hotels offer free parking, as a matter of fact, you can park next door at the La Quinta, free of charge, then walk over to avoid paying the parking fee.  I understand why hotels charge for parking in areas where parking is limited, but this is not the case here.  I doubt I will have another
Manager Response: Dear Jose,  Thank you for your feedback.   So glad you had a great stay overall.   The parking is an answer to challenges in the past where we would run out of spaces with no control.  We determined all of the full service hotels in the market, other Embassy Suites, Doubletree, Marriott, Hilton, etc all charged for parking so we made the change over a year ago.   This has meant only our guests use the lot and we still have a full lot when we run high occupancies.  We also added valet which we didn't have before.  Our two room suite, full breakfast and even reception with full bar and snacks means room rates are also higher than all the limited service hotels around us.     PS  La Quinta will and has towed cars from there lot and I would hate for anyone to have to pay for the tow at "I've been told $350" vs. $15 each night for self park.   Glad you got lucky, but park with us next time.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay with teenagers
Summary: We stayed at this hotel when we went to Huntington Beach - taking a break between going to Disneyland and Universal Studios. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. We stayed in a two-queen suite, and with three teenagers, we had plenty of room. The free evening reception was very welcome after spending a day at the beach. We ate dinner later at the hotel restaurant. Not a whole lot of healthy choices on the menu, but the staff was friendly and accommodating. The pool and hot tub were winners with the kids. The beds were very comfortable. Breakfast the next morning included made-to-order omelets and pancakes, fruit, and oatmeal with all the fixings. We would definitely stay again.
Manager Response: Glad you had a great time and liked our hotel.   I will share your review with the staff.

Summary: Overall our stay at this hotel was good.  The hotel rooms are currently being updated.  Customer service was great.  They were responsive to our needs. Close enugh to Disneyland which was very helpful.  Complimentary breakfast was good.  Very crowded but food was good.  Service was also good.  We would stay here again.
Manager Response: Lisah,  Glad you had a good stay and I love hearing about the responsive and attentive staff.  Yes we are busy at breakfast on the weekends like most Embassy Suites since we are a great location for all that Orange County has to offer.    Our Executive Chef and breakfast team have been here for a long time and we really have breakfast wired but there is no question the last hour of breakfast tends to be the busiest since everyone sleeps in (9-10am).   7-9am is usually lighter.

Summary: Maria,  Angela,  Mr Austin,  Eric and the whole Gang right down to the Coy are welcoming and UNFORGETTABLE! For the price?  The service,  attention to detail,  superb fluffy Omlettes set the stage for an incredible BUCKET LIST vacation! You need to walk thru the "E" in Gold-  Electric Doors which start to feel like a big hug very quickly. Smiles from the front desk staff and you're catapulted up to the grandeur of your own personal suite overlooking EVERYTHING.  Palm trees,  Turtles,  sunshine and Californiaocity! Come see for yourself and marvel at the low price of this beautiful luxury Hotel. Santa Ana's best kept secret strategically located right at the 5!  Gateway to both SanDiego and Los Angeles- it's a PERFECT oasis and We cannot wait to return!  DAISY of CANADA
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel looks great on the outside! It was very dated and ran down in the rooms. My room was above the bar/restaurant and you could hear clanking and banging as they were washing dishes until 1 am.
Manager Response: Marcusg482,  Thanks for the feedback.   We are in the process of renovating all our rooms and will be completely done by September.   So far 3 floors are done.   You will love the new rooms.  Please call me at 714-241-3330, I would love to get your name and better understand the specific room you stayed in.  I'm new and want to understand noise issues so I can address.

Summary: I love Embassy Suites but this one is a little dated.  The good about this hotel is the breakfast staff and their friendliness with their guests.   Them room per say is a different story.  The room had crumbs on the couches, the bed sheets had stains and crusty stuff on it, and the bathroom and bedroom smelled like vomit.  Since I had two rooms next to each other I didn't want to lose the room and be moved to another one.  The rooms didn't have wireless even though this is an expensive hotel.  The beds were comfortable.  The temperature in the room can get cold at night and no heater is available.    The pool was clean and enjoyable.  The parking is a little expensive for self parking and barely any available.  But the kitchen staff makes up for it and there good nature.  That
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback.   I will share your praises with the breakfast team.  I apologize the room was not up to standard and am working with my team to improve.  We watch our survey results and are making great progress, but your experience points to the need to be more consistent.  At our hotel my team is engaged and empowered to Make it Right so please always let us know about issues and we will do all we can to fix the issue.

Summary Heading: Hot rooms that are less than clean
Summary: Went to this hotel and it was poorly maintained.  The rooms were very dirty and the sheets had blood.  I would not recommend this hotel.  The front desk staff were hit or miss as well.  Parking was also expensive.
Manager Response: Ellen,  I'm embarrassed and apologize we failed you.  Please contact me via email at Michael.Anderson@wcghotels.com to discuss how I can make it up to you.

Summary: Check in was easy. Staff were polite and helpful. Evening social was nice. Room was clean and well attended. Breakfast lines were long. Seemed not enough help. Usually have omlet bar but line was to long and slow. Had scrambled eggs, sausage and toast. Was not feeling well the rest of the day. First time staying here. Usually stay at Embassy in Anaheim. Will stay there next time not here.
Manager Response: Ticroses-  I'm sorry you didn't enjoy breakfast.  Thank you for the feedback.  We work very hard to provide a great breakfast and scores are generally very good.   We will review, and see we are even more consistent.

Summary: Everything from the phone call to make a reservation, to check-in, to the breakfast, the staff was very helpful and friendly.  The room was very nice and comfortable, with a foldout bed made it just right for the needs of my kids.  It even had a good setup for being able to get some studies or work done (but that's not why we were there).  Breakfast was a little crowded, but i can understand why, because the omelets were tasty.
Manager Response: Thank you for your review.    We try hard to provide great service and comfortable accomadations and I have a great staff.   Please know we will share your comments.   Thank you for choosing our hotel.

Summary: I love it there and always feel home away from home. I stay a lot there and only once I had a bad experience other than that, everything is wonderful. For the price, I cannot beat it. The staff, is super and they go out of the way to help.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing and for choosing us.   Glad you had a great stay!

Summary: Food and beverage services were excellent.  The hospitality was equally top-notch.  The rooms are clean but showing their age.  The HVAC system is terrible! If the property is in "heat" mode, one can't use the AC and vice versa.  There is a notice posted near the thermostats nevertheless the room was uncomfortably hot or cold most of the time.  Housekeeping was outstanding!    Self parking is redic!  ...narrow little spaces that are fit for nothing much larger than a Prius
Manager Response: Balad -- thanks for the feedback.    Glad you enjoyed the staff and food and beverage, as well as housekeeping.   We are in the middle of a renovation of all our rooms and will be done the end of September.   Very excited about the opportunity to have new rooms, a significant Wi-Fi upgrade and we are addressing the HVAC with thermostats to help control fan and temp.   Will tie to a computer that tells the system what every thermostat is set at and control the system mode to please the majority.   Not perfect but significantly better.  Most of the year we enjoy warm weather so AC mode meets needs, but when we have cold nights it gets interesting I know, but this upgrade is designed to help a lot.  Thanks for choosing us and your kind words.

Summary: Staff is very welcoming, friendly and helpful.  The beds were comfortable and the hotel was quiet.  It is located in a great location and easy to get to.  We were able to get to Disneyland in 30 -35 minutes and were also close to Newport Beach and other great places in California.
Manager Response: Thanks for staying with us and the kind words.    We will share with our team.

Summary: I had a problem with the room and the staff worked it out so props to them. However the facility is under construction so the place is a mess. They do well to keep it quiet and clean but they are doing MAJOR construction. Even the WiFi is barely working. Their excuse for it not working was it is old. So I suggest if someone stays here try after the construction is completed.
Manager Response: Meceebee,  Thanks for the feedback.   I've got a significant solution to fix Wi-Fi coverage and bandwidth.   Spending $300K and will be done in next 60 days.    Parts of the hotel work great now, but we need to upgrade since we all use multiple devices and bandwidth at times is not enough.  All rooms are being renovated doing 18 rooms at a time since we almost always are at high occupancy due to our perfect location.   Contractor is best I've ever worked with and section of floor is closed off so no dust and noise is minimal (few days every two weeks while taking out bathroom tile).  All work from 9am to 5pm.     Glad you liked the staff and soon we will have new rooms.

Summary: This is our second family trip to this hotel, we love it! Staff is fantastic, Eric at the front desk took great care of a tricky reservation (12 people). Salvador the valet is extremely kind, was patient with our big group constantly loading and unloading, greeted my wife each day with a water bottle after she returned from her morning run.  Breakfast is plentiful and always has  more than enough options to keep everyone happy.  Rooms are well kept, great accommodations for families.  We look forward to returning again!
Manager Response: Aaron -- thanks for sharing.   I will share your review with Eric, Salvador and team.  We look forward to your return.

Summary: I got stranded in an elevator for about 45 minutes but the staff handled everything in a very safe professional manner. This hotel is in a great location for the John Wayne Airport area and the Staff is great   I will be back
Manager Response: Larry -- sorry you got stuck in the elevator.   We have a great company who does preventive maintenance and they have looked at all our elevators and are here weekly.  Glad the team handled it well.    See you on your next stay.

Summary: The room was clean, and comfortable. The beds were very cozy. The children enjoyed the beautiful indoor d√©cor with the koi fish and turtles.  A big plus was the great breakfast with plenty of choices, including omelets, fresh fruit, pancakes and breakfast meats. The down side was the pool. It was overly crowded with children and no adults around. I understand that it would be hard to enforce, yet I feel that employees could have come in and insisted adults be present with their children that were running around and causing havoc. I pointed out in during our last trip that having the Disney channel would be nice for small children. It is still lacking in that area.  All in all, it is a wonderful place to stay and we will be visiting again in a few months.
Manager Response: Invkjt -- Thank you for the feedback.   Glad the children love the hotel and the fish and turtles, as well as the breakfast.   I will investigate the Disney Channel and see what we can do and I've gotten a couple comments about kids getting wild and no parents around or in some cases there, but not paying attention.   You are right it's a tough situation where we tend to take middle ground, but it must be addressed and I will.

Summary Heading: Sweated all night and had to buy ear plugs to sleep in
Summary: This is the first time that I have ever left a review on travel advisor ...or practically anywhere else for that matter...at least that I can recall.   But, I think an honest, non-bitter review is warranted.  I generally love Embassy Suites...Generally you know what you are getting...but in this instance have one big complaint.  When I arrived at the hotel late at night, it was warm outside.   I am a very hot-natured person.   When I finally got up to my room, I opened the door and the room was sweltering hot and extremely stagnant/stuffy.   So, as per the norm when I am traveling, I marched right over you the thermostat to crank it down and get the a/c moving.   That's when...standing beneath the very low popcorn ceilings (an Embassy Suites norm)...I saw it..."the sign"...the
Manager Response: Dear Danny M,  I apologize for the miserable night you spent at our hotel.  Clearly our cooling system failed you in the room you stayed in and since we are a urban location noise and light make leaving the sliding door to the balcony a poor solution.  While our HVAC system is not perfect it works well the majority of the time if we manage it properly.  Your experience points to a fan motor failure or something isolated to that room.  Please contact me directly if I may be of further assistance.   My hope is you would try us again when you have the need in Orange County.   Let me know and I will address your reservation personally.

Summary: Whenever possible, I choose the Embassy Suites.  I know that the room will be spacious and I always look forward to the wonderful breakfast.  When I am in for the evening, the Happy Hour is always a nice way to relax before dinner.  I love all of the brick work in the open areas.  Embassy Suites knows how to do it right.
Manager Response: Donna -- glad you had a great stay!

Summary: The hotel is a very nicely laid out.  The staff very helpful.  The complimentary hospitality in the evening is a nice touch after a day of work.  The rooms were excellent especially having the working area and the sleeping area being separate. Made you fell like home.
Manager Response: Thanks for sharing.   Glad you had a great stay.

Summary: Nick at the front desk was very accommodating and helpful when there was an issue with my reservation! The hotel was very standard on the inside, very similar to all other embassy suites, with a great complimentary breakfast! The room was spacious and well cleaned. However it seems like all views from the hotel are of a parking lot.   On the weekend it was about a 15 minute drive to Disneyland which was GREAT. I'd highly recommend this as an affordable option near the park!
Manager Response: Gabi -- Nick is a star and he loves making our guests happy   Glad the staff hit high marks throughout.  I have shared your feedback.   I'm a Tigger fan myself.

Summary Heading: Quiet, comfortable, and convenient for business in Irvine/Orange County
Summary: Spent two nights at this Embassy Suites on business last week - and would stay here again. There are major renovations underway - the lobby/atrium are torn down, with work underway between 7am-7pm. A few floors of rooms are also being renovated. Biggest impact is on the cooked-to-order breakfast/manager's reception, but they have a temporary location in one of the meeting rooms - so relax! You can still get your breakfast and get your drink on in the evening!  Service: For the first time i used Hilton's 'check in on line' before arrival. I had the option to pick my own room - and probably shouldn't have. I picked a room on a higher floor, in a corner, thinking it might have a better view and be quieter. No view to speak of (parking garage), and being tucked in a corner, didn't
Manager Response: Daisy -- somehow this review is on the Embassy Suites Orange County Airport in Santa Ana.   I know they are under renovation and are sister property is a great choice second only to us. ;0)

Summary: The suites were very nice as was the staff.  The atrium was very nice with the Koi and turtle pond.  Loved the different food available at breakfast.  Staff were helpful and pleasant. Rooms were clean and quiet.
Manager Response: Glad you had a great stay.

Summary: Clean and typical Embassy Suites. Excellent breakfast and decent fitness facilities. I stayed in one of the newly renevated rooms which had updated bathroom floors and excellent king size bed. The flat screen TVs could have been larger. There was a good view of Ornage County from my 10th floor window, but even at that height there were highway noise ain the early mornings. I hate paying for parking at any hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Spacious suites and superb breakfast included in the room price.
Summary: We love staying at the Embassy Suites in Santa Ana: convenient location, gracious service, spacious suites, fine breakfasts,  family-friendly, free wi-fi, pleasant happy hours.  My only regret: the hefty parking fee.
Manager Response: Globetrotter -- glad you had a great stay.   We started the parking charges little over a year ago and it has helped us over all control who parks in our lot.   While I am fairly new I'm told prior to adding the gates and fees we had issues with non-guests parking and at higher occupancies running out of spaces.   All the full service hotels in the market charge for parking, we were the last to add.

Summary: Only 3-star or better hotel in the area but hotel needs to be updated (it is indeed undergoing renovations). Construction noise was extremely disturbing during the day.  Registration staff not as friendly as one could expect.  Hotel charges $15 per night and access and exit requires going through an automatic gate with either credit card or room key.  Even though I was asked by registration staff and affirmed that I had a vehicle and was told nothing else other than the cost and to use the room key to exit the parking lot, I found a piece of paper stuck on my windshield that I needed to register my car. I went to the registration staff which then told me I needed to talk to the parking attendant. The parking attendant then told me that I needed to fill out a form and put a copy
Manager Response: Henry -- Sorry about the confusion regarding your car, I too would be frustrated.  My team is working to fine turn and improve.  Thanks for the feedback.

Summary: Always enjoy staying. a little noise, highway is near the hotel, however hotel and staff are first rate. Breakfast is first rate. lounge area is fantastic, very nice architecture.I stay there every time I'm in town
Manager Response: Mathew -- appreciate the kind words and thanks for your loyalty.  We will continue to earn it.

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but...$15 for parking is ridiculous.
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times over the last 5 years (last night being the most recent).  It is reasonably priced for an Embassy Suites and the location is convenient for all of Orange County.  However, I am disappointed that they now charge $15 a day for parking.  This is a recent addition especially since their TripAdvisor description says they have free parking.  There are also 4 other hotels immediately adjacent to this property that have free parking for their guests.  Hotels are finding more and more ways to nickel and dime us and this is the most blatant.    I gave the rooms an "average" because they are a little dated looking.  However, the hotel is in the midst of a 6 month renovation so that problem should be quickly remedied.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Internet and T.V. Options are out dated
Summary: While at this location for a week on a business trip, there were many times when the network would completely drop off which interrupted my business several times.  Also, some channels on the t.v. would come in and out, become pix-elated as well as some channels were not available all together.  I have stayed at this location many of times on business.  I think this will be my last time.  Not worth the money.
Manager Response: Dear Derrick D, Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our Wi-Fi and TV functionality. Guest comfort and exceptional service are our top priorities and we regret you did not experience this.  We have begun a full renovation of the hotel that does include upgrading our TV system in certain rooms that have issues from time to time and a extensive upgrade of our internet system to improve signal and bandwidth. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Best regards,  Michael Anderson, General Manager

Summary Heading: At this Embassy Suites, it is all about the friendly service.
Summary: Every staff member provided true service with a smile. From the excellent front desk to the complimentary breakfast with omelettes to order, from the peaceful atrium to the fastidious housekeeping! As an occasional visiter to Orange County, I plan on making this Embassy Suites my new home away from home. Special thanks to Nick and Michal T. at the Front Desk for granting every request with professional excellence.
Manager Response: RGL -  Thank you for your comments.  So glad you enjoyed your stay and our efforts.   I have shared your notes with housekeeping, our breakfast team and the front desk team.   Nick and Michael T are stars!   I am so lucky we work together.

Summary: I expected more from a Hilton property. The hotel is dark, the rooms needed attention both in the areas of maintenance and decorating. We had three nights booked but opted to check out after two and go elsewhere. The only bright spot was breakfast...made-to-order eggs, good coffee, and plenty of variety.
Manager Response: Dear Phil K, Thank you so much for the kind words about our breakfast, Embassy Suites prides itself on our two room suite, full breakfast in the morning and even reception in the evening and we strive hard to make our offerings and our accommodations the best they can be.   We are in the process of renovating all our suites over the next six months and then our atrium, restaurant and public space.    My saving grace is our staff is the best in the market and all pride themselves on cleaning and providing the best possible product.   We are sorry you found the rooms dark and dreary, but soon we will be best in market. Sincerely, Michael Anderson General Manager

Summary: I am in and out of the Santa Ana area several times a year. My latest visit to the Embassy Suites Santa Ana County airport. I found the hotel to be fairly quiet in the common areas and with the use of natural lighting it is very dark in the evening. I was on the 10th floor on this visit and found it recently renovated. The food in the restaurant / sports bar reasonably priced and the service was very attentive.
Manager Response: Richard,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  I'm so glad to hear that you though our restaurant service was very attentive!  One of our biggest focuses as a hotel is to provide great service for our guests.  We believe that most all hotel provide a clean and comfortable environment, but what truly sets us apart is service. Than you for stay with us and we hope to see you again soon when your travels bring you back to the Orange County Airport area.  Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Old tired hotel that is expensive
Summary: How bad can it be? Moldy stale air coming out of AC units, old worn out carpet, furniture and the elevators run really sssllllooowwwww! They didn't tell us we had to pay for parking till you get the final bill, should have received a credit because their electronic get in and get out gate did not work with room cards and you had to yell for someone every time! Rip-off you paid for parking for such a inferior hotel! Food was minimal at best, breakfast was horrible and greasy! Traffic noise from hwy next to it all night long! Free wifi that NEVER worked! Too many things to list!
Manager Response: C0wtnadv,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with your experience. Guest comfort and experience are our top priorities and we regret you did not experience this. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Best regards, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites while attending a conference. I was most pleased with the delicious breakfast, served quickly and pleasantly.  I had time to get to the meeting without racing.  The staff for the breakfast were the best!  The evening reception was very nice and relaxing after a busy day of meetings.  I would stay here again.
Manager Response: OhioDriver,  Thank you so much for your great review!  We're so glad you enjoyed our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast and evening manager's reception.  There are great perks to staying with Embassy Suites by Hilton!  We hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the Orange County Airport area.  Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: From the front desk to the folks who staff the breakfast to the folks outside manning the car station and all that...this hotel is simply impeccably run. No sour grapes or problems, great pool, no smelly elevators whatsoever. The restaurant, itself, I will admit, only suffices, but that's fine.
Manager Response: Christopher,  Thank you so much for the AWESOME review.  You have paid us high praise!  I will be sure to share your review with our entire team; it will make their day.  Thank you staying with us and I hope that we will see you again soon!  Warmest Regards, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: I am very surprise that the issues I had was not taken care  of by the staff of the hotel. The first night of stay the room was extremely cold. I could not adjust it with the thermostat. That night I call the room service to see what I was doing wrong. They sent the engineer and he told me that there was a one system that control the whole hotel. I was very surprised at the comment and ask what they can do. He said he was going to turned up the heat. That night and the rest of my stay I was extremely cold and got a cold. The second day I complained again the they sent up a heater that didn't work. I gave on the issue. I other was the Wi-Fi connection. I got connected outside my room by could not connect inside the room. I tried my IPad and my laptop and both would drop
Manager Response: Miguel,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with your stay here. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. The issue with our guest room internet is being addressed in the coming months and we are very sorry this led to unproductive stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.   Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: My children LOVE the fresh-made omelets at this hotel. We love feeling like we're someplace a little more special that what we normally get in this price range. The koi fish  and turtles are always a hit. My wife and I have a lot of good memories from this hotel and it's ambiance.
Manager Response: Richard,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review.  We are so pleased to hear that your children enjoyed our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast!  It is one of our best features and is a great value addition to the stay.  I hope we can continue to make memories for your family for years to come.  Tank you staying with us and we hope to see you again soon.  Warmest Regards, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary Heading: Great time was had by all
Summary: Took our youngest two grand kids ( 9 & 12) for a week-end at hotel and trip to Knoxberry Farm.  They enjoyed the hotel as much as the amusement park.  There was plenty to keep them busy and being all enclosed it was easy to let them so freedom.  The evening snacks were well received as was the breakfast.
Manager Response: Kayandjer,  Thank you so much for the great review of your recent stay with us.  We are so glad to hear that your family had a good time at the hotel and at Knott's Berry Farm.  We hope you will stay with us again when your travels bring you back to the Orange County Airport area.  Warmest Regards, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: Hotel's management system is unable to cope with challenges during renovation and can not react adequately - even when feedback for room issue is communicated directly face to face at reception desk..
Manager Response: Stefan F,  Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts on your recent stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Santa Ana Orange County Airport.   I was saddened read your comments that the hotel was unresponsive to your needs due to the renovations that are currently underway.  Please know that guest satisfaction is one of our highest priorities, yet must find a way coexist with the renovations.  This feat can be quite challenging, but I believe our team members are up to it.  Thank you again for the feedback and I hope that you will stay with us again in the future.    Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: Our sales team staid here during our annual meeting.  We were up late at the bar, where the service was good despite the crowd.  And then we were up early at the breakfast, which was really good and we never really had to wait much. I would recommend it for business.
Manager Response: Howard,  Thank you for taking the time out of your busy schedule to review your recent stay with us.  We greatly appreciate your positive comments about our great service.  We look forward to having you again as our guest on your next trip to the Orange County Airport area.  Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager.

Summary: This was my 5th time staying at this Hotel.  The past times were great.. This on well not so much.. I had issues with paint coming off the tub as I was trying to shower, had water leaking from the celing onto the chair that I eventually sat in with a suit on.  Then the smell of one of the three rooms that I was in.  Michel the General Manager is great.  He is trying to do good things.
Manager Response: 672aarons,  Thank you for posting a review of your recent stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Santa Ana Orange County Airport.  I am so glad that you got the opportunity to meet our new general manager, Mr. Anderson, and bring your concerns to his attention.  He is a great addition to our team and has a great zest for continuous improvement.  With our renovations currently underway and knowing that we're going to be addressing WiFi, HVAC, and guest room entertainment.  Your future stays should only be Extraordinary!  We look forward to having you stay with us again when your travels bring you back to the Orange County Airport area.  Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: The room had very poor wifi connectivity. I had to use common areas to complete work. The hotel shares a single Heat/AC system leaving very minimal controls in the room. Luckily I could open the windows to allow in fresh cool air.
Manager Response: Jeffrey,  Thank you for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  We greatly appreciate the feedback and look forward to addressing each one of your concerns over the next year.    The first half of this year, we will be improving the wifi experience. Our partners at AT&T are currently finalizing a plans to improve connectivity and speed for the entire hotel. I would suspect all of the new equipment and improvements will be in place by June 2016.   To address the HVAC system, the hotel has a 2 pipe system, which was state of the art when the hotel opened up in 1984. However, in 2016, it leave some definite challenges to all parties concerned. With the concrete construction of all of our guest room walls, it has prevented the hotel from upgrading the system to current 4 and 6 pipe systems which allow a guest to dial in a temperature more to their liking. In 2016, one of the top priorities of the hotel's capital plan is to find better solutions to our guests HVAC needs.   Thank you again for your review and we hope to see you again when your travels bring you back to the Orange County Airport area.  Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: Probably dumb, but the "complimentary" breakfast (provided you buy the package with the "complimentary breakfast") was amazing.  The breakfast area was always busy, but we never had to wait long in line.  We also had "complimentary" drinks in the evening, which was nice when we were at the hotel in the evening.  We enjoyed our stay overall, but I'm not sure we'd stay there again.  Our main complaint was with the drapes/curtains in the living room area.  Basically, there is floor to ceiling glass windows outside the main door of the room, and those are cover by drapes you can open or pull closed.  However, there are gaps between where the drapes meet the door, and people walking by our room could see directly in if we were sitting in the living room area--not what I want while
Manager Response: KCarstone,  Thank you for your review of your recent stay and the valuable feedback.  I'm pleased to report that all 3 of your issues are being addressed this year!  As part of the renovations that are currently underway, each guest room's windows will be frosted to increase the privacy of each guest room.  Additionally, a unidirectional door viewer will be added to each guest room door.  The first half of this year, we will be improving the wifi experience.  Our partners at AT&T are currently finalizing a plans to improve connectivity and speed for the entire hotel.  I would suspect all of the new equipment and improvements will be in place by June 2016.    To address the HVAC system, the hotel has a 2 pipe system, which was state of the art when the hotel opened up in 1984. However, in 2016, it leave some definite challenges to all parties concerned. With the concrete construction of all of our guest room walls, it has prevented the hotel from upgrading the system to current 4 and 6 pipe systems which allow a guest to dial in a temperature more to their liking. In 2016, one of the top priorities of the hotel's capital plan is to find better solutions to our guests HVAC needs.   Thank you again for taking the time to review your stay.  We look forward to you staying with us again on future travels to the Orange County Airport area.  Warmest Regards, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: I have been staying here on business trips at least once a year.  This time, the room I entered has a dank, musty smell, and it appeared to be covered up with a product like Febreeze.  I called the front desk, and they immediately moved me to the 8th floor, which is non smoking.  However, the room had the same odor.  Rather then try a third room, I turned off the climate control (which is heat only this time of year), opened the patio window/door, and conditions improved.  I think the staleness is caused by the poor/old ventilation system in the hotel.  While it is too warm for heat, turning the thermostat all the way down simply blows warm, stagnant air in the room.  Better off turning the system off.  As a result, the room was simply too warm for my needs, and could not be
Manager Response: Jlbigguy,  Thank you very much for taking the time out to your busy schedule to review your recent stay with us.  I must say that I'm quite impressed with your olfactory senses!  We indeed do use Febreze in addition to the whole line of Proctor & Gamble products.  Hopefully you senses felt at home when they recognized the Tide, Downey, Comet, and Spic 'n Span throughout the rest of the room.  As you noticed, the hotel is currently under renovation and will be through January 2017.  We will be renovating all of our guest rooms in addition to our atrium, lobby, food & beverage facilities, and all of our meeting spaces.  Our first rooms will be coming back online towards the end of March.  I'd recommend booking the Premium room type.    To address the HVAC system, the hotel has a 2 pipe system, which was state of the art when the hotel opened up in 1984.  However, in 2016, it leave some definite challenges to all parties concerned.  With the concrete construction of all of our guest room walls, it has prevented the hotel from upgrading the system to current 4 and 6 pipe systems which allow a guest to dial in a temperature more to their liking.  In 2016, one of the top priorities of the hotel's capital plan is to find better solutions to our guests HVAC needs.    Thank you again for reviewing your stay with us.  We look forward to having you stay with us again in the future.  Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: Nice location to airport.   Very good shuttle.  Lobby is very nice and original.  Loved the fish in the lobby ponds.  Great business center and pool area is ok.  Nothing fancy but nice enough.  The bad--not the most friendly of staff, rooms are dated, but looks like they are remodeling.  The worst 6:45 am on a Sunday and no hot water for a shower ended up going for quick soak in the hot tub vs a cold shower.   Price was ok but not with out working hot water, and when you pay 50 for 4 beers and 2 appetizers you would think you would get how water for a shower.  Breakfast was good, omelets were great the rest was standard hotel breakfast.
Manager Response: WYranch,  Thank you very much for taking the time to review your recent stay with us.  Please accept my apologies on behalf of the hotel for the hot water troubles you experienced with us.  It is certainly a rare complaint to have in the hotel and my only thought would be that due to the lack of use that early in the morning, maybe the hot water was not circulating well.  Rest assured that I have shared your review with my chief engineer and he will be looking into the issue, checking our circulation pumps, multiple boilers, and electronic data recorders to insure everything is working correctly.  Thank you again for your review and I hope that you will consider us again in the future.  Very Respectfully, Timothy Wagner Assistant General Manager

Summary: The lobby most interesting I have seen in a long time murals from scenes of 1950s sub Sahara Africa.  The location is close to SNA only 5 minutes by car as well.  Orange Historic down town 10 to 20 minutes by car away.  The seat of the Government of Orange County with also Federal Offices Hospitals and Irvine with interational Corporate HQs is nearby.
Manager Response: Robert,  Thank you very much for your review of your recent stay at the Embassy Suites by Hilton Santa Ana Orange County Airport.  We couldn't agree more that our location is ideal in Orange County.  In 20 minutes you can be anywhere; Laguna Beach, Huntington Beach, Disneyland, or even the Brea Mall!
