It makes me doubt the  level of cleanliness in the kitchen/restaurant as well. I looked at these reviews and paid no mind. It's
Manager Response: Dear Tfamily09 -   I'm so sorry for your poor experience this week at our hotel.  Please be assured I will be discussing your comments with our housekeeping management team to work on immediate improvements.  We take pride in providing the best in lodging and service so our lapses during your stay are being taken very seriously.  Again, on behalf of the staff and management - I offer our apologies.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Beautiful room.  Bathroom was clean and shower worked perfectly.   Room felt very secure; the door had a good lock. Breakfast and evening receptions were really nice, although the choice of snacks at the evening reception was quite limited.
Manager Response: Dear Marie S -   We appreciate your sharing your comments with us.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed your visit with us while on business.  Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to serving you in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Another great stay at an Embassy Suites hotel / central location
Summary: My husband stayed here for 3 weeks on business and I joined him for a long weekend.  I have not yet been disappointed with an Embassy Suites hotel.  It has all the basics for a comfortable stay.  It is so nice to have a 2 room suite; normally we have 3 children in tow so the space is necessary but for this weekend it was simply a nice luxury to spread out and have extra space for my husband's work.  The tropical atrium and glass elevators is always a peaceful oasis.  The breakfast seating area was plentiful and the breakfast delicious - made to order omelets, freshly cooked bacon, sausage, pancakes and hash browns, plus the usual array of yogurt, oatmeal and pastries.  There were 2 choices of fresh fruit - honeydew/cantaloupe melons or sliced oranges.. both yummy but the oranges
Manager Response: Dear MAbelini -   Thank you for your review...it sounds like you had a great visit to Orange County.  We appreciate your feedback from your stay with us and we look forward to serving you in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Great hotel, love the atrium and breakfast buffet is amazing.  Awesome place for families.  Great central location and access to freeways and beach is 10 min away.  They really do keep the place looking great.  Parking is a little tight but I always wound up finding a spot.
Manager Response: Dear Jake F -  We appreciate your reviewing your stay with us.  I am pleased that you enjoyed the hotel and the service of our staff.  Thank you for your business and we look forward to serving you in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Breakfast buffet and service was excellent. Restaurant food was also very good. We received a Great value - for the price we paid.  This was our second stay at this Embassy Suites, and we will definitely stay at this hotel again.    We would highly recommend this hotel to our friends and family. Location was good - with easy access to freeway.
Manager Response: Dear Charlene P -   Thank you very much for taking the time to post comments on TripAdvisor regarding your stay with us.  I am so pleased that you especially enjoyed the breakfast and Sweet Spot.  I appreciate you writing that you will definitely use again if ever in the Santa Ana area again, that is a wonderful endorsement.  Thank you for your business.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Hotel is nice The Breakfast is Free
Summary: The rooms are nice and quiet. We arrived on the weekend so the hotel busy. During the morning "rush-hour" for the free breakfast the lines and cleanliness can suffer from to many people and not enough staff. The parking area is a little tight. The location to the freeway is right next door making it convenient to get on the freeway and off.
Manager Response: Dear Chris R -  We appreciate your review from your stay with us.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed our two room suites.  I will share your comments with our complimentary breakfast team so we can improve our service.  Thank you for your business and we hope to see you back soon.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: For what you pay and what you get you really cannot beat it.  The complimentary breakfast is awesome.  Evening reception is awesome.  Has an indoor pond/stream full of turtles and Koi fish that kids love.  Rooms are very nice.
Manager Response: Dear Michael R -  Thank you for your TripAdvisor review.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed our hotel during your stay with us.  We appreciate your business and look forward to your returning soon.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Good place to stay but watch out for parking
Summary: Hotel is well located, easy access to expressways and other attractions in Tustin, Irvine and Santa Ana. The hotel staff were courteous and friendly especially the morning breakfast crew. The room was clean and comfortable. We did have a problem with finding a parking spot on Saturday night after returning from a wedding. There were vehicles that were taking up 2 spots; we complained to the staff but not sure if anything was done as we ended up parking part way on the curb.
Manager Response: Dear Juliana M -   We appreciate your review from your stay with us.  We are pleased you enjoyed the hotel and the service from our staff.  I will share your comments with our team on the issues with parking you noted.  Thank you for your business and we hope to serve you again.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Literally four minutes over a back road to John Wayne airport. The rooms are ultra modern and well designed, the place was really quiet, and the free breakfast was outstanding. Lots of restaurants with 5 minute drive. Caution, the beer and wine in the hotel "market" are not cheap! Would stay here every time I fly out of Orange County.
Manager Response: Dear Rich O -   Thank you for your review...we are pleased you enjoyed your stay with us.  I appreciate you writing that you will definitely use again if ever in the Santa Ana area again, that is a wonderful endorsement.  We appreciate your business and we look forward to serving you again in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Staying in the Embassy Suites is like staying in a resort.  Try to get a suite on the north side, where it is quiet plus you can watch the fireworks from Disneyland each evening from your balcony at 9 or 9:30.  You will love the breakfast in the lovely atrium.
Manager Response: Dear Grace K -  We appreciate your review of your stay with us.  I am pleased to hear your enjoyed your visit and especially our complimentary cooked-to-order breakfast and the atrium area.  Thank you for your business and we look forward to serving you in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: When we stay in the OC, we usually stay here at the Embassy Suites, because of location and how great and comfy the rooms are. Staff are all very friendly and helpful! Love the Manager's reception at night, good way to unwind before watching t.v. with the kids and the cook to order breakfast is outstanding!!!!
Manager Response: Dear Ross family -   Thank you very much for taking the time to post comments on TripAdvisor regarding your stay with us. I am so pleased that you and your family especially enjoyed the breakfast and manager's reception in addition to the service of our staff.   I appreciate your loyalty to our hotel and we look forward to welcoming your back soon.   Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Decent Property - Could have been better
Summary: Rooms are large and roomy, but outdated. Very small bathroom.  Service could have been better. They have a rent a car service in the hotel which is useful.  Breakfast spread is good with made to order options available. Have a complimentary drinks session in the evening which was a good touch. Central atrium was impressive with a small trees and greenery.   Good place to stay if you are visiting Disneyland as its pretty close by. The TV stations were not working during my 10 day stay which kind of took the gloss from the whole thing.
Manager Response: Dear MrNJK-  Thank you for posting a review regarding your stay at our hotel on Trip Advisor.  I apologize for the issues you experienced during your stay.  I have shared your comments with our team to correct the problems you noted.  I am pleased that you did however enjoy the breakfast, our complimentary evening reception, and our atrium area.  I appreciate your patronage I hope you will give us another try in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: orange county was in midst of heat wave. air conditioning didn't work in first room. I changed rooms next day and a/c worked "a little better" but not by much. my room faced the freeway and the landing pattern for local airport and I was unable to leave window open at night to assist in cooling down the room because the noise was "awful"!
Manager Response: Dear Janice L -   Thank you for the feedback on your stay with us. I would like to apologize for our the issues you had with the air conditioning in your room.  I have passed your comments on to our engineering team for their immediate follow up.    We use such valuable feedback from customers such as you to help us improve the hotel. I hope you will give us another try in the future; we would love the opportunity to earn back your trust.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Continues to endure as one of the finest hotels in Orange County.
Summary: Have stayed here many of times over many years. Great hotel. The staff is very attentive to all my needs. They maintain the facility very well and they are always courteous. They are conveniently located near Orange County/John Wayne Airport. I highly recommend them.
Manager Response: Dear Bryan P S -  We appreciate you sharing your comments from your latest stay with us.  I was happy to hear you enjoyed the service of our team and the facility.  Thank you for your business and we look forward to your return.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: If you get a room on freeway side prepare not to sleep or bring earplugs. There is no room fan to turn on to block out noise. Temperature is controlled by season. In summer the the room temp is levels of cold, you can't turn on heat, only turn off cold. The best way to warm up the room is turn on the shower. Beds are new and very comfortable. The suites overlook the inside garden corridor are great and so worth it. Two rooms separated by a door and each with tv are great. The breakfast, evening reception and room for $119 is a deal. Get a room on the side away from freeway!
Manager Response: Dear yellowfrog777-  Thank you very much for taking the time to post comments on TripAdvisor regarding your stay with us. I am so pleased that you especially enjoyed our two room suites and our breakfast and manager's reception.   We appreciate your business and look forward to serving you again.  Kindest regards, Tom PUgh

Summary: I've stayed here many times, the atrium is awesome with the koi fish and tropical feel.  Good amenities, pool,spa, business office, exercise room. Free made to order breakfast and nightly managers reception.  The hotel is not in a quiet area. Right on top of busy 405 freeway and Warner/dyer rd. The rooms seem to have single pane windows and sliders thus making it very hard to sleep at night if you are used to having a quiet environment. They should consider replacing these to double or triple pane to improve sleep quality. Other than that, everything else was good.
Manager Response: Dear all-inclusive4me08 -   Thank you for your review.  We are pleased to hear you enjoyed the amenities of the hotel and we appreciate your loyalty to us when staying in Santa Ana.  We appreciate your comments on the freeway noise and will review this with our team.  Thank your for your business and we hope to serve you again in the near future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Overall, the service and staff here are great! I got to know the staff and made many new friends. They were especially kind to my 6 yr old daughter, who is a social butterfly and knew everyone by name before i even knew anyone. I appreciate all your hard work and hospitality to my family and me while we were here.
Manager Response: Dear Lupe A -   I was very happy to read that you and your family have enjoyed your stay at our hotel. Thank you very much for acknowledging the friendly and accommodating staff, we are striving to create that environment for all our guests so I am pleased to read you felt their hospitality. We are delighted to have you with us.  Best regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: First of all, if you want AC and heat these rooms don't have both.  Pick one or the other.  The smell is stale and fowl.  The bathroom is so small you could touch a wall with your arms outstretched.  There is mold in the corner of the shower, and housekeeping is stingy with washcloths :( saddest place around.
Manager Response: Dear Jdexec -   I'm so sorry for your poor experience this past week with us.  Please be assured I will be discussing your comments with our management team to work on immediate improvements. We take pride in providing the best in lodging and service so our lapses during your stay are being taken very seriously.  Thank you for sharing your comments, and again, on behalf of the staff and management - I offer our apologies.  Sincerely, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Not the best embassy I've stayed at
Summary: When I first arrived, the gentleman that checked me in was very unfriendly. He looked like I was interrupting his internet browsing. Through the whole process he didn't say a word to me but to tell me my room number, no greeting or anything.   The room was a little bit outdated, but it wasn't bad or dirty.   The managers reception was up to par with most Embassy Suites. Assortment of drinks and snacks, and a place to relax.   The breakfast staff was friendly and phenomenal. The food was fresh and had a great assortment
Manager Response: Dear J_pala21 -   Thank you for posting a review regarding your stay at our hotel on Trip Advisor. I apologize for the poor service you were provided at check-in.  I have passed on your comments to our team and we will follow up to insure we correct this.  We are pleased you enjoyed the complimentary cooked to order breakfast.    I appreciate your patronage I hope you will give us another try in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Pros and cons. Definitely not poor but not exactly average. It's damp.
Summary: Here for an extended stay. Close to the airport and close to the 405 and 55 freeways.  Pros: attentive and friendly staff. Free breakfast (real breakfast) and a free two hour happy hour 7 days a week. It's a winner. The food is good. There is a restaurant on premises and the food I have gotten was fine. The suite is a good size and the bed is fine. The housekeeping staff does a good job (although they skipped my room one day, and on another they didn't replace the towels). Plenty of Area shopping and food, beaches and parks nearby. Orange county's parks are great.   Cons: Dated and worn walls windows bathrooms and decor. This place needs a refurb. It's mostly clean but it's very tired. CLIMATE CONTROL. This is simply ridiculous. The ac is useless. The room is always and I mean
Manager Response: Dear Roonedit -  Thank you for your review from your extended stay with us.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed the service of our staff and the food and beverage offerings.  As you note, we will be undertaking a renovation in the near future...we have begun the process.  We appreciate your business and hope to serve you again.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: I enjoyed my stay at the Embassy Suites.  Location was convenient to freeways and parking was included.  Breakfast was exceptional.  The evening "snacks" were minimal the one evening I was able to partake.
Manager Response: Dear 950cindyb -   Thank you very much for taking the time to post comments on TripAdvisor regarding your stay with us. I am so pleased that you especially enjoyed our complimentary cooked to order breakfast.  We appreciate your business and hope to have you back with us soon.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Great value for the price.  Complimentary reception and breakfast exceeded expectations.  Comfortable, large rooms.  Clean and attractive lobby and facilities.  Convenient access to John Wayne airport.  Great location.
Manager Response: Dear Amy H -   We appreciate your review on TripAdvisor.  I am happy to hear you enjoyed our hotel and the services offered.  We look forward to welcoming you back soon.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Stayed here for about 2 weeks during my business trip. The staff are very nice and especially the breakfast was amazing .. If ur driving during the stay most of the malls and restaurants are of easy access..
Manager Response: Dear Anee1234 -   Thank you very much for taking the time to post comments on TripAdvisor regarding your stay with us.  I am so pleased that you especially enjoyed the breakfast and the service of our staff.  We appreciate your staying with us for your extended business trip and we look forward to welcoming you back.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: The rooms were soaking wet, not just damp. the counter in the bathroom was soaked. Dryed it with a towel and 5 minutes later it was back. All are clothes were damp. Bed was damp and we never really slept. The worst when complained nothing was done, had to assume entire place was like that. Checked out next morning and moved accross the street, it was fine.
Manager Response: Dear Perry V -   I'm so sorry for your poor experience this week at our hotel. Please be assured I will be discussing the issue with the dampness in your room with our engineering team to work on immediate improvements.   We take pride in providing the best in lodging and service so our lapses during your stay are being taken very seriously. I would be delighted to be of assistance in this matter if you would like to contact me. Again, on behalf of the staff and management - I offer our apologies.  Tom Pugh

Summary: This hotel was a bit on the lack luster side for an Embassy Suites hotel. My room was not ready at check in, and I was given a different room than the one I requested.   The floors are thin, I was able to hear a small child running around above me. It was loud enough that I could not hear someone knocking on the front door! Security went right away to ask the guests to please keep the noise level down.   The manager's reception was lacking snacks. The drinks were ample though I did not see coffee. There was several alcoholic drinks such as rum, vodka, beer and wine available. There was also sodas and carafes of flavored waters. Snacks were chips and salsa, animal crackers and goldfish crackers. I have seen other ES that have offered premium snacks such as pizza for a nominal
Manager Response: Dear Jessicarbt -   Thank you for your detailed review...we appreciate your comments as it allows our team to correct any items that are lacking and improve the product and service we deliver to our guests.  We appreciate your staying with us and we look forward to serving you in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Staff was wonderful, suites were great. Hotel restaurant did a great job with our dinner party of 40! Embassy Suites complimentary breakfast and managers reception always make it easy to get together with everyone when travelling in a group.
Manager Response: Dear Edward M -   We appreciate your review from your stay with us.  Our team is pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay and the service you received, especially at your group dinner in our restaurant.  Thank you for staying with us and we look forward to your next visit.  Kindest regards,  Tom Pugh

Summary: Great hotel, great food (breakfast especially good with the made-to-order omelet bar and the restaurant in the hotel had good selection and great food), beautiful lobby.  Location of hotel not great, but not because of the hotel itself--the area was just not very pedestrian-friendly and really nothing else around it.
Manager Response: Dear Terra K -   Thank you very much for taking the time to post comments on TripAdvisor regarding your stay with us. I am so pleased that you especially enjoyed the breakfast and atium area.   We appreciate your business and look forward to welcoming you back to Orange County soon.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Not what you would expect from an Embassy Suites
Summary: Just returned from three nights at the Embassy Suites in Santa Anna. I would say that the three star rating given to this hotel is correct, but by the skin of their teeth. The building is very old and is in real need of a good refurbishment. A big thing for me was not being able to control the temperature in my room. The HVAC system is so old the entire building can only run ac or heat at one time. So if the temp is above 70 they turn on the ac, if below 55 the heat. If the temp is between 55-70 no heat or ac is running. If you have been to southern Californian you know, especially at night the temp is often between 55-70 meaning no ac or heat for a lot of the time. This may not bother most people but I like a cool room when I sleep and the room was often uncomfortably warm. The
Manager Response: Dear JCAK-  Thank you for posting a review regarding your stay at our hotel on Trip Advisor. I appreciate your insightfuly comments and we will work with our team to improve our product and service. I am pleased that you found our guest service and the breakfast to your liking.   We appreciate your your business I hope you will give us another try in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Orange Co. Airport North
Summary: I am a HHonors Diamond.  Appears like an aging hotel.  Room not ready at checkin.  Rooms smelled like cigarettes.  Mediocre manager's reception.  Premium snacks program not well explained and did not work properly.
Manager Response: Dear Branford N -  I'm so sorry for your poor experience at our hotel. Please be assured I will be discussing your comments with our management team to work on immediate improvements. We take pride in providing the best in lodging and service so our lapses during your stay are being taken very seriously. I would be delighted to be of assistance in this matter if you would like to contact me. Again, on behalf of the staff and management - I offer our apologies.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: I grew up in this area so I know it well. The convenient location is perfect for getting to anywhere in Southern California. San Diego to LA to Santa Barbara, This is perfect.  The hotel is clean , the staff is Great, The food is good and the drinks at happy hour are free!! The rooms give you enough space and are clean. We booked a condo this trip because we were staying 18 days. The condo was dirty. The manager worked hard to get us in at there busy time of year. next time I will forget the Condo idea and just get the room service and stay here again!!!
Manager Response: Dear Bruce P -  Thank you for your review of your stay with us.  We appreciate your business and we are happy to hear you enjoyed our suites, complimentary breakfast and evening reception, as well as the service of our staff.  We look forward to your next stay with us.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights to attend my Moms memorial.  We have been staying here off and on for 20 years. The last night we were there my family wanted to meet to discuss some family business and go over some of my Mom's  personal items. My 17 year old daughter did not want to go since her stomach hurt. On our way home we got a call from our daughter who was very upset. She had been in the hotels business lounge doing some work on the computer. A man stood at the door of the lounge so she let him in, not thinking anything about it. She continued to work for a while then went up to her room to shower. She came back down a few hours later and was surprised when shortly there after he was let in again. Eventually it was just the two of them.  She started to feel
Manager Response: Dear RitaChance-  Thank you for your comments from your stay with us.  We certainly understand how disturbing this was for your daughter and you...we regret this happening to you and at such a difficult time.  We were pleased to hear our staff responded promptly when we were made aware of the situation and our security officer was able to detain this individual until the police arrived.  Since the individual has charges pending for this arrest, the police department has not released the report to us, nor will they share any information at this time.  As soon as they do, we will provide the information provided us to you.  Please contact me if you need any further information.  Tom Pugh

Summary: I would not recommend stay at this hotel to anyone interested in a good night sleep.  Road noise is awful and you cannot control the room temperature.  Staff are nice but for the major issues they cannot help due the system Internet extremely slow and not useful for business.
Manager Response: Dear James B -  Thank you for your review from your stay with us.  We certainly understand your frustation with the issues you experienced and we apologize.  Currently, we are working with our Internet provider to upgrade our system to keep up with the increasing wi-fi needs of our guests.  We appreciate your business and hope to serve you in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Much better than many other reviews suggest
Summary: Booked our rooms only about a week in advance and were pleased with our stay. We had two suites, one with a King bed and one with two queen beds. Rooms and service weren't amazing, but were good, and far better than some reviews we read beforehand.  Location is convenient to shopping, dining and entertainment at the Tustin Legacy complex. Also reasonable distance to the beach. We would certainly stay at the hotel again.
Manager Response: Dear Bruce M -   Thank you for staying with us and posting your comments on TripAdvisor. It sounds like you made the best of your time in Santa Ana and saw some of our attractions.    I appreciate you writing that you will definitely use again if ever in the Orange County area again, that is a wonderful endorsement.  Thank you for your business.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: My husband and I enjoy staying here simply as a pretend getaway. We are only up the street from his work but the hotel is so luxuriously immersive with its beautiful atrium and gorgeously quiet suites that we feel as if we were somewhere else entirely. I also love the indoor pool and spa and it is never overrun with people. Their complimentary breakfast includes a made to order omelette bar and is phenomenal. Even when the rates are high, this place is worth every penny.
Manager Response: Dear Julianna U -  We appreciate your review of your past stays with us.  Thank you for choosing us for your getaways.  We look forward to serving you again soon.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Embassy Suites is my favorite hotel choice. I love their two room suites, breakfast and evening reception. Parking gets full early, but is complimentary. It is worth to wait and look for a parking space. The Staff is very helpful and friendly. We always feel welcome at this Santa Ana Hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Orlando G-  Thank you very much for taking the time to post comments on TripAdvisor regarding your stay with us. I am so pleased that you especially enjoyed our two room suites, the breakfast and manager's reception, along with the service of our staff. We appreciate your business and look forward to serving you again.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary Heading: Great Location, Free Breakfast and Night Reception
Summary: This location is close to airport and business district about a 20 min drive to Disneyland. There are multiple things I love about embassy suites. Breakfast, Night Reception , and Large Room. IF your bring a family this is a must.  Beds are always comfy. With some many option in the area there a lot to choose from.    I would say what stands out the most is housekeeping staff there very friendly and bring a+ in customer service. There attitude make you feel like your the only guest there attending too.   P.S if you have a option definitely upgrade to a premium room/ Internet including plus snacks.
Manager Response: Dear MattSuper -   I was very happy to read that you enjoyed your stay at our hotel. Thank you very much for acknowledging the friendly and accommodating staff, primarily our housekeeping team.  We are striving to create that environment for all our guests so I am pleased to read you felt their hospitality. I appreciate your review of the hotel and hope to see you back soon.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Great feeling of success,my business experience has been a  very wonderful experience. I am planning on bringing my family for a vacation get away. This will be a very excellent family time planning our futures.
Manager Response: Dear Michael J A - We appreciate your comments from your stay with us.  We are pleased your business trip went well and we look forward to welcoming you and your family back to Orange County.  Thank you for your business.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: The complimentary breakfast and afternoon happy hour is nice, but all the elevators smell terrible.  It's a musty dirty feet smell and if you tell someone about it, they will spray air fresheners in the elevators and then you have a flowery dirty feet smell.  We stayed a week visiting family in the area.  This was our second time here.  The weekends are packed with kids running in and out of the pool and dripping on the carpeting in the elevators.  We will find some place else to stay next year.
Manager Response: Dear Linda Y, thank you for posting a review regarding your stay at our hotel on Trip Advisor. I apologize for the odor in the elevators.  We replaced the carpet in the elevators to correct that problem.  I am pleased that you did enjoy the breakfast and our complimentary evening reception. I appreciate your patronage I hope you will give us another try in the future.  Kindest regards, Tom Pugh

Summary: Our family of five were very comfortable at Embassy Suites Santa Ana. The easy off freeway access to the hotel and to surrounding Newport and Huntington Beaches as well as other attractions made our experience very satisfactory.
Manager Response: none

Summary: 1. The staff/managers are rude. 2. Do not have bare necessities -- like towels and blankets. 3. Heaters don't work in many of the rooms. 4. Internet not free. 5. Key card stops working for no apparent reason. 6. They have a practice of double billing you so BEWARE. 7. Elevators are VERY slow.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Buffet is great . Complimentary  every day at 4 PM snack party is nice tacos and drinks . No parking fee . Internet wifi is not free but business center computer access is free . State government rate is often listed and government rate is rarely offered .  Double room suite is nice . large room makes guests feel comfortable . I definitely will come back to this hotel .  There is one diner , non guest come from outside for free buffet in the morning  was asked for room number . He left  immediately without finishing his plate .
Manager Response: none

Summary: Not bad, the room was large, clean, bed linens & towels were also clean and plentiful. Mattress was comfortable so had a good sleep. Had breakfast in the morning which was OK, no complaints. I'd consider staying here again if returning to the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I could not ever get on to the internet in my room. The internet is not free though it is supposed to be free to Hilton Honors Members and ATT customers. If you want to get on to the intenet, you are forced to pay. Could not set clock time on alarm clock which made it useless. No towels in the fitness area or cups in the water cooler.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Great breakfast as always.  Only available with one king bed which is awesome when traveling with a teenage daughter.  I tried to upgrade to the Lolita package where we got a romantic dinner and spa treatments for dad & daughter, but I guess it was sold out.  Kidding, just bitter from sleeping on a couch bed.  Hotel did NOT get ESPN....seriously, I can get ESPN in Outer Mongolia
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hotel has great location and easy access to several sites. Staff is very friendly.  Lobby is very nice, but rooms seem dated compared to other Embassy Suites I've stayed in. We would definitely stay here again if we get in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Nice hotel with a lot of space. Breakfast was wonderful with a lot of choices. This is not a full service hotel, so carts are never available. If you are traveling with a lot of luggage, good luck on getting a cart. We traveled with an infant and had to use the stroller to help with the luggage. We asked the front desk on two occasions for a cart and they could not locate us one. The hotel has 5 carts, but the guest were not considerate. Other than this, it is a very nice and clean property.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Please improve smell of your rooms
Summary: The rooms we were given had bad smell. We changed two rooms. Both had terrible smell. The first one with smoke. We gave up in the end. We just opened the windows and left to town. We still had the smell when we came back.   The bed was comfortable. that was one thing we liked.  Breakfast was too crowded. The lines long. Not sure if it was worth it in the end.
Manager Response: Mulugeta,  Thank you for your review of your guest room. I shared your feedback with the hotel team and we are actively taking steps to freshen our guest rooms. I appreciate your time in reviewing our hotel and look forward to seeing you during your next visit to the area.  Kind Regards,

Summary: Hotel was clean, staff professional, room was very nice.  Breakfast and managers reception were awesome.  Billing was a nightmare though.  We were charged a security hold and a charge for a night we did not even stay there.  4 days later and 2 phone calls to hotel and charges still not released.  If staying here make sure you have several extra hundred dollars in your account as they double charge you for each night you stay (or don't stay).
Manager Response: none

Summary: This old girl needs help! It's dated in a lot of areas and not up to par with typical Embassy Suites. The staff is nice and helpful but the rooms are dated and a bit beat up (very un Hilton-like). The wifi is spotty and almost unusable and worse for those that are not HHonors Gold or above you must pay for this horrible service. Great location for John Wayne Airport but unless they give it a facelift I'll stay somewhere else.
Manager Response: 62RKE,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with the appearance of our two-room suites and the quality of our Wi-Fi. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Kind Regards, Tim

Summary Heading: Better than most Embassy Suites, but it's an Embassy Suites
Summary: I will have to say I was surprised by this location. I can usually smell cigarette smoke in most ESs, but didn't smell it at all. Everything is what you would expect. Service was good, relatively clean and room was comfortable. Location is very convenient and provides easy access to pretty much anywhere in Orange County. Also has a couple of different ways to access the hotel, which I like. Even though there are three other hotels right next to it, it was relatively quiet.  The only minuses include the "balcony", which is really just an extended railing and is accessible by the rooms next to you. The parking lot spaces must have been sized by someone from Europe, because at times, I had to crawl out of my car "Nascar style". The lot also smell of urine in some places. Also, make
Manager Response: none

Summary: Perhaps 12th or 13th weekend getaway with Kids. Swimming, excercise, local amusements and that great included breakfast is alaways a hit.  With our weekend getaways so successful, we like to always look for an Embassey Suites Hotel when traveling too.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Embassy Suites is ok, but I've seen better hotels... The decor and furnishings are dated, and my room had a strange smell. The bathrooms are also tiny and dark  Parking isn't great, even though it's free... They have a small-ish lot, and the spaces are very small and very tight.   Traffic noise on the freeway side is loud, especially since the sliding doors have a huge gap in them and are single pane... You also cannot really control the heating/cooling system in the rooms. No matter what the temperature is outside, hot or cool air in your room is pre-decided by the date, not the weather.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We just spent five days, four nights here and we're going back!!!!!  Having TWO queen beds PLUS the sofa sleeper worked great for our three sons.  We all looked forward each morning to the hot breakfast, and the cooked-to-order omelettes were incredible, with about 12 ingredients to choose from.  The room was very comfortable, with two new Samsung TV's, and the lobby was very inviting.  Our sons loved the fish and turtles, and the front desk even provides fish food for the kids to have to feed the fish!  Front desk staff were incredibly accommodating and helped us with many requests!  We've already booked our next stay later this summer!  And, by the way, an "easy" 12 minute drive to Disneyland!
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel exceeded our expectations. We're from Utah and booked on line. My grandkids loved the breakfast and the elevators! The maids were very nice.We didn't get a chance to use the pool. The turtles were so cute. We will stay at this hotel if were ever in the area!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I stay at this hotel about 4 times a year for business and the very close to our Corporate Headquarters.  This is family friendly hotel and the price seems to be reasonable.  Rooms are clean.  I don't like that I can't control the temparture of the room too hot for me.
Manager Response: none

Summary: drinking water in cold pitcher in the lobby not available. bathroom fixtures leaking. leaks from the ceiling. but i heard the place is under construction but should pay more attention to room readiness. it was inconvenient to be moved to another room.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotel is usually very good. I visit this area very often and stay here when the rates are reasonable. It is a little dated and needs maintenance, but is pretty nice when the rates are down. When the rates are high, this is not a good value and I stay here 4 or 5 times a year out of 11 to 12 times out of the year.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Having stayed at this hotel in the past, I was expecting it to be much nicer. I stayed for one night on 6/16 during this most recent trip. We arrived at 5:30 p.m. only to find someone's breakfast room service still sitting on a tray in the hallway across from our door. We called the front desk immediately and asked them to pick it up. We went to the front desk later and told them again and the tray was still there at 9:30 the next morning when we left. The room was fine other than the fact the window looked like it hadn't been washed in years. There was so much bird dropping on the window that the view was obscured. We did try out the pool but had to go to the front desk twice to ask them to bring towels. Forty minutes later they finally brought some towels. The breakfast was ok
Manager Response: Sean,  Thank you for your review of your past stay with us. I always appreciate hearing from our guests and I apologize that it took so long to get the breakfast tray removed from outside of your room. I have taken your comments to our team to ensure that in the future we do a better job of supplying towels to guests and preparing an adequate amount of bacon in the morning. I hope that you will be our guest again The next time you have the opportunity to travel to the Orange County.  Kind Regards, Tim

Summary Heading: My trip to Orange County California
Summary: When I come to Orange County, California, I like to stay in the Santa Ana area because I am familiar with the area.   Embrassy Suite is a nice centrally located and I have always had a nice stay there.   I also appreciate the the fact that they do not charge for parking. This one fact maybe the only reason as to why I stay there.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I travel a lot because of my work; this hotel is very close to it so I use it sometimes. The room smelled like wet rags. Even opening the balcony doors all day did not help. The AC is preset and you can only adjust the fan, so it does not get as cool as I like it. The staff was great and the complimentary services (breakfast and evening reception) are great, that‚Äôs the main reasons I use the hotel.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I goto the OC for biz travel about every other month, and was booked into this hotel for my last trip. Outside very pleasant appeal, inside lobby, very nice, main areas good, suites, not so good. They'll do in a pinch, or if you have a family and are spending the weekend going to the local attractions, but for a business traveler, there are better places to stay. Rooms are aging, and the heating and cooling issues needs to be addressed sooner rather than later. Food and nightly reception ok nothing special, and room service pizza average to poor. Overall, just an average rating
Manager Response: none

Summary: Room was clean. Vent in the bathroom is always a plus.  Air condition actually worked very well.  Front desk clerk that checked me in was a bit rude and made me feel as if I was interrupting her day.  All in all the hotel was clean.
Manager Response: none

Summary: A one night stay here was as expected for an Embassy Suites with a few exceptions, both positive and negative.    The hotel is in a good centrally located Orange County location, adjacent to the 55 freeway, and some rooms have a view of John Wayne Airport.  I was given a room on the top floor.  It had a small balcony and great views.  The room was standard for Embassy, but the bathroom is quite small with the sink, toilet, and shower all sharing a small space.  That might be an issue for some if several family members were battling for the bathroom amenities.  The TV in the bedroom did not get all of the available channels.  I checked the cables, but didn't request service since I didn't notice this until late in the evening.  Rooms on this floor did have access to free snacks
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Rooms were clean but a little outdated.
Summary: Check in was extremely quick. Room was large however, was in need of updates. We enjoyed the free hot breakfast and and ate dinner at the grill one night. Overall, a good deal for the price. I would stay here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Friendly front desk staff, excellent made-to-order omelets available as part of the complimentary hot breakfast each morning, and the rooms are spacious.  The Embassy Suites Santa Ana - Orange County Airport North location is only about 10 minutes driving distance from John Wayne/Orange County Airport.  My only complaint is that the room I had for my one-night visit was rather musty.  Perhaps the carpet needs a cleaning or someone may have smoked in what was supposed to be a non-smoking room? So, for this visit, three stars instead of four.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We did have a great stay, staff was incredible friendly. Breakfast was really good and the managers reception is ALWAYS a plus.Our rooms was very clean but very humid and it had the humidity smell to it and the A/C did not help much. The hotel needs a but of facelift .
Manager Response: none

Summary: The room that my friend booked for us was very spacious which was perfect! Though I wish the bathroom was a little bit bigger. I do have to complain about the front desk. Before departing from the hotel, I called the front desk for some shampoo and conditioner because we didn't have our room made. I called 3 times, the front desk kept reassuring that the housekeeper was on her way. Nothing. Nada. Zilch. In the end, I gave up and just left...very disappointed. Also, the breakfast was pretty good, but I wish they have more people cleaning up the tables or have an area to put dirty dishes for the guests because my friends and I took awhile to find a sitting area for us to enjoy our breakfast. I would come back to this hotel if the price is right, and improve on the guest services.
Manager Response: mscarms,  Thank you for taking the time to post about your most recent stay with us.  Your comments are greatly appreciated and have been shared with the front office, housekeeping, and complimentary services team.  We hope that you will consider staying with us again when your travels bring you back to the Orange County Airport area.  Warmest Regards, Tim

Summary: Hotel is nice. Its pretty clean, rooms stay quiet despite the atrium. The breakfast is a big plus... its not great, but it does well for what you get. Ive stayed here before and had a good experince as well. Its location is perfect for staying/working anywhere in the Santa Ana and Irvine area.

Summary: This was my first stay at an Embassy Suites hotel, so I did not know what to expect. It was a very pleasant surprise. I had requested early check in (1200 noon), but when I arrived at 930 am a two room suite was available for me. The suite was clean and well furnished, with two flat screen TV's. The complimentary breakfast was much more than sweet rolls and coffee, and included made to order omelets, scrambled eggs, crisp bacon, toast, bagels, and much more. My only disappointment with the hotel was a lack of pay movies on the TV.

Summary: My 1st stay at embassy suites-loved the openess of the facility--buffet breakfast is great--managers nightly reception was a bonus would recommend to anyone---look forward to my next stay at embassy suites hotel

Summary: Great location, excellent customer service, and great value for your money.  They have wonderful breakfast service which my kids really enjoyed. He spent 15 mins in my room only to leave stating he could only get a few channels to work...but at least my other tv in the suite worked.  When I got into the shower, I had very little water pressure...that was another disappointment.  I mentioned to the front desk again, and they did take care of one night of my room which was nice.  The next morning I did make it down to the breakfast which was quite good.  The made

If you are picky about things like broken handles on dressers you may have complaints. For our family it was perfect. Fridge worked, beds were clean and comfortable, and housekeeping did a good job navigating thru our piles. :) *Staff at breakfast was great. Our second day there Paula (didnt catch last name) overheard it was our Sons 8th birthday, and put together a little plate of buns and fruit and gathered the rest of the staff to sing happy birthday to him. He was very proud! *First night we were there was Saturday of Easter weekend and the pool was out of

Summary: everything good, great hotel nice suits, swimming pool is nice but the water is a little bit too cold specially getting out the jacuzzi. but the service is great the shelves with clean towels is always full. the gym its big enough to have a good workout, plenty of drinking water.  the breakfast area gets crowded but it flows easily, parking there is plenty,I love the easy access to the freeways and south coast plaza. ok that's all I can remember I know they requested at least 200 characters for this survey but I don't know what else to write and I'm sorry but I have more important things to do.

Summary: This Embassy Suites is a decent value with free parking, breakfast, and evening cocktails included. Due to its proximity to Disney Land there are a lot families here over the weekend. I like Embassy Suites, but as Hilton properties I'm continually surprised that they don't update them and maintain them better than they do. I have stayed as Embassy Suites all over the US and the majority of them need updated/remodeled. The beds definitely need the mattresses replaced.  Overall though this location is a decent value.

Summary Heading: STAY AWAY FROM THE SANTA ANA EMBASSY SUITES
Summary: I am a Hilton Honors member and overall find the properties to be quite acceptable. This was absolutely the exception rather than the rule. The hotel is in dire need of a facelift. My room door wouldn't shut behind me so I had to make sure that it was locked. The pool was not clean according to my work colleague. The tv satellite was now working. The room was musty smelling. The outlet in the bathroom didn't work. My room (and I'm a Diamond member) faced the airport flight path and was noisy. The parking was a problem since they taped off part of the lot for busses. But other than that Mrs. Lincoln. . . ..

Summary Heading: One of the Best Embassy Suites!
Summary: This is one of the best Embassy Suites I have ever stayed at; looks very new with a different design on the outside than most of the others.  Inside, a beautiful lobby and the usual delightful atrium with water features and tropical greenery with loads of casual seating throughout the atrium.  Very spacious living room and bedroom, beautifully decorated, along with clean bathrooms, and very comfortable beds; The room was very quiet.  Complimentary happy hour is nice. The complimentary breakfast includes the made-to-order omelets, bacon, waffles, muffins, fruit, cereals, juices, and very good coffee!

Summary: I stay in Embassy suites all the time when I travel. I was skeptical about staying near the airport as they are usually pretty ran down due to the constant traffic. This one definitely changed my opinion, as it was the best embassy I have ever stayed in.  The staff was courteous and professional, to include the cooks, room service, and front desk. The rooms were clean and well appointed and the room cleaning staff were exceptional.   I have no complaints and recommend to stay at!

Summary: Convenient location. Breakfast included. Less that 10 minutes from the airport and South Coast Plaza.   The outside looks nice, but inside it is older. The rooms could use upgrades. Seems like a lot of school trips stay here. Every evening lots of kids running around the lobby. The elevators are under construction so there are only 3 that operate. The side door to the hotel was broken, requiring you to swipe your key card three times.

Summary: I stayed 3 nights at this hotel. It is about 5-7 minutes car ride from the airport, and the hotel offers a complimentary shuttle service to and from the airport. It has a beautiful atrium where a`complimentary breakfast and happy hour are offered everyday. Landscaped in the middle of the atrium is a "stream" well-stocked with adult kois and turtles. Our room was roomy and comfortable. My fondest memory about staying at this hotel was when the nice waitress came by at breakfast on her off day because she learned by chance the day before that I was in town with my family to celebrate several of our birthdays. She rounded up the other wait staff and came to our table to sing happy birthday. We were all so touched by her caring and thoughtfulness and that she took time on her off

Summary: This location was picked for our daughters wedding for the beauty & for the convenience of our guests who traveled far to join us.It turned out to be one of the best decisions we made in planning this huge event. There was some confusion created by an outside vendor, but Samantha & team stepped up & assured us that all will be fine and they would do what they could to make it all work! Happy to report that it did! From the front desk, to housekeeping, wait staff and beyond. Everyone was courteous and very professional. Not only would I recommend this beautiful Embassy Suites to stay, but to also hold any type of event . Our guests, who we treasure, had the best time there.Made a huge impression on them!

Summary: Embassy Suites made our trip even more enjoyable because of their service.  The atmosphere as well as the service creates a very relaxing stay.  The proximity to John Wayne Airport is also a big advantage to travelers.

Summary: This hotel is beautiful, comfortable, with the best bed I've ever slept on! The indoor waterfalls and ponds are wonderful, with many comfortable areas to relax provided a refreshing break. Complimentary breakfast was excellent.

Summary: Room was clean and spacious. Staff were pleasant. Nice to have breakfast and happy hour included. Good location, easy in and out access.  Unfortunately there was only one elevator in operation at time of our stay.

Summary: Luxurious hotel without the luxurious price! The room was spacious and inviting. We felt we could relax without any worries. Staff were pleasant and welcoming. The inside court give us a sense we were not even in the city. Definitely would return in an instant!

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Santa Ana Airport North
Summary: The toilet did not work for two days. The bath tub took 1 hour to drain. This place is a dump. The hotel was very full and the bar and restaurant were understaffed for the crowd. The server encouraged me not to order hot food as it would slow the kitchen. Still a dump.

Summary Heading: Excellent stay near SNA airport and Newport Beach
Summary: We had a family vacation for spring break that took us to various sites around southern California.  We had flights departing Orange County, so chose this hotel to be near the airport and also the beach.  The accommodations and staff were great!  Highly recommended.

Summary: I returned to this hotel a second time within 6 months because I enjoyed the extra large rooms and the huge breakfast so much.  This time I had several maintenance problems and had to move rooms 3 times.  On the last day of my stay, I let the management staff know about the troubles I'd been having, and the staff bent over backwards to make it right.  Tony (I think that was his name), the manager on duty at 7am on 2/17, went way above and beyond to make me happy, and so did his manager Tim.  The customer service here is outstanding.  So is the breakfast!

Summary: Entering the hotel was very pleasurable. beyond what was expected. my sons loved the koi fish. breakfast was amazing but need to get up a bit early to not get stuck in the back of the line. complimentary evening reception was okay, did not enjoy the beverages very much but there was a non alcoholic beverage that was good. this hotel is amazing and the service is also amazing. will recommend to everyone.

Summary Heading: Embassy in need of remodel and TLC
Summary: Location sold us on the Embassy close to Orange County attractions.  It  was okay but with so many choices nearby it needs to step up or be counted out.  Positives: Location and good proximity to freeways.   Roomy accommodations that can sleep a good sized group. Reception at night and breakfast in the morning. Spa that is good after a long day walking the OC parks.  Negatives: Rooms were dated and worn.  Had a dingy feel to them. Common areas and elevators will be overrun with soccer teams, dance teams and band members. Surrounding area is mixed at best.  Overall: It is past it's prime and more enticing options are available.

Summary: The hotel sits in a cluster of airport-adjacent accommodations, and the surrounding area is rather industrial. Our room was clean and comfortable. It was also on the corner of the building, closer to the main street; however, the road noise was minimal and definitely did not interrupt my sleep. The breakfast had a nice variety of options, including an omelet bar, and the staff were very friendly. The pool/fitness area is fine.  This is a good option if you need the convenience of being near the airport and highway.

Summary: We had such a wonderful experience at the Embassy Suites.  On one could ask for better service, food and accommodations. Most banquet dining is the same old rubber chicken and over cooked / touch steak. NOT HERE! Fresh, cooked to perfection and Yummmmmy.  Everyone enjoyed our time and we will be back. Thank you to everyone who made this a great time.

Summary: We just returned from an enjoyable 4 night stay at The Embassy Suites in Santa Ana. The hotel is very close to the airport and many attractions in the area. There is a free hotel shuttle to and from the airport which is very handy. The beds were very comfortable and the rooms were very spacious and clean. We enjoyed the free complete breakfast every morning as they offered many choices of foods. The staff at the hotel were all very friendly and helpful and it made for an enjoyable stay.  We didn't have time to enjoy the pool or fitness area during our stay .We will definitely stay here when we return to the area.

Summary: The room and Hotel were very comfortable, the staff was very friendly. Very good breakfast in morning and happy hour complimentary. Fitness center very nice.  Overall experience for the price Excellent.  Only negative the internet in rooms were very slow.

Summary: Let me preface this by saying that I love staying at an Embassy Suites. That being said, this one is showing its age and may be time for an update. First, the bad. Water pressure is hit and miss. It will come and go as you are in the shower and get very cold, then very hot, then very cold before returning to your setting. The elevators can be odd. I had a conversation with one guest who stated that the elevator we were on at the time (one of the three in the back) was stopping at every even floor on its way down and while we were on it, it skipped his floor altogether and took us to ours first, which was above his. Last, the housekeeping staff left a bottle of cleaner in the bathroom. Not altogether horrible, but we have a curious toddler that love to play with anything he could
Manager Response: Ken,  Thank you for your review of the Embassy Suites Santa Ana - Orange County Airport North.  We are very appreciative of the feedback!  You've touched on a few key points that I would like to address for you.  Standard Rooms - We are very excited to report that renovation of our standard guest rooms is slated as part of our capital plan.  We are in the very preliminary stages, but eager to see the results come to fruition.  Water Pressure ‚Äì I‚Äôve contacted my chief engineer to report the water temperature variances that you experienced.  Please rest assured that he will be investigating your report and making sure that similar occurrences do not happen for future guests of the hotel.  Cleaner ‚Äì There is certainly no excuse for our team to have accidently left behind a bottle of Spic n‚Äô Span in your guest bathroom.  Please accept my apology on behalf of the hotel for this error.  Elevators ‚Äì The hotel over the past year has been in the process of modernizing the hotel‚Äôs elevator system.  Currently, 3 of the 5 elevators have been completed and the remaining 2 elevators will go down for rehab at the end of March, for 10 weeks.  We are very excited for the new digital components and upgraded technology!  Pool Temperature - The hotel is required by the health code to maintain a pool temperature of 82*F.  This on occasion can feel warmer or cooler than normal depending on our weather patterns.  Per say the region had been experiencing cold weather and had heat wave, the pool could be perceived as cold since the heat wave is so dramatic.  3 times per day, our engineering team checks the pools temperature and chemical balance to ensure optimum swimming conditions and safety for all of our guests.   Thank you so much for your positive comments about our staff!  We believe the a clean and friendly hotel is fundamental to any establishment and it is our goal to continuously provide "10" level service to our guests.  I'm so glad that we were able to hit the mark for you!  Each day our staff strives to make our hotel a better place than it was the day before.  We look forward to you seeing our continuous improvement to an already fantastic hotel, on your next stay to the Orange County area!  Warmest Regards, Timothy R. Summary: bassy Suites Santa Ana went above and beyond for my husband and I. We were married there a year to the day, so to celebrate our Anniversary we stayed the night there. Summary Heading: Nice hotel, extra charge for internet?

This charge is unreasonable for business travelers who depend on the access.  Adding the fee to the room charge would make the room seem less competitive, I suppose.  The extra charge just put me off.  Sorry.

Summary: This hotel is wonderful -- staff was courteous and helpful when needed.  Rooms were clean and fresh although showed a little age.  Evening reception (cocktails and food) was excellent as was the breakfast in the morning.  Would absolutely stay again!!!

There is nothing to do within walking distance of the Hotel, but Newport beach is about 6 miles way (watch out for evening traffic on HWY 55!!!).

Summary Heading: Family friendly, Service friendly, would go again!
Summary: A 3 night stay here wAs very enjoyable with the extensive breakfast, friendly staff, pool and hot tub, and very kid and teen friendly.   Although a ways from Disneyland, it saved us money by being further out.   Local restaurants and shops were within great distance.   Has restaurant in the facilty that had good food, and each night there is a light snacklike dinner and free adult beverages!  A+

Summary Heading: A Great Chain But A Dated Location
Summary: Embassy Suites is know for it's open atrium, water features, complementary happy hours and breakfasts. Unfortunately this particular location is becoming dated. The lobby is dark. The good news is that the bed, comforter and pillows was incredibly comfortable. And the hotel is quiet allowing a wonderful, peaceful night's sleep. You really can't beat a full breakfast and complementary drinks in the evening for the price of the night's stay. Hopefully they have some capital improvements planned to keep the place looking fresh and inviting.

Summary: I stayed her with my wife and daughter for three nights. We like to stay at Embassy Suites because of the bedroom and complimentary breakfast. Our room faced the freeway. Summary: While staying in the Embassy Suites on business, I used the pool, hot tub, gym, breakfast and night cap. They've done quite a few renovations here and even though it's the "older design" for Embassy Suites, it's still an excellent hotel. I felt very comfortable at this hotel. The staff was attentive, kind and quick. The gym got packed after 7am but what good gym doesn't. Worked the dumbbells until a treadmill was available. I'm looking forward to coming back on my next business trip!

Summary: I was given 3 hotels near my destination with the Embassy Suites as the highest. I was very please with the "non refundable" price, my trip was set and it made this high quality room less than the Holiday Inn (bottom of the 3 suggestions). High quality for the price, Great value.

Summary: I stayed on a Sunday, and I loved it.  I arrived at noon, hoping I might be able to check in early.  They were more than accommodating, not only allowing the check in but making sure it was the room type I was looking for, etc.  The room was very comfortable and spacious; parking was simple and free, access to the freeway was about as good as it gets, and the bedroom was both comfortable and quiet.  Noise can definitely be an issue at Embassy Suites due to the layout; however, there were no issues at all (and, in general, if you close the bedroom door, you will not hear anything from the atrium).  Breakfast was plentiful; the crowds not an issue.  The only thing that was a little less than satisfactory was the appetizer choices for the manager's reception - seemed to be as cheap

Summary Heading: Tried It Once - Won't Be Back
Summary: We hadn't stayed here due to mixed reviews, but the most recent ones included words like "recently renovated," so we risked it.    The good:  Beautiful atrium and lobby area (except for outdated green elevators) - enjoyed the turtles and koi in the water feature; great service; excellent breakfast; super comfortable bed  Why we won't go back:  TINY bathroom (door hits your knees if opened when you're on the toilet); mildewy smell in living room; peeling wallpaper in bedroom; no control over room temp; dirty windows (mostly between the panes, so uncleanable); $6.70 charge for wi-fi per day, PER DEVICE  To sum up:  Embassy Suites is our "splurge" when in the area, but next time we'll either stay at the Best Western across the street or the Embassy Suites at the airport.

Summary: Staff were very attentive and courteous in a relaxed manner.  Breakfast offerings were very good, including an omelet-to-order "bar." Even the adjustable swivel chair would not go quite high enough for comfortable handwriting on the desk table. If you're inclined to whimsy, I was puzzled to find a fire sprinkler head above the shower/tub.  Maybe to discourage overly hot showers? There were newer sprinkler heads placed appropriately in the rooms, though. I will happily rebook this hotel on my next trip to the area.

Summary: You are at the mercy of the hotel as they are a "single pipe" property.  Either the A/C is on (outside temp must be above 70) or the heat is on (outside temp below 55).  If the temp is between 55 and 70 all you get is recirculating air.  So, when the temp 72 during the day and your room faces to the west with the sun going down and heats up 90 -- you have no cool air as soon as the outside temp drops below 70.  Worst design ever.

Summary: Beautiful Lobby and Bar area.  Food is pretty good.  The hotel itself is Priced right, especially for California.  I would/will stay here any time I am in southern California.  An the turtles like honey dew melon.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel for John Wayne Airport Area
Summary: I've been staying at the Embassy Santa Ana on and off for quite some time. The staff is great. The employees are very friendly and usually helpful. The hotel itself is an older property with some quirks, but the rooms are very generous in size and most of them have outside balcony's which is a nice plus. They have been renovating the rooms and common areas with new carpeting and furniture. Bedding is very comfortable and lots of large pillows are provided. The bathrooms are very small but functional. Many rooms have an additional sink/dressing area in the bedroom which is nice to have with the small bathrooms. There's nice size flat screen TV's in the living room and bedroom - a decent selection of free TV channels but no pay-per-view movies are available. The hotel has an older
Manager Response: none

Summary: I rarely write reviews but often read them before choosing a hotel.  Before I booked this hotel I didn't see any mention that heat is not offered at this hotel even though I stayed in January, the outside temperature was 56 degrees, and I paid $162 per night.  The hotel is so outdated that they have an HVAC, two pipe system which means they have heat or air conditioning but both are not available at the same time.  However, when the temperature is between 55 and 70 degrees, neither the air conditioning or heat is available.  The hotel provided me with a space heater when I asked about the heat.  However, the one they provided me put off very little heat and didn't affect the room temperature.  I won't stay here again.

Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: When the "hot" water is 82 degree F
Summary: I reported to the front desk about the "missing Hot Water", he replied to me: only your room has this problem. Waited 20 mins for a red eyed serviceman to check the temperature, it was 82F, which is lower than our body temp. When I complained the elevator has no light, the front desk told me: it will be remodeling soon. However, there are no sign on the elevator indicating remodeling. The elevator doors are scratching all over.  The most Terrible hotel experience I ever have.
Manager Response: We are sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services and amenities you deserve. Thank you for your feedback regarding our water heaters. We know how important a hot shower is and your comments will help us in our training and development to assured it does not happen again. Summary Heading: Thank you to Mike, the manager on duty 11PM - 6 AM (BEST MANAGER AT THAT HOTEL)
Summary: This hotel is a very nice property.  We felt it was well maintained and the staff were courteous and (of course) the breakfast served each AM was excellent.  We stayed there August 23 - 26, 2013 and that was the weekend of some large soccer tournament.  The hotel was packed with families and lots of grade school and Jr. High children. Despite the crowded breakfasts as all those children were trying to eat and get off to the tournaments by 8 AM, the buffet staff kept the lines moving and did a great job with the food and clean up!  We inquired when the tournament was over and they told us most guests were checking out on Sunday PM.  We were happy because this meant one night without all the kids running around the common areas until late at night.  We returned that night (the
Manager Response: none

Summary: This hotels location means that if you happen to get a room facing the freeway, plan on listening to cars all night long. The windows do nothing to try to help as they are very thin and provide little sound dampening. I was unfortunately put in one of these rooms and was unpacked before I even realized. Made for a terrible nights sleep.  The hotel lacks an attention to detail with paint chipped all around, elevator buttons not working, and a general age that is starting to show.   The best part of the hotel is the free drinks and free breakfast.   I would not stay here again and opt for something a little newer.
Manager Response: none

Summary: First impression of the hotel was a 10, the complimentary breakfast a 12. My only complaint was dirty sheets upon arrival and I am a germaphob, it concerned me about the cleanliness of the rest of the hotel. Excellent staff and accommodations otherwise. It's a beautiful hotel and layout.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Wouldnt stay here for leisure, just work - but nice enough. far away from everything. Semi-Close to South Coast Plaza. Staff was great. Food was not. Nice to have the extra room, but the quality of the room was not up to the HIlton name
Manager Response: none

Summary: Whenever I stay at a hotel like this I realise how lucky we have it in some parts of East Africa. The rooms could have been much cleaner, and I could swear that my non-smoking room (531) had been a smoking room the morning we arrived. I had to walk down to the nearby fuel station shop to try and find an air freshener to get rid of the stench. The thermostat was disappointingly rigid and I was generally far removed from the luxuries that our East African hotels sometimes provide. It had good points though - especially the good nature of the staff (front desk and shuttle service especially) and thank God for the in-room tea and coffee and microwave oven.
Manager Response: none

Summary: If you like to spend 1 hour 15 minutes looking for a parking space, I have found your hotel.  If you want to find a hotel that values parties over hotel guests, you have come to the right hotel.  If you want to find a room with a thermostat that does not exist, save for the fan, I have a great spot for you.  If you want to spend $120 for a room and be treated as an necessary evil by the front desk, you should truly look into this hotel. If you want to try out the manager's "guest reception", as long as you are into potato chips and pretzels, you will be in heaven.  Hilton should be ashamed of this ES.  I, as a gold status member of HH, am not a first time guest of HIlton properties, nor if one reads my other reviews, am I  a frequent negative critic of hotels, but this

Summary: Surprisingly, very high quality dinner.  Breakfast was mediocre, crowded and loud, eggs, bacon, sausage were served cold.  Room was typical Embassy Suites, comfortable; the bed was very comfortable. Hotel location is very convenient with easy freeway access.

Summary: The hotel is in a great location on our way back from seeing family in San Diego. We had another family get together in Newport Beach. The location is great just off of the 55 fwy. We had a very quick drive into Newport Beach. The front desk staff had our room ready when we arrived. The room was clean. The breakfast was great as usual. The hotel was sold out but had more than enough staff the handle the amount of guest during the morning rush.  Keep up the great work!
Manager Response: none

Summary: As always this property was accommodating, had great beds, was clean and has an amazing breakfast.  Our only disappointment was that the pool did not appear to be heated and was pretty cold despite it being summer.

Food is good, but the smell at the bar absolutely wrecks my meal. Clean up the drains, folks. I'm in a new, renovated room. The room and furniture are very nice, but my experience at the Sweet Spot restaurant ruined my stay.

Summary: The hotel is an older Embassy Suites which is nice as it has the large atrium lobby.  The room was large, clean and maintained.  The reception was better than some I have seen at Embassy Suties and the breakfast was as to be expected for this hotel brand. Summary: This property is starting to show it's age, the rusted door frame in our bathroom, and the noisy A/C in our room, for example. Summary: Time to renovate. Hotel is on a busy freeway so request a room on the non freeway side. Do not eat in the restaurant unless you like cardboard, a staff that makes you feel like you are a burden and you have no sense of smell. Front desk was efficient and helpful. The breakfast was a value and the staff at breakfast was courteous.

Summary Heading: Great Family Hotel - close to beaches, disneyland and beyond
Summary: Once again, our family experienced a wonderful time at an embassy suites location. This time, we were in a pinch and needed to book something last minute as our friends place wasn't available. This location next to highway 55 near the Orange County John Wayne International Airport was available for the Sunday July 21 until checking out Tuesday July 23. We had a room with two queen beds in one room, and the other room had a queen pull out. What was great is that we got to have a full made to order breakfast each day plus a reception in the evening before we went out for dinner.  And Newport Beach was just 20 minutes away. I would recommend going though to Corona Del Mar (you can park for free on the streets above the beach and once you walk down the stairs, there is a picnic area
Manager Response: none

Summary: When I feel tired and old I want quiet comfort - not a hotel that is tired and old!  I like Embassy Suites, but not so much this one.  On the upside - the bed was comfortable and the towels were soft, even the standard Embassy breakfast was good.  It went down hill after that.  The first room I had faced E Dyer Rd and the freeway and the noise was constant and loud from the road.  They did accommodate my move to a quieter side of the building on my third night, so then I was able to hear the people on each side and above me more clearly without the road noise to drown them out.  Also, since the entry (with side windows) faces a mezzanine, I got to enjoy echoed voices at night and clanking breakfast dishes in the morning.  Sooooo, if you are a light sleeper this is not the place

Summary: I was a little leery reading some previous reviews but I have to say it was a great experience. I was here for 11 nights and during the entire trip the staff was consistently nice & helpful. They were very accommodating when I requested to change to a room on the 2nd floor with a bigger balcony & was able to do so on the 2nd day.  It was very helpful to have a washer & dryer available as well. Great breakfast with lots of choices (although I did wish they had the flavored coffee creamers you usually see at hotels). Great location, close to restaurants and shopping. Overall pretty quite although the hotel was full to capacity with sports teams, lots of kids. etc.  I did wish they had an outdoor pool but it was ok.  As people have stated this is an older hotel but me and the

Summary: Using the same elevator as housekeeping is very frustrating. They take up all the room and stop on every floor making the wait for any elevator too long. Other then that our stay was excellent as always!

Summary: I am a diehard road warrior that usually stays at an another brand, but due to the great rate and proximity to the freeways I chose the Embassy Suites.  I found the business center a big plus.  They do not nickel and dime you with printer/copier usage and had ample supplies.   The breakfast of made to order omelets and fruit were a great way to start the day, but they also had your typical hotel fare of cereal, bacon etc...  There was plenty of seating and I always was able to grab a USA today or Wall Street Journal without having to scrounge around for an extra copy in the morning.  The evening reception was just that, a snack with drinks to tide you over until dinner.   I felt the staff was very prompt in meeting my needs and questions while there.  This was from the front

Summary: Dirty pool.  Noisy hotel with slow service. A lot of families. Great free breakfast. Just an older hotel that will miss your expectations if you are looking for anything other than a place to sleep with your headphones in. Don't expect quick service or good help. Safe, great location and the doors lock. That's about it.

During the day, our kids & I swam in the pool, it was nice.  But at night, then entire pool was taken over by kids.  There was good everywhere, even in the pool. Summary: excellent  hotel, older charm,  but  updated.  excellent staff. Love the indoor pool.  Breakfast very good, easy access to the freeway, but heard no noise.  Love all the plants and turtles and goldfish.  Put in new couch with an actually comfortable sofa bed!

Summary: I was very concerned about the hotel due to the reviews regarding the condition of the rooms.  We spent 5 days and the location is great.  The rooms are clean, new carpets, fresh paint, comfortable bed.  My daughter slept on the sofa bed and the mattress was not great so we called and the send up another new mattress for the sofa bed and it worked out great.  The furniture is a bit dated but fine the bathroom small but again fine.  The breakfast and happy hour are great.  Overall a very pleasant stay.  We will be back.  Great service.

Summary Heading: Beautiful surroundings but rooms did not feel clean
