I am not sure the bedspreads were ever laundered and to have to wash our clothes in the laundry facilities was difficult as the laundry room was so dirty and the machines felt old.   Breakfast was always wonderful with the made to order omelets and the staff is extremely friendly.  Maybe a tad over friendly as they asked to remove your plate without swallowing your last bite. However, the turtles were sure cute to watch in the water.   The coffee creamer had an old clump of cream on the bottom of the creamer pitcher.  I stopped drinking the coffee after that.   The surroundings are beautiful and the first few hours seem
Manager Response: I am very sorry we were not able to provide you with the quality of services you deserve.  We are always looking for ways to improve our guest experience. Summary: I stayed at this hotel while attending a convention for 4 nights.  The rooms were clean, beds and pillows comfortable, and their breakfast was VERY good.  Not your usual free hotel breakfast fare.  They had made-to-order omelettes as well as all the other things you would expect and more.  I'm usually a light sleeper, but slept uninterrupted for all 4 nights.  My only compliant was that I was unable to log onto the free Wi-Fi from the bedroom, only from the sitting room.

Summary Heading: Plenty of Room for a Week Long Business Trip
Summary: I had a business trip that lasted a full week and anyone traveling for a living knows that a week long trip is not picnic.  The hotel is centrally located near the airport, can get to Fashion Island in less than 5 minutes, and Newport Beach within 15 minutes in good traffic.  The hotel itself felt spacious and the managers reception at night was great to relax after business meetings during the day.  In the morning breakfast had plenty of options and did not feel over crowded.  The room was clean and after a long day I could relax in the sitting room.  I would stay here again.

Summary: Good hotel but internet connectivity was a problem. Parking is ridiculous.  Small spaces and typically no available parking. Food was good, staff was friendly. Ambience of hotel is always pretty neat. Tropical plants and waterfalls in the lobby make it enjoyable to sit down for breakfast.

Summary Heading: Great place for $ and family friendly
Summary: Embassy suites has amazing costumer service. Best family oriented place ever. The complimentay breakfast is phenomena and the manager reception is relaxingl!!! We are locals, yet choose to stay here for a mini get away!!!

The elevators moved swiftly. The overall stay was very pleasant! Had to skip the breakfast...way to many people! All in all..."Happy"!!!

I would of course stay at this location again and again!

Summary: The lodgings, atmosphere, and food were delicious.  it was quiet.  An overall enjoyable experience!  Parking was a little more of a search, yet with persistence one was found.  I recommend using their rental cars for convenience.

Summary: Just stayed in this hotel last night.  Very relaxing lobby. Clean room, staff is very helpful and friendly. Had lunch and dinner at the restaurant, nice food , great service. Definitely will stay again.

Summary: Had a wonderful stay!  The hotel was very clean and accomodating.  My only suggestion is make sure you ask for a room that does not face the freeway.  You can hear the traffic all night!  Other than that, great hotel!!

Summary: The hotel has a very relaxing hotel lobby that makes you think you are on vacation even if you are on a business trip.  Rooms are very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  The evening reception was an added value.

Summary: I've stayed at the Embassy Suites Santa Ana Airport North dozens of times in the last two years for work. They simply don't care about customer service. I arrived last night for a reservation at about 1:00am. I found the hotel had blocked off about 40% of their parking spots (empty) for ongoing renovations, and the rest of their spots were full. I went in to the front counter and was told "park wherever you can" and the young lady at the counter laughed. I told her to cancel my reservation and found another place to stay (look for my positive review of the Courtyard by Marriott on MacArthur shortly). The Embassy Suites frequently doesn't have sufficient parking for their guests, and it's worse during their long overdue renovations or when the hotel has banquet bookings in the

Summary: The hotel lobby is very nice, the staff was very nice as well. Upgrades to the hotel might include additional treadmills in the exercise room. Painting of the green roof / ceiling in the main atrium, lobby area, also upgrading the color of the elevators. Get rid of the outdated teal green, maybe black like the handrails?
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Do Not Stay Here!  Book the Embassy Suites Irvine instead
Summary: I am a corporate planner and have stayed at a wide variety of hotels.  This is the first time in my life I have actually walked into a hotel room and checked back out within 5 minutes.  The lobby is nice but once you step foot in the rooms you will find they haven't been updated since the 70s, you will not want to take your shoes off or sit on any of the furniture.  You have NO control over air in the room.  the hotel will turn on the heat when it is a certain temperature outside but only for a few hours because all the rooms get too hot and stuffy.  AC is only turned on when it is a certain temp as well or if there is an event in house.  Staff was nice but I couldn't stomach spending more then the 5 minutes in the stuffy, musty dirty room that makes a Motel 6 rent by the hour
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our two-room suites. We would like to share the news that the hotel has completed a exstensive renovation of both guest suites and common areas and we believe you will find the improvements refreshing. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future

Summary: We just checked out, and we had a great experience. We stayed in one of the newly renovated rooms on the 10th floor, and the room was very nice.   The carpet is all new in the hotel, and I'd recommend to anyone. We're picky on hotels, and this one passed the test.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: If you like a nice lobby, but a crappy room--this is for you!
Summary: I was amazed when I walked into the lobby--absolutely beautiful. Lots of water features, great ponds with Koi and Turtles.  I was very pleasantly surprised--until I got into our room. The rooms are atrocious!  Very dated and yucky. The bathrooms are so small, you can barely turn around. Do not consider the couch pull out as an option for sleeping..they are awful and whomever is designated to sleep there, will not sleep at all.  We were only there 2 nights and we asked to switch rooms for the 2nd night. There is a much nicer, updated Embassy Suites just down the road--stay there instead!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your fedback and your thoughtful comments regarding our staff.‚ÄôGuest comfort and safety are our top priorities and we regret you did not experience this.As you noticed the hotel is currently under going a mjor renoovation that will include lobby, meetings rooms and sleep rooms.  in our continual efforts to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future and experience our new look.  Best regards, Pamelha Hild

Summary Heading: Stay away till remodel is done!
Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites (Santa Ana, CA) for 4 months will working a project in Orange County.  The organization I was working for had signed a coporate rate contract with this property so I was requried to use this property.  Service:  The front desk staff was your typical hotet staff. I can't think of anything positive or negative to say about them. They did use my name alot. I guess because I am a HH Gold member. They did pretend to NOT know of the musty / mildew smell in the rooms.  The housekeeping staff were professional and friendlier than the front desk staff.  The breakfast restaurant staff were very nice. I enjoyed speaking to them every morning. That includes the servers and cook staff.  Rooms: The time I was there the rooms were horrible. I give them a negative
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our suites. Guest comfort and safety are our top priorities and we regret you did not experience this.The hotel is currently under renoovation that will include lobby, meetings rooms and sleep rooms. As we work to complete our renovations we will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Best regards, Pamelsa Hild

Summary Heading: Very Dated for an Embassy Suites
Summary: Let me start off by saying we are HH gold members and most always stay at the Hilton Brand, with the Embassy Suites being our number 1 choice. The hotel is in the process of being renovated, and maybe once its completed it will be better.    We were not offered an upgraded room on checkin (which is normally Hiltons policy for its HHs members), and did ask.  We were told none were available.  We checked into our room, and settled in.  The happy hour had chips, salsa, and cheese, pretzels and potato chips and of couse their managers reception. The area for guests to eat was very pretty, and entertaining with turtles to watch.  The carpeting in our room was worn and dated.  The Internet did not work in the bedroom, and the cushions on the couch were very uncomfortable and sank into
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our two-room suites. As you noticed we were undergoing a renovation during your stay and it is now complete. We believe you will find the changes to our guest suites as well as our newly renovated lobby area and restaurant  a refreshing change. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future

Summary Heading: Stuck in 1970 and I can't get out!
Summary: This hotel was probably built and furnished in the 1970s and hasn't been updated since. The fold out bed in the suite is beyond bad. Our kids were so uncomfortable they couldn't sleep on it and ended up coming into our bed so my husband had to try to sleep on it. The carpet in the room is utterly disgusting. When you walk into the room you are smacked in the face with the stench of mold - it's bizarre actually. We tried to keep our sliding glass door open all night to air it out but since our "balcony" was overlooking the freeway the noise was unbearable. They have the outdoor lights shining up on the building at night to illuminate the singage which just blaze directly into the room all night long. We called housekeeping to have a clean set of sheets and an extra blanket
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with your stay here. As you noticed we are currently undergoing a modernization of our elevators and have begun to renovate our rooms which will include carpeting throughout the hotel as well as an update to our guest rooms bedding and furniture. The condition of our suites is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service. All of the issues withyour stay has been addressed and we are very sorry this led to uncomfortable stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely, Pamela Hild, STAES_DS@hilton.com

Summary: I am a gold member and knew from a previous visit that the rooms here were real bad but had hoped the remodel was far enough along I could get a decent room due to my status. Not to be. Room was hideous. The heat and air conditioning in the rooms is controlled by them, so you swelter in your room. Carpet felt moist. my room was smelly, noisy and so dirty that I actually didn't want to touch a thing until I had gotten Lysol and sprayed it on everything!! Overall waayy overpriced for the condition as I would compare it to staying at a Motel 6!!   I will say the staff is very friendly and courteous and the room service was surprisingly better than my last stay. Would I stay here again?  Absolutely not until I verified that all rooms were remodeled and I could have a much better

The condition of our suites is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service. Summary: This is a typical Embassy Suites property/ layout.  It is an older property and shows its age in some areas.  Our room's pull-out couch needs to be replaced and the elevators seem to be an issue here with either being slow or under repair.  As others have stated, there is a somewhat musty smell too- particularly in our room.  It was OK after we opened the door to the balcony for awhile to air the room out though. The room itself was clean. The breakfast in the morning is very good although it can be a bit of a zoo at times.  The lobby is pretty and the front desk service was fine.  We stayed here for the convenience of access to the John Wayne airport and would stay here again for a similar purpose.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. Summary Heading: Very pretty lobby. Rooms are typical Embassy Suite style. Nice breakfast and shuttle service to area airport and stores.
Summary: We were there for a family wedding and hotel staff were very accommodating and helpful.  The shuttle to the airport and area stores is a real plus. Rooms and breakfast are were typical Embassy Suites, lots of room with the usual amenities. They had quite a few rooms down for maintenance, but there was not noise or odor from this. The staff overall were very helpful. Would definitely stay here again if in the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary: It was shocking how bad the rooms smelled.  Other reasons for my rating of two:  Cheesy fitness center with only two treadmills; two washers (one did not work) for the large hotel; broken chair left in the room; replacement chair was just as bad; due to the smell and mold in the room, my clothes smelled; the elevators were often slow and dirty; the business center printers worked when they wanted to; and the manager's reception was a joke.  While I appreciated the free drinks, nachos, gold fish and pretzels everyday was disheartening.  I will not stay at nor recommend this hotel.

Summary: I stayed here with my fianc√© on March 13 th through 17 th.The room we were put in was terrible the smell disgusting It was damp and the odor got on my chest ( I have a chest infection now) We had to stay in the bedroom with the door wide open to breath and still covered our faces with sheets We asked to be moved but the hotel was full till the next day We didnt sleep all night as the window was open and the street noise very loud Day two they put us in a room that had a leak in the bathroom saturating th bedroom carpet every time we had a shower or bath They gave us a measly voucher for $40 to spend in the restaurant I asked for the first night to be compd thought that was the least they could do but they wouldn't I contacted Hilton but they have not followed up I am now

Summary Heading: Not Worth the Money!! False Advertisment!
Summary: To begin, upon checking into the hotel I was given a king room instead of two queen/full size beds. My confirmation requested two beds, however the hotel was unaware or did not pay attention. When they resolved that problem, I walked into a hotel room that had the worst odor and smell u could imagine. On top of that the rooms were also very cold and the thermostat did not work. When I informed the front desk and they informed me that they don't turn the heat on unless the rooms reach 52 degrees. Are you Serious? They brought me a small heater that worked for the first night only. On the second night it did not work. When I infomed the night staff they said they would bring me another heater and blankets. They never showed up. The patio door was jammed and off track. The living

Summary Heading: Good stay, better wifi would be preferred as well as a gym that's worth mentioning...
Summary: Breakfast was superior to any free breakfast I've enjoyed before. The gym was a joke though, it is not kept up by the staff and it needs a lot of improvement. Wifi isn't convenient. Beds are comfortable, TVs nice. Other than the leak outside my bathroom, it was overall a nice stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: When we checked in they mentioned renovations were going on.  When we entered the room it had a very new smell.  It was obvious the carpet had been replaced quite recently.  The couch and chair also appeared to be new.    We must have been the first guests in the room after the carpet was replaced, because the room was not ready for guests.  There were no TV remote in the room.  The TV in the living room would not turn on and the desk was extremely rickety. All the above were reported on separate occasions, as they were discovered and quickly addressed.   Additionally the phone had the wrong room number on it.  The drawers on the dresser in the bedroom would not stay closed, and kept sliding open about 6 inches.  One of the plastic rings that hold the shower curtain was missing.
Manager Response: Dear David,  Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel, and we appreciate the kind words regarding our staff. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you experienced some difficulties during your stay. Guest comfort and safety are our top priorities and we regret you did not experience this. The hotel is currently renovationg all of our guest rooms and the hotel will have a fresh new look by mid summer.. We certainly will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Best regards, Pamela Hild Director of Sales and Marketing

Summary Heading: Considering this is a Hilton brand hotel, I expected more.
Summary: This is the worst hotel in this category I ever stayed.   The elevators does not work (3 of 5 out of service) and the remaining two are too slow. 10 minutes waiting.   The rooms are dark and does not smell good. The housekeeping always forget something: towels, soap, coffee, ...   No free internet. You pay US$6.70 per 24 hours. La Quinta hotels (next door) is cheaper and offers internet free of charge.  Summary: You can get the same service in cheaper hotels around. This hotel couldn't be part of Hilton Family.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our your stay here. The condition of our suites is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service. Regarding our Internet pricing, the hotel does offer a room rate that is inclusive of internet and we would be happy to assist you in booking this in the future. We are very sorry you had a uncomfortable stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future and experience our new look and elevators.  Sincerely, Pamela Hild, Director of Sales

Summary: After reading the reviews, I was skeptical.  However, this property is beautiful outside and inside. The atrium is very nice and relaxing.  The room was large, clean and very accommodating.  The manager's reception was very nice.  I don't expect a full meal at these, and the snacks were appreciated.  The breakfast was great!  The front desk staff were very accommodating in helping us find a good seafood restaurant for dinner.  Our room was a very comfortable temperature, and I have nothing but good things to say about this property!
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel! It is great to hear you had a nice stay with us! We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!    Sincerely,  Pamela Hild, Director of Sales

Summary: When I checked in I had to use my credit card instead of the corporate card that was used to hold the reservations.  My corporate office had to jump through hoops to get them to accept the card after I had checked in. I was cold every night and used the extra bedding for my bed, because of the heating/air conservation.  One set of elevators was down and there was construction being done on the 10th floor so only 2 elevators were in working order.  When I arrived there was only sugar in the room, no creamer, and the sugar looked old. The person who checked me in did not even seem to care about my distress with using my own personal credit card.  Thus I have asked my corporate office not to book me here, instead I will book myself into a Marriott Hotel close by.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our suites. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Best regards, Pamela Hild, Director of Sales

Summary Heading: This is the second time I stayed here, and requested it.  They are always excellent.
Summary: I chair committees that work in the Tustin/Santa Ana/ Garden Grove/ Orange County area.  The hotel is convenient to all areas, and always clean, welcoming, and provides the privacy needed to complete the business assignments.  We always eat in the restaurant, and the food is exceptional. The breakfast, and manager's reception are terrific, as they assist in beginning and ending a long day of work.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Guest,   It is great to hear you had a good stay with us and that you enjoy our breakfast, evening managers reception and Sweet Spot Bar and Grill. Thank you for taking the time to review our hotel!  We hope you will come back to visit us again soon!    Sincerely,  Pamela Hild, Director of Sales

Summary Heading: For now, Stay Elsewhere!  Rooms Need Work!
Summary: I stayed at this hotel week for Feb 11th.. Hotel looks very nice from outside.. Staff was nice.. Check in process was fast & easy.. --> Atrium area is nice, but similar to any other Embassy suites.    The rooms are a different story.  I stayed in the 8th floor... Being a loyal HH member, this hotel really needs a lot of work in the rooms.. I would NOT recommend a stay here..   You may want stay elsewhere for a Hilton Hotel or the other Embassy Suites near John Wayne Airport.  My Observations & Opinions on my recent stay: --> Room carpets are disgusting & the rooms odor is NOT pleasant. --> Bathroom is very small. Bath room door is NOT even a full size door.  Bathroom ceiling is so low; placement of toilet & you get a very claustrophobic feel.  You have NO space to move in the

We hope you will consider staying with us in the future and experience our new look.  Sincerely, Pamela Hild, Director of Sales

Summary Heading: Good value with a couple of exceptions.
Summary: Overall a very nice stay for the money. Unreasonable internet charges are hard to understand however..elevator service was close to unbearable..many minutes wasted waiting for an elevator! Great breakfast every day but nightly reception needs something better to munch on.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is one of the older Embassy Suites locations, which means it's a richly detailed, beautiful place, but if you look closely it's getting pretty worn around the edges.  This is my 3rd stay here in about 5 years, it works great for me the frequent business traveler.  Location is convenient for Irvine/OC, they have a shuttle to the airport (SNA), and the cooked breakfast and "manager's reception" is most welcome.  It's among the better values you're going to find in Irvine-Santa Ana-Newport Beach-Costa Meas as this is an expensive area.  OC seems to be thick with flagship hotels but those hotels nickel and dime you for everything.  Not so the reliable Embassy Suites.  Since it's older, the lobby and atrium are thick with plants, balconies, koi ponds, and other nice touches. (I
Manager Response: none

Summary: I always stay try to stay at Embassy Suites when traveling for business.  I must say, that this property is in the poorest condition I have seen stateside for a Hilton brand hotel.  Rooms were musty and smelled bad.  Carpet in rooms and public areas are stained and bleached.  Bathroom faucet leaked and then stopped working.  I gave 2 stars instead of 1 because the staff is very friendly and ready to help.  It is not their fault the property is in need of help.
Manager Response: Dear Valued Customer, Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and your kind words regarding our staff. The hotel is undergoing a renovation of our guest suites, carpeting and elevators and we hope you will try us again and experience our new look. The condition of our suites is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service.  The issue with the faucet in your room has been forwarded addressed we are very sorry this led to uncomfortable stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future  Sincerely, Pamela Hild, Director of Sales

Summary: I am a Hilton Honors member and stay almost exclusively at these properties and although the tragic event involving a young lady committing suicide was in no way the fault of management the elavator system, air conditioning/heating system not working was a travesty. The room smell was horrible and the only way to make this somewhat better was to open the sliding glass doors and let the smog in. I also could not locate any carts upon check in and was there for a trade show with dozens of heavy boxes to unload. Two hours later I was in my room but with zero help from anyone at the front desk. Upon check out all five elevators were not working and it took me hours to get loaded as I was on the eight floor of this Hotel. Management had promised to supply me some help but after an
Manager Response: ‚ÄúThank you for your loyalty to the Hilton Honors program, Embassy Suites and your patronage during the recent Trade Show at our hotel. As a frequent traveler, we certainly appreciate your understanding that the property staff was just as affected and shocked as the guests were when this tragic event occurred in the atrium of the hotel. Quick action by the management and on-duty late evening staff redirected guests away from the scene as soon as possible and assisted with luggage while police and authorities managed the situation, which was otherwise outside of our control at the time. Hotel management was in close contact with the local authorities in securing the scene and trying to mitigate guest exposure and inconvenience which is difficult with an open atrium design ‚Äì while at the same time doing our utmost to respect the deceased and wishes of the investigators at the scene.‚Äù    Regarding your difficulties with access to the elevators, bell carts and bellmen during the heavy Trade Show checkout, we apologize for the wait you experienced. It is certainly our wish that even with 300 rooms of Trade Show attendees, all with numerous boxes and trade show displays exiting around the same time that we would have the staff and resources available to assist every guest in a timely manner.   We normally have 5 elevators that service the property‚Äôs needs but two of these were out of service as part of a modernization upgrade and are scheduled to be back in service, working better than ever, by mid February. As you may have noticed during your stay, the elevator upgrade is a part of the hotel‚Äôs multi-million dollar interior and exterior renovation which is taking place and will include new carpet in all of the guestrooms, corridors and meeting rooms as well as many other improvements like the already renovated lobby, restaurant, sports bar and parking lot. If you would like to discuss your stay further, please do not hesitate to contact our General Manager directly. Thank you‚Äù

Summary: Nice hotel. I've always loved the indoor beauty of Embassy Suites. Cute turtles. Great breakfast for it being complimentary. The omelet making was brilliant and prompt. I would have gone to the gym and the pool but I did not have time. Oh the restaurant was good too. I had the pulled pork sandwich.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed at many Embassy Suites in the past and was extremely dissapointed in my stay this past weekend.  Although the hotel is beautiful and the rooms are nice as far as layout, this experience was far from normal.  There was a dead body in the atrium area from someone who fell/jumped, people were checking in with small children and were not warned. I am so glad I didn't have my children with me! It was traumatizing!  I understand terrible things happen, but the fact that the hotel did not offer any type of compensation for those who witnessed this tragic event is beyond me.  To top it off the great breakfast was set up right where the body was all night. I could not fathom eating at all.  The rooms and elevators smelled like urine and mold, the ac did not work (is
Manager Response: Nicole, Please accept our sincere apologies for your recent experience at our property. We are sorry to hear you were not comfortable in your room and in light of the tragedy in our atrium we understand your discomfort. We were all taken aback by this incident and assure you we did our best to handle the situation in conjunction with the appropriate authorities. If we may be of any additional assistance, or if you would like to discuss your stay further, please do not hesitate to contact our General Manager directly. Thank you

Summary Heading: Convenient to the Airport and a Great Breakfast
Summary: Close proximity to John Wayne Airport (SNA) and the great breakfast and evening Manager's reception make this hotel a decent choice.  With a layout similar to other Embassy Suites (floors of rooms surrounding a central courtyard with plants and a flowing koi pond stream), the familiar is a good thing.  I have stayed here many times both on business and with my family and while I like the hotel, it is REALLY "long in the tooth" and desperately needs an upgrade.  The elevators are extremely slow (they were being upgraded in December 2012 however) and the carpets and furnishings are beginning to show wear.    The spa motor was broken and out of service for a week and kids without adult supervision were running amuck in the pool area and running around on the floors during our stay.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband just got back from a week staying there. He was there for a business conference and did not have a choice in the hotel.  When he got home, I immediately was disgusted by the smell. Everything he took with him smelled so bad, like it was moldy. His coat, the luggage, his backpack, clothes......everything needs to be taken to the laundry or dry cleaners! Think twice about staying here. One bright spot was the morning breakfast station and the man making the omelets!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: We loved staying here. We loved the wonderful breakfast every morning and the room was great. The only bad thing was that they had a water problem in our room and the carpet was moist from water damage so it kind of smelled musty. If the room didn't have water damage, it would have been perfect. The elevators seemed to break down quite a bit but we didn't mind taking the stairs to get down a little faster. For the most part, it was great and the location was good also. We also used the exercise facilities and enjoyed that feature also.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This room is NOT becoming of an Embassy Suites hotel. I would love to see the Hilton family spend a night here.  Our bathroom door has a severe case of either wood rot or mold! The room smells funny (thanks to the mold??) and you cannot control the temperature in your room. The elevators are being repaired, but I wonder if the rooms will be given the same treatment.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with your stay here. As you noticed we are currently undergoing a modernization of our elevators and will begin to renovate our rooms shortly this will include carpeting throughout the hotel as well as an update to our guest rooms bedding and furniture. The condition of our suites is very important to us as we aim to provide guests with the best accommodations and service. The issue with the smell of your room has been addressed and we are very sorry this led to uncomfortable stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future.  Sincerely, Pamela Hild, STAES_DS@hilton.com

Summary: Breakfast is definitely the best thing about this place. Many choices, much better than the average free hotel breakfast, and eaten in the atrium with foliage, a small waterfall, and koi and turtles swimming around. Very pleasant. Room smelled a little funny and was too hot (they had the heat on because it was cold outside and you couldn't do much to control the temp in the room), but the bed was very comfortable and it was clean and had a small fridge and microwave.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Have used this property awhile back, it's getting dated now.  And the biggest thing is that they do not allow you to use either heat or a/c if the outside temp is between 55 and 70.  So, that tells me that they have an antiquated heating/air conditioning system.  So it's winter and it's not the east but it's COLD outside and the room is probably 60 at the most. The lobby is warmer than this!  They offered a space heater, and almost an hour later I am still waiting for it.  I went out and scrounged one sitting in the hallway.  I won't be staying here again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We were extremely disappointed with our stay. On our first night, our neighbors decided to have a major party at 1am. I had to call the front desk 3 times to finally have action taken. We asked for some kind of reimbursement from the front desk and all they could give us was an apology. Thanks to them, I walked around like a zombie at Knott's Berry Farm all day!  There is not any central heat in the rooms. It was extremely cold outside for Orange County. When I called the front desk, they said the hotel was in a neutral zone so they were not piping heat in the rooms. They did provide us with a small heater that would only heat 1 room at a time.  The icing on the cake was when we were at breakfast on our last day. I asked one of the workers for tobasco sauce. He had attitude and
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. We sincerely appreciate your feedback and we‚Äôre very sorry you were unhappy with our two-room suites. As you noticed we were undergoing a renovation during your stay and it is now complete. We believe you will find the changes to our guest suites as well as our newly renovated lobby area and restaurant  a refreshing change. We will take your comments under consideration as we continually work to improve our guest experience. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future

Summary Heading: The room smelled terrible and was cold.
Summary: There was no manual heat control in rooms. When I complained they brought me a space heater, which I had to move around the rooms depending on where we were sitting.   There was Inadequate lighting in the rooms as well.  There was a moldy smell and when I spoke with others we were traveling with, they had had the same experience. The carpets were stained too.  Some left and went to another hotel.  The main /shared ares of the hotel were fine.  A nice fish pond with water fountain.  I would not stay in this hotel again.  I never give bad reviews this is a first...

Summary: We just got back from a three day stay.  The first room that we checked into was facing the highway.  The noise was so loud that we thought a window was open.  The windows are old and do a very poor job of insulating from noise.  We immediately asked to be moved to another room. The hotel is very much in need of a complete renovation.  The second room smelled like bleach.  We initially thought that there must be bleach in one of the toilets, sinks or tub.  We ran the water in each for a good ten minutes but still smelled bleach.  We then opended the sliding glass window and propped open the door to the room to create a cross draft to air the place out.  Seemed to help but the room got very cold because it was chilly outside.  When we closed everything up we went to turn the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. Summary: We stayed at the Embassy Suites Santa Ana for our Disneyland trip during Christmas 2012, we also stayed here back Dec 2011.  This is one of my favorite Embassy suites of all time.  The Rooms are really nice and clean.  The beds and pillows are really comfortable.   The front desk staff and the Sweet Spot restaurant staff were absolutely tremendous!   I would like to point out that Ricardo, the catering/restaurant manager was extremely professional and he provided exemplary service.  Also I would like to point out Ian, at the front desk, who also provided the best service to my family and I.  We did show up a little early and our rooms were supposed to be ready and they were not just yet and he and the entire staff went out of their way to make sure our room was ready and that we
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Perfect for one night before flying out of Orange County
Summary: We stayed here on the final night of a week long So-Cal trip with our kids and my in-laws. We needed to be close to the airport for an early flight, and they fit the bill.   We had two adjacent rooms, which provided bedrooms for the adults with sofa beds in the living rooms for the kids. Perfect arrangement. The first pair of rooms they gave us we on the top floor but they had a terrible smell of cigarette smoke in them, in spite of being on a nonsmoking floor. I called the front desk and they promptly relocated us. The new rooms were perfect--clean, very comfy beds, lots of space for the kids to spread out toys and play, etc. There's a large mall down the road that we went to an found many dinner options and some final shopping. The next morning we had a good breakfast in the
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family spent several days in 3 different rooms here at the end of Dec 2012. All 3 sets of guests reported the same problems: damp and musty smelling rooms. Water condensing on the walls. TINY bathrooms. The HVAC system there is ancient. It ONLY heats OR cools the WHOLE hotel, and then only when it is VERY warm or VERY cold according to their signs on the walls. They offer "space heaters" if you're cold. Think Walmart $10 fan with a heat element in it. Count on stagnant air unless you leave a window open. When you enter the lobby you are knocked over with a perfume smell. By the time you get to your room it is quite different. Yes, they are renovating. That's nice. Half the elevators aren't working. There used to be a nice restaurant there, now it's just a bar with a lot of
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to write a review about your recent stay at our hotel. The renovation does include the modernization of our elevators as well as carpeting throughout. The issue with the smell of your room has been addressed and we are very sorry this led to uncomfortable stay at our hotel. We hope you will consider staying with us in the future. Summary: We were part of a group that stayed at the Embassy Suites as it was proximate to our local office in OC.  No one in our 10-person team was impressed, and everyone had complaints.  I was unable to get any heat to my room at all, so it felt like an icebox on a cool December night.  It was actually warmer to turn the heating/cooling off, as all it seemed to blow was cool air!!  The hotel has the smell of high-strength industrial cleanser throughout, which didn't help either. On the positive side, the Staff was helpful, and the made-to-order breakfast was good as usual, but these could not overcome the fact that this was not a good experience, and the next time I'm in OC, I will stay at the CY Marriot on MacArthur Place.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here one night in Dec. 2012.  We have probably stayed at 12-15 different Embassy Suites and generally like them.  This property was our least favorite.  It was tired, and the room smelled musty.  The layout was the typical Embassy Suites, but this bathroom seemed small..  I have always enjoyed the managers evening cocktail hours and buffet breakfasts the next a.m., at Embassy Suites, but I felt this was a little substandard.  While the atrium and lobby was nice, it was dark.  I could hardly read the newspaper the next a.m. because of lack of light.  The servers were all very pleasant, but just did not feel the quality of the breakfast measured up.     At 4:45 a.m. the fire alarm in the hotel went off.  They shut it off quickly, but I was not able to go back to sleep.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This Hotel has problems with heating and Air.  They will tell you that if the temp is below 55 then they will run the heat and if it is above 70 they will run the air.  If the temp is between those 2 they will try there best to regulate the temp.  Do not believe them.  I stayed for 2 nights and did not sleep since it was so hot.  They gave me a box fan to use the second night after I complained which did not work.  They have space heaters available but not portable air condtioning units.  Also the 2nd morning I did not have any hot water, even after running the water for 15 minutes.  Also the first room they gave me had mold in the bathroom and when you walked in you could smell it.  They blamed it on the fact they had just cleaned the carpets.  The second room still had a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: No Heat or No Air Conditioning, which one can you do without!
Summary: Not only doesn this hotel not give you the option of heating or air conditioning but the elevator only works about half the time and when it does work it is extremely slow.    The hotel will choose heat or air conditioning for you!    Elevators marked as out of service on other floors are not marked as out of service in the lobby. Imagine getting on an elevator in the lobby only to find out you have ridden an elevator that is out of service, presumably a death trap! Makes you feel all warm and fuzzy doesn't it!  While the restuarant staff is great and the managers reception staff are also exceptional the rest of the hotel is far below the standard I expect from Hilton and Embassy Suites.  Very Disappointed!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with Embassy Suites Santa Ana and giving your feedback during your recent stay. Any feedback we receive helps to make us better. I apoligize for any Inconvenience you experienced during your stay. As you saw during your stay we are currently renovating our lobby area and will begin work to to modernize our elevators in the next week. We will also be renovating our rooms in early 2013. I hope you have a chance to come back and give us another chance to experience our new look!

Summary Heading: Who likes having to change rooms because of hotel screw-ups?
Summary: We noticed the air conditioning ceiling vent near the bathroom was dripping water on the carpet. We notified the front desk and they sent an employee who emptied a water collection pan.  Later that day, the dripping/leaking resumed.  We changed rooms, which was an inconvenience to us and the second room has strange smells but I am willing to put up with this.  There are other annoying things such as the toilet paper not being replaced and the fact that this is one of the very few hotels left on the planet without free internet - you have to pay by the day.  The worst thing about this is that on my last trip to LA, I stayed at a cheaper place two blocks away with the similar amenities but a smaller room. Internet was free and the breakfast was just as good.  When I pay more, I
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Ok Hotel but a bit far from food and amenities
Summary: This hotel is located right off the freeway which makes it a good choice but it is a drive to get to any tourist attractions. No food around but a 10 min drive down Barranca Pkwy gets you to a location with ample choice of restaurants. This hotel does make a great choice for larger families or extended families travelling together. See prasadandassociates.com to find out how this hotel works great for families. Also, those serving Embassy Suite's trademark breakfast do a wonderful job at this hotel and all staff encountered were excellent to deal with. Hotel will need a makeover in 5 years or so.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Hotel but musty, bad smelling room
Summary: I would give this a very high rating in every category if it weren't for the fact that this hotel has a water problem. The carpet was damp and the room had a musty strong Oder to it. I had read other reviews that indicated the same thing and thought it must be a small section of the hotel. Either I was incredibly unlucky to get the same spot or this is a wide spread problem in the hotel. We were in room 738.  The hotel is located right off of highway 55 which was very convenient.  The rooms were big and the breakfast was very good. Crowded at breakfast, but very hearty. The hotel restaurant was under renovation at the time.   We booked with hotels.com for a good rate, however the reservation said "free Internet."  It was not. It was $6.50 per night. This is a hotels.com problem,
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with Embassy Suites Santa Ana and giving your feedback during your recent stay. Any feedback we receive helps to make us better. Summary Heading: Needs to have a good makeover
Summary: Stayed for three nights while my wife and I enjoyed a quick vacation in the area. First thing I noted was that the room had a musty smell. The decor has not been updated in awhile and looking at the baseboards/perimeter of the room showed signs of aging {chips in bathroom baseboard at door}. Reported the musty smell to the front desk and each day the smell was still there. As for the rest of the hotel, bar food was not bad and the breakfast was typical Embasy Suites fare. They need to enforce the no kids in the pool area after 10pm. Parking is also something that is needed because the parking lot is shared with another hotel. However, the one thing that has caused me to return on more than one occassion is that the hotel is about 10 minutes from DisneyLand.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for your feedback and please accept my sincere apologies that your experience was less than a perfect 10. Any feedback we receive helps to make us better.   I wanted to share the news that we are currently renovating our lobby area and in 2013 we will begin renovating our sleep rooms. I hope you have a chance to come back and give us another chance to experience our new look!   Do not hesitate to contact me directly at STAES_DS@HILTON.COM  in the future so I can ensure you a more comfortable stay.   Warm regards,  Pamela Hild Director of Sales and Marketing

Summary: Hotel  staff very friendly and  happy to help you find your way to attractions.   Dinner at the restaurant in hotel very good. Court yard area very beutifull streams and trees with turtles and fish, Very relaxing after a long day. Breakfast cook to order so nice and part of your stay. Manager hosted drinks the nite before, met some very nice folks we would have other wise passed with out conversation. Suite Rooms very comfortable and quiet. Price was very reasonable for all the accomadations. Morning at gym nice.  If i could live here i would.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: You have to like certain things about Embassy Suites
Summary: I guess the first is the double rooms, but I like the manager's receptions.  Something about a free beer (or two) that gets to me.  Next is the omelets to order.  You have to take about $20 off the cost of room considering these two perks.  On negative side, they continue to charge for Internet - nobody does everything for nothing.  Staff here very professional.  Big atrium.  Down the road <2 miles are about 100 restaurants.  And you hop on freeway in 2 minutes from parking lot.  One negative - only 3 treadmills (plus three elipticals).
Manager Response: none

Summary: Our house was being tented by exterminators, wanted a hotel for 3 adults with suite setup.  Hotel needs makeover, working elevators, working ice makers and a good cleaning.  Always heard high praise for Embassy Suites, but should have checked Trip Advisor before booking.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with Embassy Suites Santa Ana and giving your feedback during your recent stay. Any feedback we receive helps to make us better. I wanted to share the news that our Makeover has begun! the hotel is currently renovating our lobby area and will begin work to to modernize our elevators in the next week. I hope you have a chance to come back and give us another chance to experience our new look!

Summary: As others have stated, this hotel is in dire need of refurbishing. Out of 6 elevators, only 2 worked the 4 nights we stayed there. Our original room on the 9th floor had a long list of things that needed fixing. The sliding glass door was not sealed and the freeway noise was extremely loud. We moved to the 10th floor which was better. The wallpaper was torn and the bathroom had dirt and mold in corners. There were 2 very positive items:  the staff was very helpful and the bed was very comfortable. Probably won't stay here again
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with Embassy Suites Santa Ana and giving your feedback during your recent stay. Any feedback we receive helps to make us better. I wanted to share the news that we are currently renovating our lobby area and our elevators. We will begin renovating our sleep rooms in early 2013. I hope you have a chance to come back and give us another chance to experience our new look!

Summary: This hotel could use some drastic updates NOW.  When I first arrived the service was nice - got into the elevator and it got stuck.  Once I got into the room it was very noisy to the outside.  Upon looking at the slider - it would not close properly - had to push it and force a towel to keep it closed allowing me to sleep.  Shower curtains were torn.  Carpet was very worn like on previous reviews I would wear shoes or socks on the carpet at all times.  But the worse thing is I reported these to the front desk.  The next day I received a call from management regarding my stay - called back and sent an email.  No follow up.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with Embassy Suites Santa Ana and giving your feedback during your recent stay. Any feedback we receive helps to make us better. I wanted to share the news that we are currently renovating our lobby area and will begin work to to modernize our elevators in the next week. I hope you have a chance to come back and give us another chance to experience our new look!

Summary: This would be a nice Hotel if it were updated, however...Upon walking into the hotel you're overcome with very cold, damp air and a musty smell. They moved us to another room because the telephones didn't work in the first one.  The carpet in the room felt thick and sticky under my feet so I had to wear my shoes  and the room also had that damp, musty smell to it.  The hotel is right next to the freeway and the seal around the sliding door was very poor because the traffic noise came through as if we had an open window.  Another guest in a nearby room said his was the same.  During our week long stay, two of the elevators broke, nobody ever came to fix them and for the last 5 days of our trip we had to endure a long wait and a crammed elevator. The bathroom was really small and
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I'm Sure You Can Do Better in the Area
Summary: What a busy hotel, spent 10 nights here on business and the place never slowed down.  They have a beautiful atrium but throw everyone out at 10 PM; I was with a group of over 20 people and this left virtually nowhere for us to gather for the evening.  The evening reception had the worst drinks I‚Äôve ever had at an Embassy, and the morning coffee wasn‚Äôt much better.    A lot of the guests were families with small children doing the theme park visits which probably explains why it‚Äôs so busy.  We did eat at the hotel restaurant a few times and the food was excellent, much better than you would expect for a hotel restaurant/bar.  Parking was very difficult, if you got back to the hotel too late it was nearly impossible to find an empty parking space.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Very good location close to airport and shopping malls.  Some rooms I get are great and others are ok.  It is generally faily quiet and the rooms seem clean.  They have an excellent breakfast included with your stay!  The evening reception has drinks, wine and beer; but the bartender seems to frown on your if you come up for your second beer.  The rooms sometimes feel cold and it is hard to warm up.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Old hotel with charming atmosphere. Nice cooked to order breakfast. Social hour has free drinks (bottom shelf liqueur). Rooms are old with dingy old furniture from early 80's. My first room I couldn't stand the old mildew odor. Had to switch rooms & my second room had broken toilet. I couldn't wait to escape this place. Make this hotel your very bottom choice
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great Breakfast, Older Rooms, Comfortable Stay
Summary: They have a full hot breakfast with made to order omelets.  The staff was inviting and helpful on all requests I had.  The hotel does have a small area to purchase snacks and beverages.  Unfortunately if you are looking for restaurants in the area they are quite sparse.  If do have a car, a trip to Newport Beach is definitely something to take advantage.  I did attend an Angels game and it only took me about 15-20 minutes on city streets to get to my destination.  I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the area for business.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This was once a nice hotel, but that was long long ago.  While the common areas look very inviting and nice to have a drink or conversation in, and indoor pool is very pretty, the rooms themselves show the age of the building.  The smell of age and musty nights has laid into the hotel.  The beds are well kept and clean, the carpet needs replacing and the furniture needed to go long ago.  When I flew into John Wayne, I noticed this building from the air and wondered what it was.  It was an very inviting building, with an extremely average interior.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Slowest elevators I have EVER experienced
Summary: While I would agree this property is showing it's age (smell referenced in Scheerzee's review - not overly offensive but...) I have to give it kudos for a working remote control, hot water which was relatively prompt in making up to the 10th floor and a good breakfast.  It's not quite up to my usual expectations for a Embassy but the service was excellent and the location good...  What drove me NUTS during a 1 night stay was the elevators...not sure that they can do anything about it but where I come from we'd say they were slow as molassess....not sure I'd put this property on my repeat list but - in a pinch - I would stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: This is my second time staying here and it will certainly be the last.  It has not changed at all after calling prior and asking if it's been renovated.   It needs TI be demolished.  I have moved 2 different times to rooms that both smelled like mold.   When front desk staff not cleaning service came to my room. They even said the smell is from dampness in the carpets (mold) and have had consistent comments or complaints.  I can feel it when I breathe  You here every noise from sliding patio doors to your next door neighbors.  I called 3x after being woken up at different times of the night, this is actually written at 1am. Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Nice Embassy with many dirty balconies and TV with a guide channel
Summary: I stayed here for one night to catch an early flight home the next morning.  This Embassy is nice and meets the standards one expects from the chain.  The front desk personnel were friendly and every staff member I passed greeted me, asked how my stay was going, or at least smiled.  The rooms are good sized, though smaller than most Embassy‚Äôs, with comfortable furniture and bed.  The bathroom is ok sized, but a bit small.  The tub was clean, but kind of dingy looking.  There was absolutely no toilet paper, but when I called housekeeping they brought some very quickly.  The LCD TVs are average size and feature many channels and a TV guide which is rare and always a great plus.  There are many different sized and shaped balconies in a southwestern adobe/stucco terraced design with
Manager Response: none

Summary: First of all the good- the free breakfast was delicious, great omelet. The bad- no parking, dirty rooms. As stated in other reviews, if you don't arrive early, be prepared to fight for a parking space. I was impressed though that a maintenance man gave up his parking spot for us. As for the room, upon entering there was this musty smell, sort of like they had just washed the carpet/furniture but that was not the case as our socks were dirty from walking around the room. Our room lacked remote controls and a working phone. When I pulled out a chair to sit down, I found cookie crumbs....and they weren't mine or my childrens! The bed was comfortable though but not the sofabed, then again they never are. One last thing, the a/c is programed by the hotel so you don't have control
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Very Busy Hotel. no privacy or  free wifi!!
Summary: First time staying at an Embassy Suite! Rooms here are very roomy but needs a little updating. our room in 805 was VERY HOT. the sleeping area never cooled down, i called for a fan and never received one. the hinges on  door that separated the bedroom and sitting area were off! called to have someone fix it and no one showed up! bathroom door did not shut either, the beds and pillows were comfy but not the sofa bed!!! room was very humid! this hotel is very busy, i felt like i was in VEGAS. The pool was very cold for being indoor! breakfast and happy hour are ok! front desk was friendly. 5 min drive to the DISTRICT which offers entertainment. I  probably would not choose an Embassy Suite again because they do not offer FREE WIFI.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Never use this hotel for a special event that can't be done over.
Summary: We had my daughter's wedding reception at this location.  They served the wrong appetizers during the cocktail hour.  We paid extra for these appetizers were to be served by waiters on trays.  They were served buffet style instead.  Champagne was paid for to be served to every guest over the age of 21 for the toast.  It was not.  The cake was three flavors and was to be served by waiters on trays asking each guest what flavor they wanted.  Each guest was given whatever flavor the waiter chose to give them instead.  When we reported all of these errors on the part of the Embassy Suites staff, we were shuffled from one person to another, each time being told it wasn't up to them, but that we would have to speak with the next person up the chain.  Eventually we were told we would
Manager Response: none

Summary: One of the best hotel experiences ever!. The room was big and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and genuine. No charge for parking and the business center makes this place a diamond in the rough. The only thing that I did not like is there was no outdoor pool. An indoor pool is good in the northwest or northeast where it is cold. The breakfast buffet and the managers reception plays for the price of the room by itself. Only 20 minutes to the beach!!
Manager Response: none

Summary: I have stayed here on several occasions and the friendlyness and service from the hotel staff is wonderful.  They make you feel like family/freinds not just guest.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  I'm glad to read you feel like a part of our family and we will continue in our efforts to make our property "your home away from home".  Hope to see you again in the very near future.

Summary Heading: Gorgeous Rainforest Atrium; Hotel in Need of TLC
Summary: With appropriate restoration, this hotel would be *outstanding*.  The cumulative problems of age & use become irritating after a day:  ‚Ä¢ Spacious living room/ kitchenette (mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, sink) & bedroom, but tiny bathroom.¬†  ‚Ä¢ 1 washer ($1) & 1 dryer ($1) for *entire* hotel -- 300 rooms. (Washer coin mechanism jammed full of coins, called maintenance to empty coins & had to wait to use machine. Impractical for longer stays if you have to keep checking for machines to be freed up.)  ‚Ä¢ Lovely glass elevators (to view lush atrium plants & spot turtles & koi) were extremely slow or just didn't work at all.  ‚Ä¢ Free breakfast, but excessively long breakfast line for made-to-order omelets. (No matter how speedily cooks worked, they simply couldn't keep up with
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your comments concerning your recent stay with us.  I apologize if we did not meet your expectations in some areas.  It's important to know our guests' perscpective so we can continue to provide consistent quality with both product and services.  Improvement plans for our property are being developed and will soon be implemented.  I thank you for your recent stay with us and hope we have the opportunity to once again welcome you back to our hotel.

Summary Heading: Easy on the wallet, average hotel
Summary: Family decided to stay here because it was central point for different sites/events (Disneyland, meeting friends in San Diego and LA, etc).  Overall, while the hotel met general standards, for a vacation traveler who can afford a bit more, I would recommend a different hotel.  Good points: -Location was convenient in a general sense: 5 mins from SNA airport, ~45 mins from LAX airport, reasonable driving distance to Disney, San Diego and Los Angeles, 10 mins from great shopping at South Coast Mall, close to some great restaurants in Little Saigon/Garden Grove/Brookhurst -Free parking: nice perk because driving is required  -Rooms include butler bar (small sink) with mini fridge -Free buffet breakfast (with omelet station) and manager's reception (cocktails and light snacks).

I shared your comments with the appropriate department heads so corrective action can be taken.  Improvements are being planned for the very near futue so I hope we have an opportunity to once again welcome you back to our property.

Summary Heading: Hotel is OK - Could use an upgrade
Summary: Hotel is OK.  Rooms are very spacious - beds are comfortable - location is great-appreciate coffee maker and breakfast was delicious.  On the negative - Try to check in about 4:30 PM and was told room not available until 1/2 hour more.  Hotel seems run down.  Elevators are beyond slow and bedding looks old.  For the price - I would have prefered to stay some where else.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your concerns about your recent stay with us.  I am sorry to read that we failed to meet your expectations.  We constantly strive to provide consistent quality with both product and service and it's vital to our success to know when we have fallen short of our guests' expectations.  We are currently working on some noticeable improvements and hope you will consider returning to our property in the future.  Again, I thank you for posting your concerns and please accept our apology for falling short of your expectations during your recent stay with us.

Summary Heading: Except for the elevators, this place is a good place to stay
Summary: Check in was easy. Was able to get in our room upon arrival at 1pm. Elevators were super slow, but that was the only downfall. Rooms were spacious- enough for 3 adults and 3 kids. Fridge and microwave were nice. The kids enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Hotel location wa perfect for where we had to go- LA, West Covina, Rosemead were all short drives away. Would stay again.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  Please accept my apology since we were unable to meet your expectations concerning certain aspects of your stay with us.  We constantly strive to provide consistent quality in both product and service.  We continue in our efforts to make improvements to our property to ensure your future stay with us is comfortable and pleasant.  We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel in the near future.

Summary: I like the location however the room needs updating.  The sofabed in the first room is definitely old and needs to be replaced it is not comfortable at all.  The furniture is a little dated.  The bedroom had a nice king size bed and my parents said that was comfortable.  They did not have a built in closet and very little space to hang up clothes. The lighting of the room was not very good kind of dark.  Also the bath tub fixtures did not turn off very easy we had to call maintenance to turn off the water in the tub.  I also asked for extra towels and they did not bring them.  I have stayed at this hotel before and they just don't seem like they have updated it too much.  I would like to say that the breakfast is great and I really enjoyed the made to order omelets.  I also

Summary: My wife stayed here for our wedding night, the room we got was pretty big and spacious enough space to fit 4-6 people is needed.  The staff: when we checked in I was very disappointed the person at the front desk didn't even crack a smile and seemed bother at the fact that we were trying to check in that late at night (12:45 am) even tho we had a reservation. this was very disappointing, I mean my wife was still wearing her wedding dress!  on the other hand the breakfast buffet staff was super friendly and helpful so kuddos to them.  The Room: it was super big, I mean we didnt even use half of it but the furniture was pretty old and the paint and color scheme too, bathroom was ok but not great.  The breakfast buffet: was awesome! lots of variety and everything tasted pretty

Summary: It was late, we were still soaked from our trip to Sea World San Diego, and we didn't want to stay "just anywhere". My husband pulled into Embassy Suites Santa Ana and went in to see if there were vacancies while I browsed reviews. I read some horrifying reviews and before I could call to tell him to forget it, he came out with room keys in hand.   Some of the reviewers complaints were on target. There was no individual climate control in the rooms, and our room was a bit cold, especially with our wet clothes on. The internet was not free, as is common in most hotels these days. We only stayed the one night though, so we dealt with it. The bed was extremely comfortable and we slept like babies. Hot water was plentiful, the pool,hot tub, and fitness room were great, and the
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent stay with us.  Please accept my apology if we did not meet all of your expectations.  We do strive to provide consistent quality in both product and service.  I am pleased to know that you enjoyed your stay with us and look forward to welcoming you back to our property in the near future.

Summary Heading: Old old old, nice staff but not a good Embassy
Summary: Old and grungy hotel, they have tried to update some things, but the carpets, walls, curtains and similar need renovation.  Breakfast was going bad and cheap for a couple years, they have brought back some nicer items and it seems to be better.  Watch for the very small parking spots, big cars and suv may not fit.

Summary: Stayed here while attending a family event nearby. Location was convenient. Lobby and exterior seemed recently refurbished, but room was not. Had tear in room carpet, but room was spacious and clean. Saturday breakfast at 9:30 am was a zoo. Food was good, but it was packed with people, many of whom would not wait their turn. Service was disorganized for volume of people. We took food back to our room, which was a good choice.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments.  I am sorry that we did not meet your expectations concerning certain aspects of your recent stay with us.  We do strive to provide consistent quality in both product and service and it is vital that we know when we have fallen short of our guests' expectations.  Your comments are being shared with the appropriate  department managers involved so that corrective action can be taken.  Again, thank you for posting your comments.  We hope to have a future opportunity to welcome you back to our property.

Summary: Stayed Sat and Sun nights. Hotel is quite dated. Be prepared for long waits for the breakfast if you arrive after 830am on a weekend morning. There was no wait on Monday morning. Front desk service was very efficient, friendly. We did not use the pool, though we saw many families doing so. Convenient on/off the highway, and convenient to the South Coast Mall (5 mins) and to the Entertainment District in Tustin (5 mins). I would not seek this out again if I planned to come to the area.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments.  I'm sorry that we did not meet your expectations during your recent stay with us. Your comments are being shared with the appropriate department managers here so corrective action can be taken.  Thank you for your recent stay with us and we hope to have an opportunity to serve you again in the near future.

Summary Heading: One of the best Embassy Suites
Summary: A group of business associates stayed for two nighhts for a meeting/training session held at the hotel.  The most impressive element was the level of service.  from the friendly and efficient front desk check in, to the again friendly fwood service ( especially food service in the bar area, where they were doing double duty with drink service, food, and assisting with getting the food ready, to being greeted by all staff-- with a smile-- was a pleasure to stay there.  It is a "traditional" Embassy Suites" with the large lobby and atrium area.  This area was larger than most, with very pleasant and distinctive eating areas around a stream/koi and turtle!! Pond.  Breakfast highlight was the omelette bar which had made to order dishes with a real variety of ingredients.  The
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent stay with us at the Embassy Suites Santa Ana Orange County Airport.  We strive to provide the highest quality in both product and service and are thrilled to hear of your recent experiences at our property.  We continue to make improvements concerning our guest suites and public areas with an emphasis on guest service.  We look forward to welcoming you back to our property in the near future.

Summary Heading: Go just to see the awsomely huge koi !
Summary: Beautiful lobby with a koi pond and some amazing fish. room was very clean....just needed some new light bulbs and the tv remote was missing (and no pay per view movies which is usually my hotel surge) bed very comfortable all of the staff were genuinely friendly and the koi! i'd come back just for the koi!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments concerning your recent stay at our hotel.  Yes, we do have the largest koi in Orange County.  And, don't forget about our turtle population.  We strive to provide consistent quality in both product and service.  We're glad you stayed with us and look forward to welcoming you back to our property in the near future.

Summary: Like in a previous review, the elevators are slow and the rooms have a funky smell when you get in. On the plus side, theres free drinks and food during the managers reception. The breakfast in the morning is passable at best. Seems like the staff has difficulty keeping up with bacon and utensil demand. The only saving grace would be the omelet station. this property does not seem up to the same standard as other embassy suites hotels that ive stayed at previously.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your comments and concerns about your recent stay at our hotel.  I am sorry to hear that we did not meet your expectations in some areas.
