Your comments are being shared with the appropriate department managers involved so corrective action can be taken.

Summary: This was a nice Embassy Suites. Excellent breakfast buffet and managers cocktail hour. The front desk was very helpful. I used the workout facilities daily, nice selection of weights and treadmills. The rooms here are a bit dated, but they are very clean. I would definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to submit your comments about the Embassy Suites Santa Ana.  We're glad you stayed with us and look forward to welcoming you back to our property in the near future.

Summary: This Embassy Suite is very near the airport which is great but the hotel is dark and old.  The rooms are up to date but nothing special.  The customer service was good--almost over the top during breakfast as I was asked too many times if I was done with my plate.  The second day I just had them take it before I was done so I could continue a business discussion with my customer.  Irritating.  The room was a bit noisy but not bad.    Next time I would stay at the Hampton Inn right behind this property.  The darkness of the interior of the hotel was depressing.  The internet was very, very slow and I think this is due to the location of the room in the hotel.  When I complained, they offered to move me to another room but I was checking out in the AM so just put up with it.
Manager Response: I appreciate you taking the time to post your comments.  It is our goal to provide consistent quality in both product and service.  Your comments are being shared with the appropriate department managers involved so we can make the necessary improvements here.  We do hope to have an opportunity to welcome you back to our property.

Summary: I really loved this hotel. The atrium area was beautiful. The room was spacious--yes the furniture in the living room area was a bit old, but everything was clean and comfortable. We did not use the sofa as a sleeper, so I can't comment on that. But the BEDS were outstanding--they seemed rather new and were really plush pillow tops. The bedding was nice and soft with nice fluffy comforters. The bathroom was small, but nice. The breakfast with cooked-to-order omelettes was good and the managers reception was also very nice. Every single employee, from the front-desk to the wait staff to the bartenders was friendly and helpful. There was a nice pool area and workout area. The restaurant would be the only negative. The service was friendly, but very slow and the food wasn't very
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to post your comments regarding your recent stay at our hotel.  We're very glad you stayed with us and always anxious to hear our guest's perspective.  I am sorry that we did not meet your expectations regarding our restaurant but will share your comments with the manager so we can take corrective action.  We look forward to welcoming you back to our hotel in the near future.

Summary: I'm a wheelchair user, so I booked a room with a roll-in shower.  The shower pan in our room was elevated about a half inch, and there was nothing to keep the water in the shower.  Consequently, the water ran out across the bathroom floor and seeped under the bathroom door, soaking the carpet in the bedroom for about a five-foot stretch.  I called for extra towels, and the person at the front desk sounded like they'd been expecting a call.    When we checked out the next morning, I told the desk clerk about it, and he was very nice, but just said that he'd call maintenance to get it dried out.  Then I asked to see the manager, who, I think, dummied up.  He claimed this was the first time he'd ever heard this complaint about that shower, and then he asked me what I wanted him to
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Embassy Suites Santa Ana, CA -- Our Go-to Hotel for Disneyland Visits
Summary: Designed for the business traveler, Embassy Suites, Santa Ana has all the amenities you need minus the crowds.  Pros: easy 10 minute drive to Disneyland, nice indoor pool, workout room with great cardio equipment, computer room with internet access/printers, happy hour drinks/snacks, and fabulous made-to-order breakfast.  Cons:  rooms are fairly dated with very small baths, in-room internet access costs extra, maid service inconsistent or absent on some days, and intermittent problems with the elevators.  Overall, very comfortable and good value.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Hello,  My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites - Santa Ana - Orange County on 4/24/12.  This was one of the worst hotel rooms we have ever stayed in.  The room was dirty, the carpet felt wet. There was mold on the ceiling in the bedroom area. The over all room was dirty. On top of that the floor was uneven. I felt like I was on a ship. On my phone I have a app on my phone of a level and the floor totally slopes towards the middle. The hotel must be aware of this because they placed shims under the dressers front legs to make it level to hold the television. The worst of it was waking up to bumps on my left side of my face all from the disgusting old yellow pillow.  I've stayed at many hotels and again this was by far the worst. For a hotel that was $198 it was for like a
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Not the nicest Embassy Suites ever, but ok for the price.
Summary: It's an embassy suites so you can't really complain but it is probably the oldest embassy suites that I have stayed in and it shows.  The best way to describe the rooms are "heavily used".  The furniture is very old, but clean.  The wallpaper in the bathroom had a few mold spots on it and the carpet was very worn.  They do have the complimentary breakfast and managers happy hour.  The breakfast was above average with a very large selection of food.  They cut corners on the happy hour, chips and salsa every night of my stay and they no longer offer "name brand" spirits, it was all off brand selections.  The elevators are horribly slow and the heating/cooling is a two pipe HVAC system so you don't get to choose between air or heat - you get one or the other depending on the
Manager Response: none

Summary: Stayed here one night while traveling on business (was supposed to stay two but quickly changed those plans upon checking in). Good location close to the freeways and airport and just two miles away from The District, a new shopping/restaurant area (check out The Winery restaurant if you're a wino - great wine selection and good food). The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, the linens were soft (no postage-stamp sized towels) and the bathroom was newly remodeled and clean.  BUT, this hotel (or at least room 514) is in dire need of an upgrade. Had I not arrived at 7 pm with dinner plans that meant I would spend a total of about 6 hours overnight in the room, I would have moved hotels.  The atrium has a funky smell to it, probably because of the mutliple ponds there - nice for
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: We have stayed here many times, the last time was a disappointment
Summary: But this time was better. Last time, my room smelled of mildew, we asked to be moved, same smell as if there had been water damage in the past and mildew was somewhere. This time, just an occasional hint of the smell but huge difference. Last time, breakfast was disappointing. This time, they obviously listened to complaints because breakfast was outstanding. They had TWO omelet stations and added more fruit and a lovely mozzarella, tomato and basil salad which I loved. Afternoon snack time was beefed up as well. An unwelcome surprise was the two $25 holds they placed on my card. Why? I paid with points so room was free, I had NO charges - AND - I only stayed one night? So why a charge on the 14th (check-in) and again on the 15th (check-out)? I hate hotels with these freaking
Manager Response: none

Summary: I used to come here as a child with my parents and it looks...exactly the same. :-/ Rooms need desperate updating. For an ES this wouldnt be top on my list to return to but because of the memories I have there I will probably go back and hopefully will look better soon.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Filthy Hotel, Shocked it is part of the Hilton Brand.
Summary: I stayed at the Embassy Suites on March 28th and was absolutly shocked and disgusted. I challenge any of the staff to sleep one night in thier own hotel. I travel for business 3-4 times a week and am loyal to the Hilton brand.   I checked into my room which is old and out dated with tired furniture, went to take a shower and there was a ring where a bottle of shampoo must of been. I don't know if it was mold or dirt and I am not sure I want to know. And by the way the towels that should be white are grey.  I was supposed to stay for two nights, I checked out the next morning and moved to another Hotel. Summary: Our family has stayed at this hotel several times over the last year. However, our last experience was not that good. We stayed for one night on March 17th, we were in room 536 which had a bad odor and a loud leak in the bedroom. The lack of communications is where my complaints stems from, we checked out at 10:30 on Sunday, March 18th and realized .30 minutes later that our son left his cell phone in the bed. We immediately called the hotel as we were at the Long Beach airport and was transferred to housekeeping. Today is now March 22nd and we have left a total of four messages, two to housekeeping, one for the manager, Kelly and one with Ashley at the front desk. Not one person has returned our calls. Summary: Stayed for one with family for business.  Had issues with room cleanliness.  However, management was quick to respond, and we were satisfied with the result.  The rooms, and the hotel for that matter, are getting older and in need of some refurbishment.  We have stayed here before and generally have a good experience.  The breakfast was not bad, and check out was easy.  If the price is right I would stay here again, but shop around prices do vary.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Less than adequate stay at the Embassy Suites
Summary: Our stay at the Embassy Suites was not what we expected. We had no hot water in our room, the pull out sofa bed was horrible, and the breakfast was the worst we've experienced at an Embassy Suites. Our stay at the hotel was short as we were driving to Palm Desert the next morning. We didn't realize we had no hot water until late in the evening when it was time to go to bed. We had to get up at 6 am so there was no time to have it fixed for our showers. Needless to say, our showers were cold. Our kids slept on the pullout sofa bed. The mattress was beyond old and sloped down so severely that our kids almost slid off a couple of times during the night. The breakfast was not up to par. The omelets were tasteless, and the only fruit they offered was watermelon. We were surprised by
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Warning- Moldy Breakfast and Cold Water Showers
Summary: I am currently staying in another Hilton owned hotel while still paying full price for the room we just left at Embassy Suites in Santa Ana. The room/food and customer service is bad.  When I made the reservation I was told the executive level has a separate lounge with snacks and drinks along with free wifi.  Come to find out this is not true. I tried to call downstairs to get a wake up call. Our phone didn't work correctly using the direct dial buttons to the front desk or any others for that matter.  Our 7am wake up call for Friday happened at 7pm on Thursday thanks to the front desk.  We took a luke warm shower that evening as the water never got hot.  The towels were all stained.   The reason we left was because of what happened this morning.  I got in the shower and it was
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great value, great location, friendly staff, so so cocktail hour
Summary: I'm comparing it to other Embassy Suites I've stayed at... overall a solid 3(and a half) stars! This one had a great location, good parking, great staff, and clean well maintained rooms. The pool was great.   There is some deferred maintenance on exterior paint, sliding balcony doors, carpets etc..but the rooms were great except for AC controls have a mind of their own.  The "Managers Reception"  cocktail time was lack-luster , drinks were ok but all they had for snacks was basic cheese nachos and sad popcorn.  Other locations have had some fruit, cold cuts, cheese, taco bar, cocktail weenies etc...something.  The breakfast was a up to the usual standards, with omelettes to order, and other assorted hot and cold items. Much better than the cocktail snacks. I'd stay there again
Manager Response: none

Summary: Really enjoyed our stay here. All rooms are suites. the kids loved having their own area and room. The full breakfast and made to order omelletes were awesome. Along with the "free' cocktail hour in the evenings. Indoor pool/spa were excellent. All around nice property. centrally located in orange County. Close to disneyland, Angel stadium, beaches and airport. Very reasonable price.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good for a night close to the airport
Summary: I stayed for one night after arriving from across the country.  The hotel has a nice lobby and friendly staff.  My room was standard for Embassy Suites and was well maintained.  It is, however, a little old and in need of some upgrades.  My most significant criticism is that the heat/ac cannot be controlled within the room.  The entire hotel is either on heat or air conditioning.  I'm used to cool temperatures and I wasn't able to get my room quite cool enough without the availability of AC.  Breakfast was the standard Embassy fare.  I went later in the morning and there were no crowds.  The business center was convenient and the exercise room was adequate.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I just spent a week at Embassy Suites and it was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had.  As soon as we checked into our room (early) we noticed that there were balconies on the outside of the hotel, but our room did not have one.  After checking with the front desk we were immediately moved right across the hall to a room with a balcony.  We also requested an electric fan which we always use at home, and they are the first hotel I have ever stayed at that provided one.  The breakfast is phenomenal, five times larger than your run of the mill "continental breakfast".  Everything is cooked to order.  Nice restaurant and bar on site.  The staff was very helpful in every aspect including pointing out local attractions that we might have missed. (special
Manager Response: none

Summary: I do love this hotel. Nice looking hotel good rest. and bar and free breakfast. The rooms are large and spotless. The staff goes out of there way to make sure every person is happy.
Manager Response: none

Summary: Embassy Suites in general is a great place because of the breakfast in AM and drinks at nightafter a long day.  We got this for $107 + room tax and Internet was included.  It was a good value.  Plenty of good local restaurants and the staff was very helpful.  I'd go back in a New York minute !!
Manager Response: none

Summary: Check-in and out was smooth and quick.  Husband and I chose this location for our Disneyland trip to avoid kids and we weren't disappointed.  I think we saw 2 kids all week.  We could've stayed closer to Disneyland, but we wanted peace and quiet once we left the park and that's exactly what we got at the Santa Ana location.   The advertised comp breakfast hours differed from the actual hours, so we called daily to get the actual hours.  On our later mornings, the staff started breaking down the hot food station 30 minutes before the end of breakfast.  This wasn't an issue for us, but I thought it was worth pointing out to later sleepers.  We will stay at this Embassy Suites the next time we go to Disneyland.
Manager Response: none

Summary: We stayed here recently for family gathering/wedding and found the hotel to be a good value with breakfast included and cocktail hour too.  Room was clean (but rather dark).  Amazed at how quiet the room is since the rooms surround atrium where breakfast and cocktails are served.  We heard no noise!  Staff very professional and nice.  (Bar closes early some nights however).  Would stay here again if we return to the area.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Hotel near John Wayne Airport
Summary: I've stayed at the Embassy Suites Santa Ana a lot this year - 40+ nights, so I'm very familiar with this hotel. First, the good. The rooms are large and the beds are comfortable. There are flat screen TV's in both the living room and bedroom, but no pay per view movies. The staff is great. I like the lobby and the atrium. . The happy hour is typical Embassy Suites - not bad but they could mix up the appetizers once in a while. The restaurant is not bad but a little pricy. Parking is usually not difficult. The internet service works well in most rooms, but in some it's a weak signal, particularly in the bedroom. As to the bad, I have just a few complaints. The main thing they need to do is replace their (dark) carpeting. There's a damp smell in many of the rooms. Lighter carpet
Manager Response: none

Summary: I am embarressed to say I choose this property based on rate.  OC can be expensive. I got less than I paid for.  When your done with my review browse the others.  Look for a couple of recurring themes.  Slow elevators, check.  Large rooms, check. Potential for road noise, check. To be fair I didn't experience any odors, never got on the internet but as a Hilton Diamond level customer I can tell you this property misses the mark.  I was disappointed to find so many responses from management saying they will fix this or fix that.  Well at the end of October your elevators still suck.  My Hilton profile asks for a room away from the elevator and you gave me one directly across from an elevator.  Imagine my suprise when I entered the shower in the early morning only to find the

Summary: Had a great trip here, the hotel was really nice inside with nice trees .  The breakfast was a plus and the chefs were really nice. We also enjoyed the managers reception. Would recommend to family and friends
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Older, but kept in good shape
Summary: We needed a hotel for one night while we were traveling to Orange County for a tournament for our sons.  I like to book a 1BD suite for our family of 5 and Embassy suites had a great 1BD suite with 2 queen beds and a pull out couch in the living area.  The breakfast was good, a lot of options and an omelet bar-made to order.  You can tell that it is not a new hotel, but it has a nice decor and was clean.  The beds were comfortable.  The staff is very friendly, however we had called earlier in the day about availability of port-a-cribs for our youngest and we were told that they would put one in our room for us.  It was not there when we arrived, but with one call to the front desk they brought it to us.

Summary Heading: Nastiest Smelling Place in an otherwise Nice area
Summary: Stayed here in Decembe 2010. Rooms were clean/OK but definitely dated. The manager moved me to three different rooms in a span of 24 hours and the odor did not get any better. Unless they install completely new carpet, I will never go back. I think it is a combination of OLD carpet and the type of open construction at the Hotel that promotes the odor.  My recommendation is to try the Doubletree just a couple of miles away.

Summary Heading: Decent stay but not as good as other Embassy Suites
Summary: We arrived around 12:30 on a Saturday and checkin wasn't until 4pm but we thought it doesnt hurt to ask if they had our rooms ready. They did! We opened the patio door to let some fresh air in, but that didn't help at all. We just put our things in the room and headed straight to the beach. Summary: This hotel was so awful. No help at check in at 10:15 pm. We had two very sleepy children on EST . The suite smelled horrible. I think it was a flea spray that was sprayed . We did complain and they said they would try to correct the problem. It did not. The room stayed damp,carpet ,towels etc. Furniture and decor from the 80's. Not at all attractive. Very small bathroom. Would have checked out but returned late first two nights and we were attending family function held at the hotel . Four really unpleasant days and nights. It was so icky. Breakfast very good. Many options,made to order omelets,fresh fruits,pancakes,cereals,yogurt etc. There are so many hotels nearby. Research them all.

Summary: We stayed three nights, staff was helpful, pool was nice. The breakfast was good and similar to most Embassy Suites. I checked trip advisor before I left and saw numerous complaints about the same issue...you'd think they'd do something about it.   They are slooooooooow, sometimes skip you when waiting for one, sometimes going down takes you up. Just terrible...  Besides that here are some other things about the hotel to help you with your decision and travel.  Each room has a balcony, but they very in size depending on where you are on the floor. It is certainly our goal to provide consistent quality in both product and service, and it is vital to our continued success to know when we have fallen short.  I can assure you that every team member here on property takes pride in the cleanlinenss of the hotel and are very concerned in keeping the hotel very clean.  This includes not only a deep cleaning between guests ( each inspected by a Housekeeping Supervisor before releasing as "vacant/ready" at the Front Desk), but a preventatative maintenance and deep cleaning rotation program in place.  After any type of complaint is made the room has to be inspected by the county to  be put back in order.  They did inspect the room and found no such proof of mentioned bugs in the room. Summary: What an attractive lobby!  Waterfalls, koi fish and turtles to enjoy.  We loved the cooked to order breakfast and happy hour. Other wise would definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Great value, gread service and yes, it was clean.

I read several TripAdvisor reviews prior to booking and I was concerned about cleanliness. I question the accuracy of those review, however, because I found this hotel to be extremely clean. It's my understanding that Hiltol holds its management team to very high cleanliness standards. The management team of this property clearly has done a good job of meeting its goal. It was also a bargain price. This may be due to the location, in the shadow of Orange County airport. It's a few miles south of a dicey neighborhood in Santa Ana, but certainly this is a safe area.

If you are sensitive to noise, please note that rooms on the south-east size pick up noise from the interstate and airport.  There is a smell of air freshener throughout the hotel, not atypical for older places like this one. The location is very convenient, about 10 minutes to Disneyland or to Newport beach. Better restaurants are also 5-10 minutes away.  Overall the hotel provided a good value.

The room furnishings were in excellent condition - I must have been staying in a different room than the other reviewers who complained about theirs. Summary: We are a frequent customer of Embassy Suites, and this property is not what we expected. Avoid rooms that face the freeway due to the noise, especially avoid room 711, as the sliding glass door is defective and all freeway traffic noise comes in and kept me from having a peaceful night sleep.    I wedged the door closed with towels and slept with earplugs.  Weight room was an fitness center was outstanding and very clean. Summary Heading: Favorite Embassy Suites in this area

Summary Heading: Some Good, Some Not So Good

I was able to check in by 3:00 which was great since I had to rush to decorate the room and drop off party supplies before picking up the birthday girl and her friends.  However, the connecting door was deadbolted and I had to wait for maintenance to come and unlock the door.  (This was no fault of the hotels, just an FYI, if you book the connecting rooms you can ask for them to be unlocked ahead of time.) If you've never stayed in an embassy suites, you're missing out on a daily hot breakfast, manager's reception in the evening and for this particular location, an indoor pool (a relief from the hot Cali weather). Summary: This hotel is very convenient to the airport, with no airport noise. While located in a somewhat busy upscale office area, it works well as a suburban hotel. Quality meets Embassy Suite standards. Rooms are clean and very well maintained. The expansive atrium is always a visual refreshment.   Only complaints? Two things - first, the parking garage does not have a direct access into the hotel, so there is some navigating of luggage around the parking gates, a pull up some stairs and a bit of awkward maneuvering through some non-automated side doors - if, that is, you don't unload first at the main lobby doors.   Second, the breakfast is very good, but each order is individually prepared and served by standing in a line while two cooks prepare and serve your custom order.

Summary: This place was great.  We arrived around 3:30 p.m. and a room was waiting for us. We were given a room on the 2nd floor which had a huge concrete balcony that was very enjoyable.  (Get a room on the 2nd floor if possible as they all had huge balconies).  Room was very clean and comfortable.  Managers reception was a nice touch and the free breakfast was delicious with a ton of choices.  We ordered room service and it arrived within 20 minutes and the food was very good.  Checkout was  no problem.  I would most definitely stay here again.

Summary: My husband and I received a complimentary overnight stay at the Embassy Suites through a local fundraiser.  I'm happy to say that the hotel has been fully renovated as of September 2006 and although my stay was brief, I didn't have any of the problems mentioned in previous postings.  The most appreciated  improvements were to the bathrooms--Neutrogena products, granite countertops and shower area with a convex curtain rod to give a little more elbow room (so you don't have to deal with sticking to a wet shower curtain). Summary: This hotel is WONDERFUL!! The breakfast it has in the morning is wonderful and yummy.  They have everything you want offered from pancakes to cereal and hot chocolate.  It is nicely kept up and the lobby is gorgeous.  In the atrium, you eat breakfast and there are huge fish in the ponds which are extremely fun to look at.  One of the best features it has is location.  It only took us ten minutes to get to disneyland, 5 minutes to newport beach and 20 to long beach.
